loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school, Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional firewood to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in yucca, plantains, green bananas, potatoes, corn, and loose onions to sell to his customers.

loans.name: 031407050003.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Vinh is 63 years old, married, and has one child. She lives with no dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture raising poultry, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. 

Vinh requested her fifth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she will use to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. In 2011, she joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She is the leader of the 031407050003.thiệu Khánh Group, which consists of three members.

In the future, Vinh hopes that she maintains a successful business and is able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo un homme de 57ans est cultivateur de profession. Il a pour femme une couturière et 05 enfants en charge.  Il exerce son activité à ANEHO et demande un prêt pour acheter des intrants. Il souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: Kodjo, a man of 57 years old, is a farmer. His wife is a seamstress, and he supports five children. He does his farming at Aneho and is asking for a loan to buy inputs. He would like to expand his farming business and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: 031408010002.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Minh is applying for a loan to purchase more seeds and supplies to plant vegetables for sale. She works in agriculture growing vegetables. Minh is 41 years old and she is married with three children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 031408010002.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group. Minh lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Minh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Minh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and supplies to plant vegetables for sale

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон мужчина 23 лет, женат, молодой отец двоих детей. Он вырос в семье рабочих и с детства знает сложности жизни. Олимчон закончив 9 классов школы, поступил в техническое училище и обучился слесарному мастерству. В возрасте 18 лет Олимчон женился. Сейчас у него двое прекрасных детей. Жена Олимчона не имеет образования, поэтому получить хорошую работу она не в состоянии. Поэтому Олимчон кроме работы слесарем, начал заниматься животноводством. Сейчас у него в стаде 10 баранов. Каждый день Олимчон пасет свое стадо на поле. Олимчон откормив баранов, продает их и вместо них покупает молодых. Так и идёт его бизнес. В настоящее время Олимчон хочет закупить корм для скота. Но у него нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за получением кредита. Олимчон надеется и благодарит за доверие.
texts.en: Olimjon is a 23-year-old man. He is married and a young father of two children. He grew up in a working class family and has known life's difficulties since his childhood. Olimjon completed nine years of school then enrolled in a technical college and studied plumbing skills. Olimjon got married at 18 years of age. Now he has two wonderful children. Olimjon's wife does not have an education, and so she is not able to get a good job. Because of this, in addition to working as a plumber Olimjon began rearing animals. Now he has ten sheep in his flock. Every day Olimjon tends to his flock in the fields. When Olimjon has fattened up the sheep, he sells them and buys young ones in their place. That is how his business goes. Currently Olimjon wants to buy feed for his livestock but he does not have enough money. He has therefore applied to MDO Arvand to receive a loan. Olimjon is hopeful and is grateful for your trust.

loans.use: to increase the size of his flock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various items for resale.

loans.name: 031409280001.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Hằng is applying for a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. She operates a food stall/restaurant, selling vegetables. Hằng has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hằng is 37 years old, and she is married with one child. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hằng joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hằng has successfully repaid four loans from the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the leader of a six-member group, the 031409280001.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group. 

In the future, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: 20 Phú Nhi Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mến works in agriculture, raising poultry. Mến has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. This is Mến first loan with the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Mến is the group leader of the 20 Phú Nhi Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Mến is 33 years old, and she is married with three children. With her business profit, Mến hopes to buy a motorbike, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Thôn 3 Quảng Giao Group

texts.en:
Huân is applying for a loan to purchase baby cows to raise and sell in future. She works in agriculture, raising cows. Huân is 51 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 09 Thôn 3 Quảng Giao solidarity group. Huân supports no dependents with her business in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Huân joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Huân has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Huân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Huân hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby cows to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 47 years old and has four children. Lolita is married, and one of her children is in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lolita has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang is the head of Gayatri Indah group. She is a housewife and she works to support her family's needs. Her husband works as a farmer. Her primary job is as staff member in a high school, but she’s also raising pigs at home. Although the price for pigs is getting lower than before and the feed price is still high, Ni Komang continues to pursue this business, together with other members of the Gayatri Indah group.

After making the repayment for the last loan, the Gayatri Indah group is proposing a new loan. One member stopped borrowing because she had to move to the city. Her husband had a new job there. She said she was grateful for the loan support, especially the training from MUK staff. She will continue her business in her new place. She was replaced by a new member. 

Now with the same loan size, they will use the loan to increase the pig population, renovate the cages, and buy feed and some vitamins. Ni Komang will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior piglets, renovate the cage, and buy feed. She is optimistic that the business will grow and she will earn a satisfactory profit. Her dream is to have enough savings so that she can continue the business with her own money.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets, renovate the cage, and buy feed

loans.name: 031408020002.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bê has a small store where she sells coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to maintain her store (small bar with coffee, tea, soft drinks, fast food, etc.).

Bê is 61 years old, married, and has six children. She is the group leader of the 031408020002.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Bê joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Bê has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Bê hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to maintain her store

loans.name: Hannah Jean

texts.en:
Hannah Jean is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Hannah Jean dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Levita

texts.en:
Levita is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Levita is 56 years old now.

Levita has a business selling personal care products in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like lotion, etc.

Levita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Levita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like lotion, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. Virginia is married and has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of fruits to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruits to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 49 years old and married with five children. One of her children is in school, and Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

Nilda has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, school supplies, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, vegetable oil, ketchup, mayonnaise and fruits.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thắng Phúc Ngư Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Điều has a retail business selling cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. Điều has been involved in this business for three years.

The main hardship that Điều faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc., to resell.

Điều is 55 years old, and she is married with five children.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 01 Thắng Phúc Ngư Lộc solidarity group. 

This is Điều's first loan with the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Along with her business profit, Điều hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar and milk to resell

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year-old Julita engages in selling snack food like turon (consisting of a deep-fried banana in a spring roll wrapper coated in sugar), home meals, and polvoron (a semi-sweet concoction made of toasted flour, powdered milk, sugar, and butter). She is married with 2 grown children. She also weaves and sells native baskets. She is in need of funds to support her ongoing livelihood.

Julita  is asking for a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy materials for weaving baskets and additional capital for food vending. These tools are essential to augmenting her sources of income: she will be able to produce more baskets and start to prepare more varieties of food to be sold. 

 With the additional capital, she is doing her best to manage her both businesses successfully and hopes to become sustainable in the near future.

loans.use: to buy materials for weaving baskets and additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 36 years old and has five children. Rosario is married, and three of her children are in school.

Rosario is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosario has been in this business for 12 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ma. Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Ma. Editha works hard to support her family.

She has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Editha is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit of computer for her business.

Ma. Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Paula De Jesus

texts.es: Paula una mujer de 54 años de edad es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijas una de 16 años y la menor de 8 años de edad a las que apoya para que estudien. Paula ha logrado instalar en su vivienda una tienda de productos básicos, la cual le permite sostener la economía de su hogar y estar pendiente de sus hijas. Ella desea invertir en su tienda, ya que sabe que entre más productos tiene mejores son sus ventas y ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: azúcar, frijoles, arroz, cereales, aceite, huevos, refrescos, leche, bebidas frías,  etc., para surtir su tienda y así de esta manera ella obtener más ganancias y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijas y tener un mejor futuro para ellas.
texts.en:
Paula, age 54, is a single mother.  She lives with her two daughters.  One is 16, and the younger is 8.  She supports their education.

Paula has managed to install a basic products store at her house.  The store allows her to support her household and to take care of her daughters.

She wishes to invest in her store because she knows that with more products she has more sales and earnings.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy sugar, beans, rice, grains, cooking oil, eggs, soft drinks, milk, and cold drinks, etc.  She will do this in order to stock her store.  This way she will get more earnings and improve the quality of life for her daughters, and they will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, rice, grains, cooking oil, eggs, soft drinks, milk, and cold drinks, etc. to stock her store.

loans.name: 07 Tân Lộc Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thương works in marine aquaculture. Thương has been involved in this business for four years. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to raise marine life for sale.

Thương is 42 years old, and she is married with three children.

This is Thương's first loan with the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Thương is the group leader of the 07 Tân Lộc Hải Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Along with her business profit, Thương hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to raise marine aquaculture for sale

loans.name: Griselda Marisel

texts.es: Griselda de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de cereales y perfumería su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, clienta tiene 6 años de dedicarse a las ventas, la cual ha ido mejorando con el tiempo y a podido generar buenos ingresos, vende sus productos durante todo el año, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería todo por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Griselda is 37 years old. She owns a house where she lives with her family. She sells cereals and perfumes at the municipal market. She has been in business for six years. She has improved with time and has made good profits. She sells her products all year round.

Griselda is requesting a loan to buy more products in bulk in order to be able to continue selling and improve her and her family’s living quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cereals and perfumes in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, buttons and zippers all wholesale.

loans.name: Solimar

texts.en:
Solimar works hard to support her family. Solimar is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like cloth, tailoring chalk, etc.

Solimar has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Solimar would like to build and expand her business to secure the finances of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like cloth, tailoring chalk, etc.

loans.name: Necel

texts.en:
Necel is 25 years old, married, and has one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Necel has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Necel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

In the future, Necel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Sandra Enesifora

texts.es:
Sandra, con el apoyo que ha recibido de Padecomsm y los inversionistas Kiva ha mantenido su negocio de venta de tortillas y ha iniciado a vender comida y generando ingresos para que en su hogar su familia tenga una vida más digna.
Nuevamente necesita de un crédito para poder comprar maíz, verduras, carnes, aceite, especias, leña, etc.,  tendrá materia prima para continuar vendiendo tortillas y comida, espera que seguir contando con las demandas que hasta hoy tiene.
texts.en:
With the support she has received from Padecomsm and Kiva lenders, Sandra has kept up her business selling tortillas and started selling other foods, generating more income so at home her family can have a better life. 
She needs a new loan to purchase corn, vegetables, meats, oil, spices, firewood etc. so she will have the raw materials to keep selling tortillas and other foods. She hopes she will continue to have the demand she has had up until now.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, meats, oil, spices, firewood, and other raw materials to continue selling tortillas and food

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara es una mujer de 55 años de edad habita en casa propia desde hace 20 años, por lo que se siente feliz ya que sabe que sus esfuerzos por construirla tienen su fruto. Sara se gana la vida en un hogar de niños prestando servicios domésticos, ella se siente bendecida con su trabajo, pues gracias a este ha podido sostenerse económicamente, pero últimamente el costo de los insumos básicos, energía eléctrica, agua le ha afectado económicamente, es por esto que hace un año ella comenzó a vender ropa para adultos y niños en su comunidad esto lo realiza los fines de semana camina por las calles de su comunidad mostrando sus producto sus clientes viendo la calidad y bajos precios de sus productos la han preferido, por lo que la demanda de su negocio ha crecido es por eso que ella está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: faldas, medias, blusas, pantalones y vestidos así ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, sabe que con esto logrará tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejoraran sus ingresos económicos, comprometiéndose a cumplir con las cuotas que el crédito amerita.
texts.en:
Sara is a 55 year-old woman. She has lived in her own home for the last 20 years.This pleases her, since she sees the fruits of her labor in having built it. 

Sara earns her living as a domestic aide in a children’s home. She feels blessed by her work, and thanks to it she has been able to support herself financially, but lately the cost of basic supplies, electricity and water have affected her financially. 

This is why she has begun to sell clothing for adults and children in her community. She does this on weekends, walking through her community showing her products. Her customers notice her quality and low prices, and demand for her business has grown as a result. 

Because of this, she is seeking a loan from FUSAI to invest in skirts, stockings, blouses, pants and dresses and thus offer a greater variety to her customers. She knows that with this she will be able to have a better quality of life and improve her income. She promises to keep up with the payments on the loan that is awarded to her.

loans.use: To buy skirts, stockings, blouses, pants and dresses in order to offer her customers greater variety.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Tây Hòa Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hai is 53 years old, married, and has three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 01 Tây Hòa Hưng Lộc solidarity group. 

Hai works in agriculture, raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for eight years.

In 2011, Hai joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hai has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

The main hardship that Hai faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

Hai hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Đông Hòa Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thủy has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to resell.

Thủy is 31 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Đông Hòa Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

In 2013, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Thủy has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Thủy has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 46 years old, married, and has three children to provide for. To earn a living she is engaged in a sari-sari store business to provide her family needs. She and her husband want to increase their income for their children's needs. So she decided to take a loan at GDMPC to purchase goods for resale and increase her store inventory to make more sales, resulting in increased income.

Arlene's plan for the future is to save money from her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 64 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full pledge member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase gardening tools, fertilizers, pots and flower seedlings. In the future, Luz wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase gardening tools, fertilizers, pots and flower seedlings.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita is 44 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school, Lelita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.  

Letita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Lelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 42 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Ana has borrowed and paid back three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mailyn requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, sugar, noodles, and other personal care products.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Mailyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, sugar, noodles, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 51 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school.

She provides for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Paulina has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Herminda

texts.en:
Herminda is 55 years old and married with three children. 

Herminda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Herminda has been in the pig fattening business for 3 years, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Herminda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Bernarda

texts.es:
María, tiene una venta de frutas y verduras, vive sola con su esposo de 51 años de edad, juntos comparten su día a adía y también sus responsabilidades en el hogar, no tiene familiares en el extranjero que le ayuden económicamente; el negocio lo atiende desde hace más de dos años, aprendió a administrar este tipo de actividad con el apoyo de amistades.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar güisquiles, papayas, papas, pepinos, lechugas, etc., para tener debidamente surtido su negocio y atender mejor a sus clientes, espera que su clientela aumente y pueda tener mejores ingresos.
El objetivo de trabajar con créditos es fortalecer su negocio y cancelar su deuda con buena calificación crediticia.
texts.en:
María has a business selling vegetables and fruit. She is 51 years old and lives alone with her husband. They share their day to day life and also the household responsibilities. They don't have family members abroad to help them economically.

She has had the business for more than two years. She learned to manage this type of business with the help of acquaintances. She needs the loan to buy chayote, papayas, potatoes, cucumber, lettuce etc. to properly stock her business and serve her clients better. She hopes that her clients increase and she can have more income. The goal of working with loans is to strengthen her business and pay off her debt with a good credit rating.

loans.use: to buy chayote, papayas, potatoes, cucumber, lettuce etc. to properly stock her business.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Jovita dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Jurinda

texts.en:
Jurinda is 27 years old and married with three children.

Jurinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, candies, biscuits, beers, etc. to sell.

Jurinda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jurinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, candies, biscuits, and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Naga Tegal Wangi Group

texts.en:
The Naga Tegal Wangi group received its seventh loan from MUK. Ni Made, head of the group, managed the loan wisely. Repayment of the loan was done on time under her supervision. Ni Made sold her piglets at a satisfactory price after keeping them for six months. Two members decided to resign after they had enough saving to continue the pigs business with their own money.

Ni Made is very grateful for the benefits she earned and she thanks lenders for their support. For electricity and water, Ni Made spends 200,000 IDR per month.

The Naga Tegal Wangi group now receives a new loan. The group expected an increased amount, but after an evaluation from MUK’s staff, the group still received the same loan amount.

Ni Made already has two sows and she will use her portion of the loan to purchase super quality feed only. She must protect the health of her sows. Ni Made is a piglets seller in her village and also a farmer. She uses pig manure as a fertilizer in her garden. 

One sow can give birth to 8 to 12 piglets. She hopes the sows can give birth safely and the piglets can grow healthy. She sell the piglets for fattening or pig barbeque. She has a plan to save all the profit and use it for business capital later.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed.

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito is a 45-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Balatacan, Tangub, industriously caring for his fishing activities. He is married and has 3 children. Angelito personally takes charge of his business and is doing well. From his daily sales, he has saved an amount and was able to buy fishing boat engine.

Now, Angelito sees a good opportunity to expand his business. He is requesting PHP 35,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories and pay for materials to complete his fishing boat. He deeply wishes for a good education for his kids and for them to have businesses on their own.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories and pay for materials to complete his fishing boat

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina is a 59-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Sindangan, industriously caring for her fishing activities.  She is married and has 7 children.  She personally takes charge of their business, and their children work for them as support. The business is doing well.  Esterlina has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business is nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. She is a savvy business woman. 

Now, Esterlina sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting PHP 10,000 from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy additional nets and fishing accessories. She deeply wishes for a good and healthy life for all of those in the family.

loans.use: to buy additional nets and fishing accessories

location.town: Sindangan - Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda earns through retailing various sea food like shells and sea weeds. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurances and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for a variety of shells and sea weeds for resale. She is on her way to repaying her loan from her earnings. She hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for a variety of shells and sea weeds for resale.

location.town: SINDANGAN-TAMIL, JOSE DALMAN, ZAMBONGA DEL NORTE

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a 69-year-old married woman with 12 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelly has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Nelly requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

In the future, Nelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is married and works hard to support her family. Maria Fe has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Maria Fe has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Maria Fe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Luz works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from personal products retail. Ma. Luz is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from buying and selling crab.

Gina is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy pig feed and materials to build a pig pen.

Gina dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to set up a new business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and materials to build a pig pen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Carla Ines

texts.es:
Carla es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos generales. 
Ella es emprendedora, optimista, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en distintas zonas de la ciudad como la ‘Ceja’ y la ‘feria 16 de julio’; que son comerciales y están ubicadas al lado este, aquí se agrupan los edificios administrativos, comerciales y sedes de organizaciones sociales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Carla es de tez morena, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello largo negro lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y en el comercio mayormente habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que trabaja como comerciante y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas natural y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos generales, como; ollas, pañales, bebidas, etc., actividad que realiza de forma ambulante empujado un carrito de dos ruedas donde almacena la mercadería. Una vez cada cierto tiempo, ella viaja con su esposo a comprar mercadería a la fronteras con Perú y también con Argentina, para obtener productos novedosos y comerciales, “con mi pareja y mi niño viajamos constantemente a traer productos de temporada, los vendemos y viajamos de nuevo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede cuidar a su hijo y trabajar, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar mercadería y abastecer a sus clientes. Su sueño es abrir una empresa distribuidora para realizar ventas por mayor, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra por mayor de mercadería de temporada como; chamarras, vinos, frutos secos, y otros, porque existe demanda de esos productos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Carla solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería de temporada y con los beneficios pagar los gastos preescolares de su hijo.
texts.en:
Carla is a 22-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has a 4-year-old son. She works selling different products. Carla is an optimistic, energetic, compromised, generous, kind, responsible and hardworking woman. She works as a street vendor in different areas, such as “La Ceja” and “Feria 16 de Julio”, which are commercial areas located in the eastern side of the city. There are different administrative and commercial buildings, as well as social organizations in this area. The city has cold weather, with temperatures that range between 0 and 12 °C [32-54 °F].

Carla has a dark complexion and brown eyes, and wears glasses. She wears her long black hair tied in the back. She is short and thin. Her mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken by locals. However, she mainly speaks Spanish at work. She lives together with her husband, who works as a salesman, and her son, who is not yet of school age. They rent a room built with bricks and cement, with a metal roof and wooden floor. It is served with drinking water, electricity, natural gas and sewage.

Carla sells different products, such as pots, diapers, and beverages. She works as a street vendor and pushes a cart to transport and sell her products. Every once in a while, she and her husband travel to the borders with Peru or Argentina in search for innovative and easy-to-sell products. “I travel regularly with my partner and my son to bring seasonal products. We sell them and then travel again,” she says. The advantage of having this business is that she can take care of her son and work at the same time. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy more products and fulfill the customers’ needs. Her dream is to open a store and sell products in bulk.

Carla would like to expand her business by buying seasonal products in bulk, such as jackets, wine, and dried fruits, which are highly-demanded products. This is the first loan she receives from the institution, but she has been in business for two years.

This is why Carla is requesting a loan to buy seasonal products and use the profits to pay her son’s kindergarten fees.

loans.use: to buy seasonal products such as jackets, wine and dried fruits, and with the profits pay for his son's kindergarten fees.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Wilma dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 51 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Lucila works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Lucila has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Lucila would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 43 years old and has five children. Antonieta is separated and has one child who is still in school.

Antonieta is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Antonieta has been raising pigs for 2 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Antonieta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 49 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school, Elenita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like chips, milk, sugar, bread, etc.

Elenita has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Elenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like chips, milk, sugar, bread, etc.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 72-year-old, married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Sofia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sofia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Sofia has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Sofia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with four children. She earns a living by selling seafood in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her general store and her plastic-wares business.

She is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

Ruth dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is a 43 years old and married. She has one child. To earn a living, she has had a vegetable garden for 10 years already and it is a good business for the family because it is profitable. They earn PHP 2,000 a month which helps them in their daily family needs. Juvelyn sells the vegetables to the market from her garden. She aims to have a higher income for her family so she decided to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the vegetable garden to be able to produce a good vegetable harvest.

Juvelyn's plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle for delivery of her vegetables to the market.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: 031303030002.thiệu Đô Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Đông  works in agriculture raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

Đông  is 46 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 031303030002.Thiệu Đô solidarity group. Đông  lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Đông  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Đông  has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đông  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Đông  faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Đông  hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dress making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

Virginia has been in this business for 1 year. Virginia earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from tailoring. Editha is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Maria Liezel

texts.en:
Maria Liezel is single and has a buy and sell religious articles business in the Philippines.

Maria Liezel requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more religious items like rosaries, candles, novena notes, etc. to sell.

Maria Liezel has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Maria Liezel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more religious items like rosaries, candles, novena notes, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. Jenelyn is married and has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is single and 25 years old. She is a good daughter to her parents because she finds a way to earn income to help her parents with their family needs. She is engaged in a food stall business. She cooks from a menu and sells food to the community. She wants to earn a higher income and be able to help her parents pay for their maintenance medication, so she decided to purchase additional ingredients to generate more income.

Jennifer plans in the future to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients to make food and sell

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets, bamboo, binder, and other fishing equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Denia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, bamboo, binder, and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Tam's Group

texts.en:
Tam is 46 years old, married, and has one adult child. They live in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family lives mainly based on the cultivation of coffee. Each year they earn 30 to 40 million VND from harvesting more than one hectare of coffee. This income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and a small amount of savings. 

Tam wants to buy fertilizer to for the coming crop but her savings are not enough. She requested a loan from M7 Microfinance Institution Limited, which she will use to buy fertilizer for the coming crop of coffee. She will work hard to repay the loan on time. She hopes that the loan will help her family invest effectively with high productivity to double the last year's crop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Rufatjon

texts.en:
Rufatjon is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1985. He is living in a rural area with his family. He is married and has three children. He has ten year of experience doing business in agriculture. 

In spite of less opportunity for working in the rural area, he tries his best to do business efficiently to feed his family. There are good conditions for keeping livestock and planting agricultural products. He is a goal oriented, responsible, and kind person who ensures his family only by doing agriculture. 

He appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant new plantings for the coming season. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant new plantings for the coming season

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es: En sus confecciones de ropa femenina, Zunilda cuenta con seis años de experiencia en esta actividad, esta emprendedora mujer decidió tomar clases de confección para luego poder ofrecer prendas de vestir con excelente diseño y calidad.  Ella tiene 46 años de edad y es madre de nueve hijos aún tres son menores de edad, reside en una urbanización ubicada en el municipio de Barranquilla, en donde funciona su negocio y sus principales clientes son vecinos y conocidos, a principios de año cuando va a iniciar la temporada escolar elabora uniformes para instituciones académicas. Zunilda elabora blusas, pantalones, faldas y vestidos para damas, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en telas, botones, hilos, y accesorios para elaborar pantalones y vestidos. Ella considera que esta   inversión que permitirá aumentar la capacidad de producción y las ventas.  Su meta a futuro es adecuar su apartamento para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: In her tailoring of female clothing, Zunilda has six years of experience. This entrepreneurial woman decided to take dress-making classes to later be able to offer garments of excellent design and quality. She is 46-years-old and is the mother of nine children, three of whom are still minors. She lives in an urbanization located in the municipality of Barranquilla, where she runs her business, and her main clients are her neighbors and acquaintances. At the beginning of the year, when the school season is about to begin, she makes uniforms for academic institutions. Zunilda makes blouses, pants, skirts, and dresses for women. She is applying for a credikiva, the first financing she has with the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in fabric, buttons, thread, and accessories to make pants and dresses. She thinks that this investment will allow her to increase her production capacity and her sales. Her goal in the future is to fix her apartment to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in fabric, buttons, thread, and accessories to make pants and dresses.

loans.name: Alonsa

texts.en:
Alonsa is 49 years old and widowed with five children.  With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Alonsa has been in this business for 28 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Milcah, who is fifty eight years old, married, and a mother of four. All her children are in school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She does maize and beans farming as her main business. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's training on enterprise and financial management as she acquired skills in budgeting and record keeping. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality fertilizer so that she can increase her output. This will assist her to cater for the family needs such as paying school fees. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will increase farm output and thus more income to cater for family needs such as school fees.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is the responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her brother has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for ten years. Her brother is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her brother needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her brother is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Robina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Robina's brother can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Robina  also plans to make savings with the profit from her brother's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Robina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her brother to repair his taxi

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is the responsible mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Shabana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shabana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Shabana  also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Shabana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to repair his taxi

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 63 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She  sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, and other groceries.  

Erlinda requested a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jose Abdul

texts.es:
José, práctica el cultivo de granos básicos y tiene un taller de estructuras metálicas, el negocio lo desempeña de lunes de sábado, aprendió a trabajar en la tierra con el apoyo de su padre y luego asistió a capacitaciones, ya cuenta con 6 años de experiencia.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas preparar la tierra en la que sembrará granos básicos, así mismo comprara materias para equipar mejor su taller, espera tener los recursos necesarios para continuar trabajando y beneficiarse con mejores ingresos.
Sueña con adquirir experiencia en el uso de créditos, tener un negocio más estable y darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida facilitándoles mejor alimentación, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
José grows cereals and owns a workshop where he paints metal structures. He works Monday to Saturday. He learned from his father to work the land. He received additional training and has now a 6-year experience.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies to prepare the land in which he will sow cereals. He will also buy raw materials to better equip his workshop. He hopes to have enough resources to continue working and improve his income.

His dream is to learn how to manage these loans adequately, have a more stable business, and improve his family’s living conditions by providing them with better food, clothes and education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and raw materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Thien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thien, 53, has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since January 1995. Her family consists of six members, including her husband, her son, her daughter-in-law, and two children of her son. Her family currently lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is agricultural production, so the annual income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses, and they can still save a small amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for the next coffee crop but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to request a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in agriculture production, and the next crop will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
Ibrohim is a handsome man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1993. He lives in a village and comes to the city to get a higher education. He is married and lives with parents. Ibrohim was born in village where agriculture is the most common business. He is an older child in their family and helps his parents with their activities. They live in a big family and work with livestock and plant vegetables and fruits. 

When he studied at school, after classes he always helped his parents with their business. His parents wished for their son be educated and wanted him to enter university. After graduating with excellence from secondary school he entered the university with his knowledge. He prepared before entering. 

The family's income is spent on needs such as food and clothing. His parents do not have enough money to pay his tuition fees at the university. He decided to appeal to IMON and ask for a loan to pay his higher education costs. He hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Her name is Myra, 39. She is a  resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines, and married to Rolando, a driver. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs.

Myra operates a small variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from her grocery items she also sells fruits and veggies for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 800 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items and pay for papaya, pineapple, eggplant, bananas, etc., to better serve her customers. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and the good return on her investment for it will surely cover their daily sustenance.

Myra aims to sustain and grow a bigger general store. She prays that God will prosper them materially and spiritually and that she can have a deeper relationship with God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fruits and veggies and other grocery items to sell at her small general store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Cecilia works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines and also earns income from fattening pigs. Cecilia is borrowing 9,500 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru: Сухробчон добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 38 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Со своей семьёй Сухробчон живут в сельском посёлке. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Сухробчон занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении 5 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур, Затем, когда собирает урожай, вывозит на большой базар и там продаёт свой урожай. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. Также он работает таксистом, как дополнительный доход. У него имеется несколько голов скота, которых он выращивает для дальнейшей продажи. Но сейчас Сухробчон хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультур. Но сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для покупки минеральных удобрений Сухробчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Suhrobjon is a kind-hearted and hard-working 38-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Suhrobjon and his family live in a rural village. Suhrobjon runs a business in order to have an income to live on. He has been growing crops for the last five years, then when he gathers the harvest he takes it to a big market and sells it. Previously he used to work on a mid-sized farm and then decided to sell his own harvest. He also works as a taxi driver to get extra income. He has a few livestock that he is rearing for resale in the future. But now Suhrobjon wants to specifically to expand his business crop growing business. He does not have enough of his own money at the moment to buy artificial fertilizer, so he has applied to Arvand and wants to take a loan. Suhrobjon really hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat, age 40, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Her husband needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery material to resell. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally.

 However due to lack of money he finds it difficult.  For that reason, his wife, Asmat, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband.

Her husband will purchase an embroidery machine and new varieties of embroidery materials. Asmat is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his embroidery business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant activity.

loans.name: Shaida

texts.en:
Shaida is 37 years old woman and a mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband runs a hotel (restaurant). He sells different types of dishes such as chicken karahi, daals, chicken tikka, and kabab. Her husband is the only family member responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shaida's husband needs to purchase different types of ingredients and other items for his business so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profits. But due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase these items for his business. Therefore Shaida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband expand his restaurant business

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina, at the age of 57, is a mother of five children. She engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn a living, with the help of her husband who drives their own motorcycle to cater for passengers. 

She aims for a greater income. That's why she took a loan again to purchase goods to sell to increase her store inventory and to generate more income.

Felina's plan for the future is to save money from her business.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Chua's Group

texts.en:
Chua is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently is living with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s income is mainly from her husband’s meager civil servant salary. Because the couple has to care and pay for their children’s education, the remaining income is not much. 

To get additional income for the family, the couple have discussed and agreed to invest in expanding the goat breeding model to get meat to sell to the market as it can bring them a good income. They don’t have enough money, so they want to borrow a loan for this purpose.
 
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time, and hopes that the loan will help her family invest in breeding effectively with high productivity and that it will bring her family a considerable profit next year.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the goat breeding model

loans.name: Nerilyn

texts.en:
Nerilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Nerilyn has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from pig raising.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en:
Hanh is a Kinh ethnic woman. Her family has four members, including her husband and her two lovely daughters. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is from cultivation, so the income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount. 

She wants to buy additional fertilizer to fertilize for the longan tree garden and the coffee garden but the saved amount of money is not enough to buy fertilizer. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes the loan will help her family invest well in the longan and coffee garden, and that the longan trees and coffee trees will be laden with fruits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Dien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dien, born in 1988, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and animal breeding. Her family has 7,000 square meters of land for coffee with the annual income of VND 40-50 million, but the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount. 

She wants to buy fertilizer for the coming coffee crop but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to take a loan to buy fertilizer for the coffee.

She hopes that the loan will help her family have money to invest more in the coffee field, and then the coffee field will bring her family a yield half as much again as the last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Balitwewunya Group

texts.en: Balitwewunya Group is located in Sserubona B Kituntu sub-county, Mpigi district. The group is headed by Sarah. The dominant activity carried out by the members is agriculture, growing passion fruit. The members requested loans, which they will use to buy fertilizers and to expand the area under cultivation. They are hard working and passionate with a dream of improving their household income through continuous production.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Marlaine

texts.en:
Marlaine is 34 years old and married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pig in the Philippines. Marlaine requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Marlaine has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Vinh's Group

texts.en:
Vinh, born in 1988, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has four members, including her husband, her daughter, her son, and her. They are living in Mai Son district, Son La province.
	
Her family’s main income is from her meager salary so the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expense and save a small amount. 

She intends to build sanitary works (latrine) for her house but the saved amount is not enough to buy materials. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan  will help her family have a tidy sanitary work (latrine); every member of the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to build sanitary works (latrine)

loans.name: Phuong's Group

texts.en:
Phuong, born in 1977, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family has five members, including her husband, her three daughters, and her. Her daughters are obedient and good at studying. Her family is currently living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is animal breeding and cultivation. The annual income from harvesting the coffee is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount. 

She wants to buy fertilizer for the coming coffee crop but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time, and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family have money to invest effectively at high productivity in the coffee with the yield double that of the last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.ru: Мукаддам женщина 35 лет, замужем, мать двоих детей. Она выросла в сельской местности, закончила школу и в 18 лет вышла замуж. Она живет с родителями мужа и с двумя детьми. Муж Мукаддам работает мастером. Сама Мукаддам занимается животноводством. У нее 10 баранов и 3 козы. Молоко коз после дойки Мукаддам относит на рынок для продажи. Оно быстро скупается. Баранов она откармливает и продаёт. Мукаддам со своим мужем работает день и ночь, чтобы обеспечить своих детей. Чтобы они не были голодными. Она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Она хочет купить еще одного барана и корм для скота. Но у нее нет полной суммы денег. Она надеется, что МДО Арванд выделит ей нужную сумму. Благодарит за поддержку в трудные времена.
texts.en:
Mukaddam is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. She grew up in a rural area, finished high school and got married at 18. She lives with her husband's parents and her two children. Her husband works as a foreman and she works in animal husbandry. She has 10 rams and three goats. She milks the goats and sells their milk at the market. It sells out quickly. She fattens the rams and then sells them.

Mukaddam and her husband work day and night to provide for their children so they don't go hungry. She has approached Arvand for financial support because she wants to buy one more ram and livestock feed, but she doesn't have enough of her own money. She hopes that Arvand will offer her the necessary amount and she expresses her thanks for support during difficult times.

loans.use: to purchase a ram and livestock feed

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung, born in 1984, is a Thai ethnic woman currently living with her husband, her son, and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding, so the annual income from sugar cane, corn tree, and pig breeding is about VND 50 to 60 million. But, after deducting all costs, the remaining income is just enough to cover the living expenses and save a small amount. 

However, the saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the coming crop of sugar cane and corn. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have money to care for the coming crop well, and it will bring her family with a yield twice as big as the last year. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru:
Курбонгул молодая и начинающая бизнес-леди. Ей 27 лет. Она развелась мужем, две маленькие дети. Курбонгул хочет начать свой бизнес по купле и продаже крупнорогатых скотов. Она, несмотря на свой юный возраст и не большой опыт работы не боится начать свой бизнес. Потому что большая часть жителей района Шахритус занимаются животноводством. И Курбонгул знает, что может в любое время обратится за советом к соседям. Родители Курбонгул тоже занимались животноводством, но они держали животных для личных нужд. Весь опыт, который получила Курбонгул от своих родителей, она хочет использовать в своем бизнесе. 
   Чтобы начать бизнес Курбонгул необходимо купить несколько голов крупнорогатого скота. К сожалению чтобы купить необходимое количество скота у нее не хватает средств, поэтому она просит кредит. Курбонгул старается, чтобы прокормить детей. Она верит в Вас и надеется, что Вы ей поможете, и она не останется без работы.
texts.en:
Kurbongul is a young ‘business lady’ starting her first undertaking. She is 27 years old, divorced, with two small children. 

Kurbongul wants to breed cattle. Despite her young age and limited experience, she is not afraid of starting her own business. There is a reason to that. Since most of residents in the region of Shahrituz are raising livestock, Kurbongul relies on the opportunity to turn to them for advice at any time. Kurbongul’s parents were also involved in raising livestock, but only for their personal needs. Still, in her business Kurbongul is going to use all the experience she’d gained from her parents.

To start the business, Kurbongul needs to purchase several head of cattle. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have enough money to buy them, which is why she requested a loan. Kurbongul is working hard to provide for her kids. She has faith in you and hopes for your help and that she wouldn’t have to be out of work.

loans.use: to start a business of raising and selling cattle, to buy cattle

loans.name: Mehri

texts.en: Mehri is a hard-working woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1966. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is married and has one child. When her husband went into the army, he was beaten so Mehri basically does business by herself and feeds their family. Mehri has 20 years experience doing business in agriculture.
