The income from her business meets her family's needs, such as food and clothing, and pays for the treatment of her husband. She learned from her childhood how to raise livestock and grow potatoes. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy potato seed and fertilizer for the coming season. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy potato seed and fertilizer for the coming season

loans.name: Jesselyn

texts.en:
Jesselyn is 43 years old and married with two children.

Jesselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jesselyn has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Jesselyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food for her business

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 57-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and eight children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for one year. Her husband alone is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Shaheen's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g., pieces of clothes, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories). But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items for his business purpose. 

Therefore Shaheen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance, Shaheen is very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase his tailoring business

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Loan is a Kinh woman. Her family has four members, including her husband, her daughter, and her son. Currently, her family is living in Son La city, a unit under Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is grocery sales. However, due to the strong competitive trend of this kind of business, the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount. 

She intends to repair the sanitary work of her family but she does not have money to buy materials. Therefore she wants to borrow a loan to buy materials for the sanitary work.
	
She will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time and hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a clean sanitary work.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the sanitary work (latrine)

loans.name: Khong's Group

texts.en:
Khong, 46 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman who has been joining in the program of M7-MFI since January 1997. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding. Her family has only 1.2 hectares of cultivated land of coffee and another 2000 square meters of cultivated land. 

The total income after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a small amount, but the saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the coffee and the coffee seed. This is the reason why she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. 

She will works hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time. She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively with high productivity, and next year it will bring her family twice as much product as the last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Retailing helps Roy provide for the family. He has a store that sells various food commodities and grocery items. Roy also sells animal feed and does vending for additional earnings. He like the simplicity of the retailing business because all he needs to do is display his goods and tend his store for his buyers. 

Roy plans to expand his retailing business. He applied for a loan from PMPC for the required capital. He wants to purchase more store inventory and pay for additional bags and supplies of animal feed and vitamins. Roy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more store inventory and pay for additional bags and supplies of animal feed and vitaminsl

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair beauty services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area for the business and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to buy more stock of beauty products. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her well being. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Naheem

texts.en:
Naheem is a 44-year-old responsible mother of four children who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a crockery shop for the past 20 years. Her husband is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.
Naheem's husband wants to purchase different types of crockery such as jugs, cups, and dinner sets to meet the demand of his customers. Due to financial constraints, he is not in the position to buy this merchandise for reselling purposes. So, Naheem has applied for a Kiva Loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these things to fulfill his business needs. This will also help him increase his daily sales and earn more profit to manage the business and supply the family's needs
Naheem is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase his crockery business

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 20 years old. With one child, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, shampoo, sugar, etc.

Cristine has been in this business for two years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, bread, shampoo, sugar, etc

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 33 years old and married with four children who are in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, shampoo, and noodles.

Evangeline has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, soap, shampoo, and noodles

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to buy more stock. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.This will enable her increase her sales, and hence have more income. Her business goal is to be a large scale distributor of clothes within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have a better and improved business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Rose Mae

texts.en:
Rose Mae is 25 years old and a single woman. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Rose Mae has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gina Flor

texts.en:
Gina Flor is 38 years old and married, with one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Gina Flor has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more fish to sell.

Gina Flor has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Lidia Abigail

texts.es:
Lidia, logro crecer con su negocio gracias al financiamiento anterior, ha suplido las necesidades de sus clientes y está mejorando la  economía familiar poco a poco, los miembros de su familia se encuentran en óptimas condiciones de salud y le apoyan en su negocio.
Como desea continuar mejorando su negocio y ve en los créditos la oportunidad de hacer con facilidad y a corto plazo, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar granos, básicos, bebidas, detergente, cosméticos, lociones, etc., seguirá trabajando y llevando el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia managed to grow her business thanks to the previous financing. She has supplied her customers' needs and is improving her family's economic situation little by little. The members of her family are in optimal health conditions and they help her out with her business.

As she wishes to continue improving her business, and sees the opportunity to do so easily and in the short-term with financing, she requests a new loan so that she can buy basic grains, soft drinks, detergent, cosmetics, lotions, etc. With this, she will continue to work and to provide daily sustenance to her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, detergent, cosmetics, lotions, etc.

loans.name: Edgar Benjamin

texts.es: Edgar vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica a la reparación de electrodomésticos, adicional a eso también realiza viajes en su pick up, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a las dos actividades las cuales le permiten salir adelante con su madre, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos para televisores y equipos de sonido y para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y así poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Edgar lives in his own house with his mother. He works in the repair of home appliances, and in addition to that he also makes runs with his pick-up truck. He has been working in both these activities for many years, and they have permitted him and his mother to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of spare parts for TVs and sound systems, as well as to service his vehicle, so that he can continue with his work, since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for TVs and sound systems, as well as to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Charlie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Charlie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Charlie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Cristie Rose

texts.en:
Cristie Rose is a 33-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Cristie Rose has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. 

Cristie Rose requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

In the future, Cristie Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Denis

texts.es: Denis tiene la edad  de 20 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el segundo   préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Denis is 20 years old, single and lives with his parents and siblings who are his main priorities. He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer, fungicide and to pay for labor in work to assist his coffee crops. He will also buy some seedlings to plant taking advantage of the beginning of the rainy season with the objective of increasing plant density per area. He also wants to take advantage of the fertile soil and climatic conditions and others which favor the growth of coffee.

With these improvements to the crops he hopes to obtain a bit more profit and thus improve the living conditions of his family and also invest some more in the cultivation and fulfill some goals. This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never had a loan from the state banks and FUDECOSUR has awarded the loan with better conditions and much lower rates of interest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia, es un apersona dedica a cuidar de su familia y atender su venta de antojitos, además tiene una tienda de productos de primera necesidad que está ubicada en su vivienda, la venta de atoles, enchiladas, empanadas, etc., la realiza cuatro días a la semana de forma ambulante en su pueblo;  ella vive con su esposo y un nieto, los cuales le apoyan en el negocio, ya que de esta manera generan los ingresos que son necesarios para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
El capital que está solicitando a Padecomsm será de utilidad para poder comprar aceite, verduras, granos básicos, huevos, pan y otro tipo de productos tanto para elaborar la venta de antojitos como para que el inventario de su tienda esté más surtido, también reservara una parte para cultivar un área pequeña de granos básicos de esta manera alimentara a su familia obtendrá ingresos extras para cubrir otras necesidades de su hogar.
Su visión es ampliar la tienda, tener nuevos clientes, mejorar sus condiciones económicas y darle a su nieto un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Herminia is a person who takes care of her family and manages her sales of snacks. She also has a store located in her home that sells staple goods. She sells atoles [a dessert/drink traditionally made of corn meal and milk and flavored with spices, fruits, etc], enchiladas [stuffed tortillas], empanadas [stuffed pastries], etc., as a street vendor in her town four days a week. 

She lives with her husband and one grandson, who help her in the business since this is how they generate revenues that are required to meet the family's needs. The capital she is requesting from PADECOMSM will be used to be able to purchase oil, vegetables, basic grains, eggs, bread and other types of products, in order to not only make snack sales, but also so that the inventory of her store will be better stocked. She will also keep a portion in order to cultivate a small area of basic grains and thus feed her family and obtain extra revenue to cover other household needs. 

Her vision is expand the store, get new clients, improve her economic situation and give her grandson a better future.

loans.use: to purchase oil, vegetables, basic grains, eggs, bread and other types of products.

loans.name: Yolyn Grace

texts.en:
Yolyn Grace is a 20-year-old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of nine. Her father died last February 2015 and her mother is a housewife. Yolyn Grace is the youngest in the family; she has six siblings. Four of them are already married. Her elder sister works as a pre-school teacher. 

Their total monthly family income of 8,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) ($180) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. This motivates Yolyn Grace to find means to help the family have more income. 

That’s why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Apart from helping her family, Yolyn Grace also dreams of becoming a successful call center agent and of having enough income to uplift her family from poverty. 

Your generosity in funding her loan will help Yolyn Grace have better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future. 

With the 80,000 Kenya Shillings (KES), she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a responsible mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 33 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to provide maintenance for his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make repairs for his taxi. Therefore Naseem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Naseem's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Naseem also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Naseem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.en:
Anvarjon is a handsome man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1973. He is living in a rural area with his family. He is married and has five children. He has 15 years of practice doing business in agriculture. He is a hardworking and goal-oriented person. The standard of their living was very hard, and he is used to ensuring his family has necessary things. 

He has good experience in agriculture, keeping livestock and planting potatoes. The only business that is common in his area is agriculture. He is planning to buy 15 head of livestock to keep them and then trade. He requested a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy livestock. 

He hopes to be a good farmer and to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy 15 head of livestock to keep them and then trade

loans.name: Maryle

texts.en:
Maryle is a 20-year-old college undergraduate and lives in Bago City. She belongs to a family of seven. Her father works as a carpenter, and her mother is a housewife. Maryle is the second to the youngest in the family, and she has four siblings. Her two elder brothers work in a local department store, her elder sister works in party needs store, and her younger brother is in high school. Their total monthly family income of 16,500 Philippines Pesos (PHP)($370) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. 

This motivates Maryle to find means to help the family have more income. That’s why she braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Apart from helping her family, Maryle also dreams of becoming a successful call center agent, to have a stable job, to have a better future, and to help her family financially. 

Your generosity in funding her loan will help Maryle have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio, quiere aprovechar la temporada de inicio de invierno y se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, fortalecerá su negocio y tendrá oportunidad de generar mayores ingresos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida familiar.
La inversión del financiamiento anterior  en su negocio le ha dado los recursos necesarios para crecer con la ganadería, aumentar su producción de lácteos y tener cosechas abundantes de granos básicos, su familia conserva el mismo número de miembros y comparten una vida más digna, las circunstancias económicas están mejorando.
texts.en:
Eugenio wants to take advantage of the fact that winter is beginning and has decided to apply for another loan in order to buy grazing cattle, strengthen his business and have the opportunity to earn a higher income and improve his family’s lifestyle.

Eugenio invested his previous in his business, which provided him with the necessary resources to expand his cattle-raising business, to increase dairy products production, and to have an abundant harvest of basic grains. Eugenio’s family remains as it was, and together they are enjoying a better life with an improving financial situation.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle, strengthen his business and have the opportunity to earn a higher income.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a businesswoman from Sindangan. She is a widow who runs a little sari-sari (variety) store and earns a meager income that is sufficient for her needs. Corazon has a lot of expertise in selling and she is a full-fledged member of PMPC. 

Corazon is requesting a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. She continues to look for better business opportunities which is proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities and consumable items

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 59 years old and is widowed with four adult children. She lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Loreta earns a living from her little sari-sari (variety) store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. For several years, she has also operated an ice-candy vending business. Loreta earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month from her business activities and has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. 

Loreta is requesting a loan to purchase groceries and other products to sell. She hopes to expand her sari-sari store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and consumable products

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria De Jesus tiene 34 años y está divorciada. Ella tiene un hijo de siete años. Hace cinco meses abrió una tortillería. Actualmente vende aproximadamente 120 kg de maíz al día. En su tienda inician actividades a las 5 am y terminan cerca de las 6 pm. Maria De Jesus está tratando de estabilizar su negocio para abrir una sucursal más en los siguientes meses. El precio de la tortilla es algo con lo que siempre tiene que lidiar porque es muy variable. Maria De Jesus está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 10,000 para reparar una máquina y comprar ingredientes en grandes cantidades como harina, sal y maíz. Gracias a Kiva y a su primer préstamo con Konfío está viendo sus sueños convertirse en realidad. Con este préstamo ella asegura que podrá incrementar sus ventas a un 90% aproximadamente.
texts.en: Maria De Jesus is 34 years old and is divorced. She has a seven year old son. Five months ago, she opened a tortilla shop. Currently she sells about 120 kg of corn a day. She starts working in her store at 5 am and ends around 6 pm. Maria De Jesus is trying to stabilize her business to open another branchin the following months. The price of tortillas is something that she always has to deal with because it's very variable. Maria de Jesus is requesting a loan of MXN 10,000 to repair a machine and buy ingredients in bulk like flour, salt and corn. Thanks to Kiva and her first loan with Konfío, she is seeing her dreams become reality. With this loan she says she can increase sales by approximately 90%.

loans.use: to repair a machine and buy ingredients such as flour, salt and corn in high quantities.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and married with two children. For the past 11 years, she has run a general store and also earns additional income selling Avon products. Nora has borrowed and repaid 25 previous loans from NWTF. She works hard to provide for her family.

Nora is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell. In the future, she aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy household goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase of chicharron (pork cracklings), quesillo (tortilla with cheese filling), maize, and beans among other ingredients

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a  Kiva borrower with three children. She describes herself as trustworthy. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables, beans and maize and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for five years.

Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital.

This is Jeniffer's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this new KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

Jeniffer's business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have an improved livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials such as galvanized iron, welding rods, iron, etc.

Ofelia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials such as galvanized iron, welding rods, iron, etc.

loans.name: Veronica Luz

texts.es:
Veronica nació en 1972 en la Ciudad de México. Hoy tiene 43 años y está felizmente casada y es madre de una niña. A Natalia, su hija de 17 años, desde muy pequeña le ha gustado hacer diferentes manualidades. Sus creaciones son tan impresionantes que comenzó a venderlas a sus conocidos en la escuela. Su negocio fue tan exitoso que Veronica decidió iniciar un negocio más formal en colaboración con su hija, vendiendo aretes, diademas, pulseras y diferentes manualidades. 

Este negocio ayudará a Veronica a tener un ingreso extra para cubrir los gastos educativos de Natalia y ayudar a que su hija se desarrolle personal y profesionalmente. Veronica además de su negocio, tiene un trabajo fijo en el sector turístico. Con un préstamo de MXN 4,500 será capaz de comprar materiales como listones, telas e hilos para hacer los productos. Veronica es una mujer muy perseverante e independiente, que siempre ha luchado contra los retos que se encuentra en su camino para darle lo mejor a su familia.

Está muy agradecida con Kiva y los prestamistas por confiar en ella y apoyarla en su negocio. Este es el primer préstamo de Veronica con Konfío y asegura que hará pagos en tiempo.
texts.en:
Veronica was born in 1972 in Mexico City. Today she is 43 years old and is happily married and the mother of a girl. Natalia, her daughter of 17 years, has liked doing different crafts from a very young age. Her creations are so impressive that she began selling to acquaintances at school. Her business was so successful that Veronica decided to start a formal business in collaboration with her daughter, selling earrings, diadems, bracelets and various crafts.

This business will help Veronica to earn extra income to cover the educational expenses of Natalia and help her daughter develop personally and professionally. In addition to this business, Veronica has a steady job in the tourism sector. With a loan of MXN 4,500, she will be able to buy materials like ribbons, fabric and thread to make the products. Veronica is a very persevering and an independent woman who has always fought the challenges on her way to give the best to her family.

She is very grateful to Kiva lenders who trust her and support her in her business. This is Veronica's first loan with Konfío and ensures that payments will be made in time.

loans.use: to buy materials such as ribbons and fabric.

loans.name: Gul Jabeen

texts.en:
Gul Jabeen is 47 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her spouse and five children. For the past 20 years, Gul Jabeen’s husband has run his own tailoring shop in the local market and he is responsible to provide for the needs of the entire family. She is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. Gul Jabeen’s husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories such as pieces of cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But, due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these items.

Gul Jabeen is requesting a Kiva loan through the field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories for her husband’s tailoring business. She hopes that her husband will earn a more profitable income. Gul Jabeen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories for her husband’s tailoring business

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед честный и хорошо воспитанный человек. Он родился в 1977 году. Сейчас он женат и отец троих детей. У него один сын и две дочери. Сын студент учится в университете.  Дочки еще маленькие, им 4 и 2 лет. Жена в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Она доить корову и обеспечить детей с молоком. Чамшед 13 своей жизни занимается животноводством. Он у себя во дворе выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Сейчас Чамшед просит кредит, для купли корма для скота. Это кредит поможет ей откормить скота и взять больше молоко для своих детей. Чамшед надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Jamshed is an honest and well-mannered man.  He was born in 1977.  Today he is married and the father of three children (one son and two daughters).  His son is a university student.  His daughters are still young: they are 4 and 2 years old.  Jamshed's wife is involved in agriculture and works in their district.  She also milks the family's cow, thus providing milk to the children.  Jamshed has been involved in animal husbandry for the past 13 years of his life.  He raises cattle at home and is taking a loan to buy feed for his animals.  This loan will help him to feed his cattle and get more milk for his children.  He is looking forward to your support.

loans.use: to buy feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1987. She is living in a village with nearby hills. She is single and lives with her parents.

For about three years, she has been working as an operator at a company. Firuza is a responsible, gentle, and communicative person and does her job well.

She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders to get a loan for needed everyday items like food and clothes. She felt some financial problems recently because of a financial crisis. She hopes to be supported and feed her family.

loans.use: to buy needed everyday items like food and clothes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with one child. She describes herself as jovial and a leader. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for four years.

Her business is located in a busy area near a bus stage and her primary customers are schools, hotels etc. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient working capital to add to her stock.

This is Grace's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this new KES 100,000 loan to buy more maize, beans, rice, flour and other cereals to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to build a permanent house.

Grace's business goal is to open another outlet in a nearby shopping center within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to give her children the best education she can.

loans.use: to buy more maize, beans, rice, flour and other cereals to sell

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as competent. She operates a restaurant and has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add to her stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years.

loans.use: to add to her stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Merfe

texts.en:
Merfe is a 20-year-old college undergraduate and lives in Bago City. She is married to Jose Jr., who works as a farm laborer. They have one 2-year-old child. Their total monthly family income is only PHP 4,000 ($90).

Merfe has long seen the need to help her husband, but didn’t have the means until she learned about the two-month training program of Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, she needs your help to finance her tuition.

Once Merfe starts earning, she can provide her family’s basic needs and then save some money for her child’s education and a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Winilyn

texts.en:
Winilyn is 32 years old and married with three children who are in school. For the past three years, she has run a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines. Winilyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Winilyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of eggs to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy eggs to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 48 years old, married and has one child.

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Carmelita has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Odelina

texts.en: Odelina is applying for a loan of $1,500 to improve her business. She is running a tailoring business in her house. She is making a good income from tailoring and she wants to buy more needed items with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to her tailoring shop and she is open every day. She opened her business two years ago with her own working capital $50.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and fine fabrics

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is a 22-year-old high school graduate and lives in Bago City. He belongs to a family of nine. His father died in Febuary 2015, and his mother is a housewife. Benjie is the second to the youngest of six siblings. Four of them are already married. His elder sister is a pre-school teacher.

Before, Benjie was working at Panasiatic as a reliever janitor for five months, but he stopped because he wanted to undergo training in Bagosphere. Their total monthly family income of PHP 8,000 ($180) is barely enough for them. This motivates Benjie to find means to help the family have more income. That’s why he braved the selection process of Bagosphere and successfully passed it to qualify for the two-month training program that could lead to a call center job.

Apart from helping his family, Benjie also dreams to become a successful call center agent and to have a better income, so he can uplift his family from poverty. Your generosity in funding his loan will help Benjie have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a two-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia nació en 1969 en Ecatepec De Morelos, donde la mayoría de los habitantes viajan a diario a la Ciudad de México para trabajar. Lucia vive con su esposo y sus dos bellos hijos. Con el fin de darle siempre lo mejor a su familia y tener un ingreso extra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Lucia inició un negocio que ofrece servicio de alquiler de equipo para fiestas. 
Un préstamo de MXN 10,000 ayudará a Lucia a comprar nueva vajilla y cubertería para ofrecer un mejor precio, así como crear publicidad para ser reconocida en toda la región. 
Lucia está muy agradecida con Kiva y los prestamistas que la apoyen en ester proyecto. El incremento en sus ingresos derivado de este préstamo le permitirá realizar pagos satisfactorios en su segundo préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en:
Lucia was born in 1969 in Ecatepec De Moreles, where the majority of inhabitants travel every day to Mexico City to work. Lucia lives with her husband and her two beautiful children. In order to always give the best to her family and to have extra income to help her husband with home expenses, Lucia began a business that offers party equipment rental services.

A loan of MXN 10,000 will help Lucia buy new cutlery and crockery to offer a better price and also for advertising to become more well-known in all of the region.

Lucia is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders that help her with this project. The increase in income from this loan will allow her to make successful repayments on her second loan with Konfio.

loans.use: to purchase a new cutlery and crockery and to create advertising.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a hard working woman. Hadija is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Hadija has been working hard to manage her spare parts business, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Hadija has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts, and will help Hadija to generate greater profits and provide for her children. Hadija hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Hadija is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde vende una variedad de productos alimenticios, clienta cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en la actividad, vende durante todo el año, con las ganancias que obtiene es como pueden salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, granos básicos, golosinas, leche, refrescos, azúcar, huevos, pan dulce, entre otras cosas y asu surtir mas su tienda par tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Candelaria, 43 years old, lives in a house of her own with her ​​life partner. She has a small store located in her place of residence where she sells a variety of food products. She has 5 years of experience in the business. She sells all year round. It is by her earnings that they can get ahead. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of soups, staple grains, sweets, milk, refreshments, sugar, eggs, sweet bread, among other things, and this way supply her shop more to have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy soups, staple grains, sweets, milk, refreshments, sugar, eggs, sweet bread, among other things.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 48, lives in Silang, Cavite, Philippines and is married to Melchor, a security guard and a driver. They have three children, two who work and one of whom is still in high school. In addition to paying the fees for her child in school, she works hard to support and maintain the household’s daily personal and household needs.

Juliana operates a sari-sari, a type of small convenience store in the Philippines. There she sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities, with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices, then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 800 PHP a day.

To help her continue operation of her sari-sari Juliana is applying for a 45,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CCT, which she will use to buy grocery items such as canned goods, instant noodles, fresh meat, and vegetables like eggplant, cabbage, potatoes, onions, etc.

Juliana is positive that these goods will provide a good return on her investment. She aims to expand her store and look for other means of income. She wants her child to get a college education to bring her better opportunities in life. She thanks God and you in advance for this financial assistance, for it will surely cover the family’s daily necessities and her child's school needs.

All CCT community clients such as Juliana are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man with seven children. He describes himself as competent. He operates a farm where he keeps livestock to sell, and he has been involved in this business for five years.

Joel's business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He says that his biggest business challenge is bad weather. His business goal is to have a stable business within five years.

This is Joel's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.	He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mueni

texts.en:
Mueni is married with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetics shop business, her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family’s basic needs. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks, and body lotions.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 50 years old and married with one child. Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eva has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, personal care products and other groceries. 

In the future Eva would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of fishing net.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es: Doña Florentina de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, además recibe remesas de un hijo, tiene 10 años de experiencia a esa actividad la cual inicio con capital financiado,  con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para seguir con la elaboración de las tortillas y tener junto a su hija una mejo calidad de vida.
texts.en: Florentina is 65 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter.  She works making and selling tortillas, and she also receives financial support from her son.  She has 10 years of experience at this business which she started with financing.  With the income she's earned, she's been able to cover some expenses that have come up.  She is requesting a loan to purchase corn in bulk and lime to continue making tortillas and provide a better quality of life for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase corn in bulk and lime.

loans.name: Miguel Osvaldo

texts.es: Miguel de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de ganando bovino desde hace varios años, vende sus productos de ganado en los pueblos aledaños, con las ventas que realiza es como puede salir adelante con su esposa,  el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ganando para continuar con la crianza y asi tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Miguel is 43 years old and lives in his own home with his wife.  He has worked raising cattle for many years, and selling the meat in nearby towns.  With the sales he makes, he and his wife are able to get ahead.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more cattle to continue raising them and thus have better income.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Juralyn

texts.en:
Juralyn is 36 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with one child now of school-aged. Juralyn earns a living from fishing activity particularly in operating a fishing boat and artificial fish sanctuary locally known as "payaw" business for 9 years already. 

Now she also receives a monthly pension as a surviving spouse of her late husband. She earns approximately PHP10,000 each month doing this type of activity and that amount is very helpful to support her child. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing bamboo, ropes and sinkers for the repair of her "payaw". Juralyn has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Juralyn hopes to expand her fishing business by acquiring additional “payaw”.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing bamboo, ropes and sinkers

loans.name: Welsonia

texts.en:
Welsonia is 51 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Welsonia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Welsonia has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, personal care products and school supplies. 

In the future, Welsonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.en:
Ana Vilma is 38 years old and married with two children, one of whom in school, Ana Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell bamboo in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell.

Ana Vilma has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bamboo to sell

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.es:
Entusiasta y muy comprometida en los negocios, Ana Karen nació en 1994 en Chimalhuacan, Estado de México, donde se reportaron más de 525,000 habitantes en 2005. Ana Karen, a sus 18 años, inició un negocio fabricando y reparando calcetines, una prenda que casi todos los habitantes de su región usan a diario. Actualmente tiene un pequeño taller en su casa, en el que reparan los calcetines defectuosos de otras empresas. Después de que los reparan y están listos para usarse, se encargan de vender los calcetines en los mercados más cercanos. 
Ella está muy orgullosa de haberse convertido en una emprendedora con el fin de cubrir los gastos de sus estudios universitarios. Su mayor sueño en la vida es tener diferentes sucursales en diferentes regiones y tener su propia casa, en donde podría compartir momentos inolvidables junto con su hijo de dos años. 
Los calcetines con diseños infantiles son los que más fabrican. Y son los niños los mejores jueces que Ana Karen puede tener. Ana Karen quiere poner un negocio de ropa deportiva para tener todos los ingresos posibles. 
Con este préstamo de Kiva será capaz de comprar materiales para la elaboración de los calcetines como telas, hilos, estambres y otros. Al dar fondos para este préstamo, ayudarán a que Ana Karen tenga un mejor patrimonio que ofrecer a su hijo como madre soltera.
texts.en:
Enthusiastic and very committed to her business, Ana Karen was born in 1994 in Chimalhuacan, Estado de Mexico, where reportedly more than 525,000 people lived in 2005. Ana Karen, with her 18 years, began her business making and repairing socks, a garment that almost all the residents in her region use daily. She has a small workshop in her house, where she repairs defectives socks amongst other businesses. After she repairs the socks and they're ready to use, she sells the socks in the nearby markets. She is very proud to have become an entrepreneur to cover the expenses from her university studies. Her biggest dream in life is to have different branches in different regions and to have her own house where she can share unforgettable moments together with her son of two years.

Socks with designs for children is what she makes most, and children are the best judges that Ana Karen can have. Ana Karen wants to open a business of sports wear to have the highest income possible. With this Kiva loan, she will be able to buy materials to make the socks like fabric, needles, threads, and other things. With the funds from this loan, it will help Ana Karen have a better legacy to offer her son as a single mother.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, needles and threads in bulk.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1964. He is living in a rural area with his family. He is married and has two children. He has 25 years of practice doing business in agriculture. He is a hardworking and goal-oriented person. 

Regretfully, his wife is sick now. Each month Ahmad is buying medicines for her. 

Ahmad is used to doing agriculture from a young age. He keeps livestock and cultivates potatoes. He is planning to plant potatoes this coming season and asks for a loan from IMON to buy seeds and fertilizer. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Saidakbar

texts.en:
Saidakbar is an active boy. He was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1992.  Currently, Saidakbar is a second-year student at Art University. He is an excellent student and actively participates in his classes. He is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to pay tuition fees and hopes you will support him.

Saidakbar lives in Vahdat and welcomes everyone to his beautiful city - a city that attracts tourists due to its geographical location. The city's canyon is famous for its wonderful healing springs, wild forests, and rapid mountain rivers. Additionally, the mountain massifs in the area are of great interest to hikers.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 2 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Loan, 49, is married with three children and lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past ten years she has raised chickens to make a living. She is also the leader of the 4-member Nhóm 02 Thôn 2 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which is pictured in this photograph.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her in regard to her chicken business is the lack of capital. Therefore she is applying for a 40,000,000 VND loan through Kiva’s partner Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to be divided among her group. This will be her first loan, and she will use her portion to buy more chicks to raise and sell.

With her profits Loan hopes to build a new house, for her business thrive and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario, 53 years old, is married and resides in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She joined PMPC in March, 2011 in order to access the programs and services of the coop. Rosario has recently accessed her 5th loan in the amount of PHP 14,000 for additional working capital to buy variety of commodities for her business. She wants to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, sugar and milk for retail. She sells a variety of assorted products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities for her store such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and milk

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 45 years old, married and has two children she's sending to school. Her husband works abroad as an OFW. To help her husband in carrying their needs, Emelita decided to manage a dry goods store. She is selling bags, slippers, and shoes. Emelita has been five years in this type of business and hopes for continued growth of it for a continuous source of income. With this, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy shoulder bags, back bags, slippers, shoes, and sports bags. Emelita wishes to extend her business as she is expecting that in the future, her husband will stop working abroad as he gets older.

loans.use: to buy shoulder bags, back bags, slippers, shoes, and sports bags.

loans.name: Julesia

texts.en:
Julesia is 43 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Julesia works very hard to provide for them.

Julesia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell. Julesia has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, coffee, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Julesia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 46, is a widow mother of two children, and living in Bati district of Takeo Province, Cambodia. To make a living, for 10 years she has been managing and operating a farming business, growing and selling rice to local dealers. 

Due to a lack of funds, Chantha has applied for a first Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more farmland in order to expand her current business. She hopes that she can earn more money to improve their living standards through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more farmland.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is an active borrower with BRAC Pakistan. She lives with her five children and husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running his own scrap business, and one of her sons has been running a mobile shop for the past 8 years.

Sajida's son wants to purchase different types of mobile accessories for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, her son is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore Sajida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she’ll enable her son to purchase relevant items for his business purpose so that her son can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Sajida is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son expand his mobile business

loans.name: Sonia Estela

texts.es: Sonia de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella posee una venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia ya tiene clientes fijos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como puede salir adelante con su hija, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 44, lives in her own house with her daughter.  She has had a business selling second-hand clothes for several years.  Her business is located at her house.  She has fixed customers.  She is able to get ahead with her daughter with what she gets from her sales.

She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes wholesale in order to be able to continue with her work and to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza wants to borrow a loan of P15,000 to buy grocery items she will sell in her village. She has her stall beside her house. Analiza wants to sell more items because she believes that by selling more items she will also gain higher income. Analiza is almost one year into running her business. 

She wishes to expand the business while managing it for the future of her four children. One of her children is going to school and hopes to finish his study up to college. Analiza and her husband are doing their best to have a better way of living for their family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items she will sell in her village.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra, a widow, is 53 years old from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Petra has rented a space in the fish market where she displays a variety of dried fish to sell. She has been in this business for many years already, earning a good return, enabling her to support the needs of her family. 

Since she wants to generate more income, Petra joined Paglaum MPC to gain insurance and financial assistance, purchasing dried fish in bulk for resale at market. She has now applied for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy more variety of dried fish for resale. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, she can become a successful vendor someday to continuously provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of dried fish for resale

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Tita is 54 years old and has two children who are in school.

Tita has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She requested a 29,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of spices to sell. Tita has been in this business for 10 years.  

In the future, Tita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of spices to sell

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 72 years old and widowed with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Merlinda has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items such as canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, and other groceries.

Merlinda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items such as canned goods, soft drinks, diapers, and other groceries.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 51 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from growing vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, eggs, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 44-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for 15 years. Her husband is solely responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Rukhsana's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, laces, needles, and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable condition to buy these items for his business purpose. Therefore, Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount, she will financially assist her husband with these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs so that her husband can earn more profitable income. For this financial assistance, Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase items needed for her husband's tailoring business

loans.name: Lourdes Marcela

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 53 años y está divorciada. Es madre de un niño de 17 años y una hija de 20 años. Lourdes tiene un salario fijo gracias a su empleo administrativo. Siguiendo su pasión por cocinar, en especial el mole, un platillo tradicional mexicano, Lourdes comenzó un negocio vendiendo mole a sus conocidos y amigos con el fin de cubrir los gastos de su hogar y los estudios universitarios de sus dos hijos. 
El mayor reto que Lourdes enfrenta es la competencia pero gracias a su receta secreta, su negocio ha sido muy exitoso. Por esa razón quiere convertir su negocio en un establecimiento más formal. Le gustaría tener un restaurante que vendiera diferentes platillos mexicanos como quesadillas, tacos y otros, todos hechos a base de mole. 
Con un préstamo de 10,000 ella podrá comprar ingredientes en grandes cantidades para preparar mole, como chocolate, chiles, pan y condimentos, así como etiquetas y envases para sus productos. Lourdes es una empresaria, una buena madre y muy trabajadora mujer que sería muy feliz si pudiera darle empleo a otras personas que le ayuden en todo el proceso de preparación de un platillo con tanta cultura. Gracias a este préstamo de Kiva podrá mejorar su producto y por lo tanto sus ventas. El incremento en sus ventas le permitirá tener mayores ganancias y ahorrar para cumplir su sueño de poner un restaurante. Con los ingresos derivados de este préstamo será capaz de realizar pagos satisfactorios en su primer préstamo con Konfío.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 53 years old and is divorced. She is a mother of a 17 year old son and a 20 year old daughter. Lourdes has a fixed salary thanks to her administrative job. She is continuing her passion of cooking, especially "mole," a traditional Mexican dish. Lourdes is beginning her business selling mole to her acquaintances and friends in order to cover her house expenses and university studies of her children.

The biggest challenge that Lourdes faces is the competition but thanks to a secret recipe, her business has been very successful. For this reason, she is beginning to establish a more formal business. She would like to have a restaurant that sells different Mexican dishes like quesadillas, tacos, and other things, all made with a "mole" base.

With a loan of MXN 10,000, she would like to buy ingredients in larger quantities to prepare mole, like chocolate, chilies, bread, and condiments, and labels and packaging for her products. The increase in sales would allow her to have a better earnings and accomplish her dream of opening a restaurant. With the increase in income derived from this loan, she would be able to pay back her first Konfio loan satisfactorily.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare mole and also packaging and labels.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour, and also purchase construction materials for her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour, and also purchase construction materials for her rental houses.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 38 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Bernadette is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Bernadette requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Bernadette has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernadette would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a computer shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice and charcoal.  Editha is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to  purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computer and pay for mechanics salaries for her computer shop business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her computer and pay for mechanics salaries

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 48 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Carmelita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for ten years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Virginia has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell in her general store. Her dream is to one day be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

Adora has been in this business for ten years now.

In the future, Adora would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Betty works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dressmaking and farming rice. Betty is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell for her general store business.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 37 years old and a mother of four children. Her husband has been working in furniture for 20 years and is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold. 

Naseem's husband wants to buy  pieces of wood and other tools for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband cannot afford to buy this merchandise. Therefore Naseem has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. with the help of this loan her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business purpose and earn a profitable income to meet the daily needs of the family and business.

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's  furniture business in order to meet the needs of the family

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras es un grupo nuevo, que tiene muchas expectativas para poder mejorar sus vidas. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer su situación de vida e ir mejorándola con su trabajo.
La Sra. María solicita este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, panificados, frutas y otros, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas. María se define como una persona luchadora que inspirada en superarse pone todo lo mejor de sí.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su situación de vida, y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Trabajadoras" [Working Women] is a new group. They have many expectations for the improvement of their lives. They participate in the program for the elimination of poverty to get to know their life situation and improve it with their work.

María is requesting this loan to buy various supplies for her shop like vegetables, meat, baked goods, fruits and others. This way she will be able to keep her sales going.

María defines herself as a fighter who, inspired by her will to better herself, puts her all into it. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given to improve her life situation and help her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, baked goods, fruits and others to stock her shop.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-years-old married man from Khan Younis city and is a father for one son and two daughters.  Ali is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income.  He also works in distributing cooking gas for local clients.  It is a good business and provides him with a good income.

Ali took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more cooking gas bottles for his business. This will increase his income and improve his business.  Ali appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more cooking gas bottles for his business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 57 years old and has six children. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years.

As much as possible, fisher people like Victoria need to have all of the needed fishing accessories to minimize their chances of a low or zero catch. Victoria already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC, amounting to PHP 14,900, for the purchase of new nets.

Victoria personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio es un hombre de 39 años de edad, soltero, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años,  y su negocio es la venta comida tradicional.
Él es buen padre, independiente, activo, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘villa Dolores’ es el área más antigua y populosa de la ciudad, las tradiciones, el desarrollo y los lugares simbólicos de este barrio son ahora parte de un circuito turístico guiado por estudiantes del colegios. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Sergio es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello corto negro, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tipo Snack, como; pollo a la broaster, chuleta de res, asado, medio lomo, pollo dorado, sillpancho, y otros…, todo acompañado con sopa, “inicié mi negocio gracias a la experiencia de mi madre, ahora cuento con clientes diarios…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que es el único comercio de este tipo en el lugar, la desventaja es la falta de equipos de cocina para aumentar la oferta de comida. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande y completo, el desea realizar la compra de una máquina espiadera para cocina pollos al espiedo. La máquina espiadera se utiliza para asar alimentos, generalmente haciéndolos girar frente, debajo o sobre la fuente de calor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sergio solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina espiadera para abrir un restaurante y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sergio is a 39-year-old single man. He has one son who is 5 years old, and he sells traditional food for a living. He is a good father, independent, active, constant, responsible, and very hard-working.

He carries out his work in the "Villa Dolores" zone, which is the oldest and most populous area of the city. The traditions, development, and symbolic places of this neighborhood are now part of a guided tour led by high-school students. It has a cold and dry climate, with a daytime temperature that varies between 0 and 12 degrees Celsius.

Sergio is tan, with black eyes, short black hair, short stature, and slim build. His mother language is Aymará, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish in daily life and in his business.

He shares his life with his son, who is not school-age yet. They live in a house owned by the family, which is made of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof and a wood floor. It has potable water, electricity, gas, and plumbing.

His business is in snack food sales, such as broasted chicken, beef chops, roasted meat, half fillets, golden chicken, silpancho, and other foods... all accompanied by soup. "I started my business thanks to my mother's experience, and now I have daily customers," he says.

The advantage of his business is that he is the only salesman of this type in the area. The disadvantage is his lack of kitchen equipment to increase his food offerings. His dream is to have a large and full-size restaurant. He wants to purchase a rotisserie oven to cook chicken. A rotisserie oven is used to roast food, usually making it rotate in front of, below, or above the heat source. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in his 3 years of business.

For these reasons, Sergio is requesting a loan to purchase a rotisserie oven to open a restaurant, and use the earnings to cover his son's expenses.

loans.use: to buy a rotisserie oven to open a restaurant, and use the earnings to cover his son's expenses

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with two children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like shampoo, canned goods, diapers and other groceries.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Josephine aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, canned goods, diapers and other groceries.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Haidita

texts.en:
