Haidita works hard to support her family. Haidita is married and has a seaweeds cultured business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings, plastic ropes and bottles, etc.

Haidita has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Haidita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, plastic ropes and bottles, etc

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 40 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are sent to school.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like body lotion, toys, school supplies, soft drinks and beverages to sell.

She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Analyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like body lotion, toys, school supplies, soft drinks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 52-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. 

Her husband has been running a crockery shop for past 30 years. Her husband is solely responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Nusrat's husband wants to purchase a different a type of crockery (e.g., jugs, glasses, dinner sets) to fulfill the demands of his customers. But, due to financial constraints, he is not in the position of buying this merchandise for reselling purposes. 

To fulfill her husband's business needs, Nusrat has applied for a Kiva Loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all the things he needs to fulfill his business needs. This will also help him to increase his daily sales and earn more profitable income in order to manage the business and meet his family's needs.

Nusrat is very happy and she is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase inventory in her husband's crockery business.

loans.name: Diab

texts.en:
Diab is a 38-years-old married man from Dier El balah city.   He works as an employee in the public sector with a very low income.  During the last violence in Gaza, his home was destroyed completely.  Diab and his family are living now in a rented house. 

Diab took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some construction supplies to rebuild part of his home. by taking this loan, He will be able to cover part of the urgent expenses he has.   Diab appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy some construction supplies to rebuild part of his home which was destroyed completely

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animals.

loans.name: Ranojon

texts.en:
Ranojon is a wise woman. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1952. She is living in a rural area with her family. She is married and has children. She has many years of practice sewing traditional women's dresses and also pillows, mattresses, etc. She has permanent customers for her national dresses and items. She gets orders and sews at home. 

She is planning to widen her activity and asked for a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy textiles and necessary items to sew dresses, pillows, mattresses, etc. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy textiles and necessary items to sew dresses, pillows, mattresses, etc.

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.en:
Nelinda is married and is from Sindangan, Philippines. She joined PMPC and appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. The co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her retailing business, helping the family survive.

Fortunately, she makes promising sales every day and is able to save from it. Nelinda keeps on running the business well, to continuously provide for her family. She believes that with their support, they will keep going and sustain the business.

Nelinda wishes to have safe and comfortable living quarters in a house constructed with a durable ceiling and walls. She has applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional construction materials for the completion of her house, like bags of cement and floor tiles. Nelinda wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional construction materials for the completion of her house, like bags of cement and floor tiles

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar is a confident woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into the family of workers. She is living in a town with her family. She is widow and has one child. 

She has been trading in the market for ten years. She has a  business of buying and selling fresh fruits and attracts permanent customers every day. 

She is planning to widen her business and wants to buy additional fruits for the coming season. She appealed to IMON to take a loan to buy fruits. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and help her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for her market stall

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta  de 42 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que vive junto a su hija ya mayor de edad a la que ha logrado sacar  adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, por lo que se siente muy orgullosa de ella. Berta se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de muñecos de trapo, actividad que le permite sostenerse y continuar apoyando a su hija. Berta desea invertir en su negocio, ya que en mayo sus ventas son mejores por las fiestas del día de la madre, por lo que ella quiere tener suficiente mercadería para cumplir con la demanda de productos que sus clientes solicitan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bolsos, muñecos de tela y arreglos alusivos a las madres.
texts.en:
42-year-old Berta is a hard-working woman who lives with her adult daughter. She succeeded in supporting her thanks to her effort and dedication, for which she is very proud of her.

For the past 4 years, Berta has sold rag dolls for a living, an occupation that has allowed her to support herself and continue supporting her daughter. Berta wants to invest in her business because in May, her sales are better because of Mother's Day celebrations. She wants to have enough merchandise to fulfill her customers' demand for products.

She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in bags, cloth dolls, and arrangements for mothers.

loans.use: to purchase bags, cloth dolls, and arrangements for mothers

loans.name: Barnojon

texts.en:
Barnojon is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a district with her family. She is married and has two children.

She has many years of experience doing business in agriculture. She participated at a three-day training provided by IMON to startup clients and decided to do a business to help her family.

She wants to be busy with fattening livestock and selling to customers. She takes care with each livestock and knows her business well. She will work hard in order to earn money for her family budget. She hopes to help her husband and ensure her children have necessary things and education.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to buy livestock and do business. She awaits Kiva lenders’ kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 52 years old and has eight children.  Rosita is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Rosita has been  for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Anamie

texts.en:
Anamie is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Anamie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Anamie has been farming vegetables for two years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school, Susan works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Susan has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future Susan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell and save money for her children's education

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  Amy is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Amy has a general store business in the Philippines. Amy requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries like shampoo, soap, soft drinks and other groceries.

Amy has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Amy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like shampoo, soap, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 25-year-old married man from Khan Younis City.   He works as an employee in the public sector and he also has a sheep barn. He raises the sheep and sells the meat and diary products at the local market.

Jihad would like to improve his business so he took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. 
Jihad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn and therefore increase his business

loans.name: El Sadaka Group

texts.en:
Ommaya is the featured borrower for El Sadaka Group. She got together with the other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living situations at the same time.

Ommaya is a 53-year-old married mother of four. Twelve years ago she started preparing and selling food from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Ommaya has good cooking skills. She is an ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate and expand her kitchen which will facilitate her work. Ommaya is the first lady on the right in the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Abir is the lady sitting in the middle, and Maysaloun is the first lady on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to renovate and expand her kitchen which will facilitate her work

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 53 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs  in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Analyn has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs, so as to expand her business more

loans.name: Susette

texts.en:
Susette is 32 years old, married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc.

Susette has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 3 years and also earns an income from making nipa roofing.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, shampoo, eggs, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Remylo

texts.en:
Remylo is 36 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Remylo is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Remylo has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from general store and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leziel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Leziel works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Leziel is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Leziel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a piece of land and thus improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Ana Obdulia

texts.es:
Ana, está felizmente casada, vive con su esposo y dos hijos que tiene edades de 14 y 11 años, tiene una venta de ropa que la realiza de manera ambulante y también vende tamales, sus recorridos son en la localidad en que vive y en los alrededores, su madre le enseño a elaborar la venta de tamales.
Requiere de un crédito para comprarse prendas de vestir, maíz, condimentos, hojas de huerta, etc., será de ayuda para incrementar su inventario y atender mejor a sus clientes, espera tener materia prima para elaborar la venta de tamales por una larga temporada y recuperar la inversión con mayores ganancias.
Ana desea mantener su negocio con vida para sacar adelante a su familia y poder pagarles la universidad a sus hijos y que así ellos tengan una profesión.
texts.en:
Ana is happily married. She lives with her husband and two children, who are 14 and 11 years old. She sells clothing as a traveling saleswoman, and she also sells tamales. Her rounds are in the area where she lives and its surroundings. Her mother taught her how to sell tamales.

She needs a loan to buy material for clothing, corn, condiments, banana leaves, etc. which will help increase her inventory and better serve her customers. She hopes to have raw ingredients to sell tamales for a long period of time and make back the investment with better earnings.

Ana wants to keep her business alive to support her family and pay for the college education of her children, so that they can have a profession.

loans.use: to buy material for clothing, corn, condiments, banana leaves, etc. which will help increase her inventory and better serve her customers

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Julie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling feed.  Julie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to  purchase more sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Julie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Agali Awamu Nakulabye Group

texts.en:
Medius 35, is a single mother with 3 children. She has operated a retail business for 5 years, selling merchandise (clothing, shoes, perfumes) that she orders from catalogs and resells to her customers. The business has been her means of supporting herself and her children.
Medius lives with her children. 

This is her first loan and she is grateful to UGAFODE for supporting her business. Her customers live in all parts of the city and her earnings from the business cover her main expenses: food, healthcare, schooling for her children, and expenses related to her family members.

Medius's neighbour, a member of UGAFODE before, brought her to the group. She hopes to save enough from her business to build a house of her own and rent a shop where she can better operate her business.

loans.use: To boost her clothing business by buying clothing for selling.  She wants to build her own house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchse yuca, meat, maize, vegetables, tomato, etc.

loans.name: 031406050003.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngân works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Ngân is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children.  She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 031406050003.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group.  Ngân lives with no dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Ngân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future to increase her capital for more business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gerald, a barber, and has two children who are still in the elementary level in school. She has sold fruits and vegetables for 10 years already. Her earnings from the business help meet their everyday needs and her children’s school needs.

Florence buys fruits that are native to the Philippines, such as pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells mangoes, citrus fruits and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day. 

Florence is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to purchase more varieties of fruit to sell. She will use her loan to buy more fruits and veggies from a wholesaler and farm owners who sell them by the kilo. Her earnings cover their daily sustenance and the school requirement of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Florence aims to grow her fruits and vegetable vending business. She plans to buy a vehicle to deliver her fruits to households. She also dreams that her children will be able to finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gemema

texts.en:
Gemema is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemema is 44 years old and all of her children are in school.

Gemema has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Gemema requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Gemema has been in this business for two years. In the future, Gemema would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from candy making. Dolores is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business so as to send her children to college

loans.name: Naida

texts.en:
Naida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell for her business.

Naida has been in this business for 7 years. Naida earns more income from general store and farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Ederlita

texts.en:
Ederlita is 64 years old and has five children. Ederlita is a married woman.

Ederlita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Ederlita requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ederlita has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ederlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise livestock

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is 64 years old and married.  Emilia works very hard to provide for them.

Emilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Emilia has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Emilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is from Maysisyan village of Armavir region and is engaged in agricultural business. She cultivates wheat, potatoes, and cabbages and sells them in local markets. Armenuhi likes her farming business and works day and night to develop it. She is asking for this loan to purchase potato seeds to be able to develop her agricultural business. 

Because the region where Armenuhi's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Armenuhi's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF International and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds to develop her agricultural business

loans.name: Susana Milagros

texts.es: Susana de 39 años de edad es madre de 3 hijos y reside en una urbanización en Barranquilla, angustiada por la situación económica en la que se encontraba decidió vender jugos de frutas naturales y empanadas (pasaboca elaborado a base de masa rellenas de queso o carne) y a los medios días elaboraba almuerzos.  Tiempo después decidió solo vender frutas desde su casa al tener una buena base de clientes a los que todos los días en el horario de 10 a 6:30 p.m. les ofrece frutas frescas y le cancelan de contado.  Sus compras las realiza a mayoristas de frutas y les cancela inmediatamente, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para adquirir una nevera para conservar las frutas frescas y poder tener más variedad.  Con doce años de experiencia Susana ha logrado ser reconocida entre sus vecinos por sus excelentes productos.  Ella desea que su negocio siga creciendo para lograr tener la capacidad necesaria para responder a la demanda. Su meta familiar es lograr que con el fruto de su trabajo pueda costearle los estudios profesionales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Susana is 39 years old and the mother of three children. She resides in a project in Barranquilla. Concerned  about the economic situation in which she found herself, Susana decided to begin selling natural fruit juices and stuffed buns (snacks made of dough stuffed with cheese or meat), and also, at mid-day, she would sell lunches.

Later on, Susana decided to just sell fruit from her home, depending on her good customer base. She serves her fresh fruits every day between 10:00 am and 6:30 pm and receives payment in cash. Susana buys her fruit at wholesale, paying immediately. 

Now, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, in order to acquire a refrigerator to conserve her fresh fruit and be able to stock more variety.

With 12 years of experience, Susana has won recognition for her excellent products among her neighbors. She wants her business to continue to grow, gaining the necessary capacity to respond to demand. 

Susana's family goal is that by continuing to work with her fruit, she can pay for her children's professional studies.

loans.use: acquire a refrigerator to help conserve fresh fruits and to be able to keep more variety in stock.

loans.name: Gladis Kena

texts.es:
Gladis tiene 36 años y está soltera. Tiene un taller de manualidades en su casa, mismo que inició hace más de 10 años con su familia. Todos sus productos están inspirados en los niños y siempre usan materiales reciclados. Muñecas, lámparas, plumas y regalos son algunos de los productos que Gladis ofrece. Ellos inician actividades en el taller a las 8 am y en ocasiones terminan hasta medianoche. 
Todos sus diseños y creaciones son originales y únicas, por lo que siempre atraen nuevos clientes. Gladis tiene una alianza con una de compañía famosa en todo el país y por esa razón tiene que acelerar el proceso de producción. Está solicitando un préstamo de MXN 6,000 para comprar materiales en grandes cantidades, necesarios para manufacturar todas sus obras de arte como telas, hilos, estambres y agujas. 
A Gladis le gustaría aprovechar al máximo sus habilidades en la pintura para tener ganancias. Tiene planeado abrir una galería en la que se ofrezcan todos los productos que ella misma ha creado con el fin de transmitir un sentimiento positivo a quienes lo compren. 
Este es el primer préstamo de Gladis con Konfío y está muy comprometida a pagar a tiempo porque “como emprendedor, mantener un buen historial crediticio es la herramienta para que tu negocio siga creciendo y con el paso del tiempo, ser un negocio muy competitivo”, Gladis dice.
texts.en:
Gladis is 36 years old and is single. She has a craft workshop in her house- the same one that she started more than 10 years ago with her family. All of her products are inspired by kids and always use recycled materials. Dolls, lamps, pens, and gifts are some of the products that Gladis offers. They begin their activities in the workshop at 8 am and sometimes finish at midnight.

All of her designs and creations are originals and unique, so she always attracts new clients. Gladis has a partnership with a famous company in the whole country, and because of this, she has to accelerate her production process. She is seeking a loan of MXN 6,000 to buy materials in great quantities, which is necessary to manufacture all of her work, such as fabrics, threads, yarns and needles.

Gladis would like to maximize her painting abilities to have make a profit. She is planning on opening a gallery in which she would offer all products that she has created her self to provide a positive sentiment to those who buy.

This is her first loan with Konfio, and she is very dedicated to paying on time because "as an entrepreneur, maintaining a good credit history is the tool to continue growing your business, and with time, business is very competitive," Gladis says.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabrics, threads and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Elyor

texts.en:
Elyor is a strong man who was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1976. He lives in a rural area with his family. He is married and has three children. He also has a mother who needs to be supported. 

He has 10 years of experience doing business in agriculture, which is the most common and efficient business to do in his area. As a responsible and goal-oriented person, he is committed to ensuring his family's needs are met. His wife helps and supports him with the business.

Unfortunately, his last harvest was not good because of a financial crisis. He is going to gain a good harvest in the coming season. He is asking for financial support from IMON to buy vegetables seeds, cereal seeds and fertilizer. Elyor hopes to have a good harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy vegetables seeds, cereal seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Paz

texts.es: Doña Maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y pupusas, posee 15 años de dedicarse a esa actividad y así como puede obtiene sus ingresos para los gastos de la casa, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de quesillo, chicharron, maíz, frijoles, cal, entre otros y así seguir con la elaboración de los alimentos para tener junto a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
53-year-old Maria lives with her child in a house that she owns. She sells tortillas and pupusas for a living. She has done this for 15 years, which has allowed her to earn enough income to cover the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase quesillo [a soft Salvadoran cheese], pork cracklings, corn, beans, lime, etc. so that she can continue making these foods in order to have a better quality of life, along with her child.

loans.use: to buy quesillo, pork cracklings, corn, beans, lime, etc.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a mother of two children at the age of 42. She wants what's the best for the family. Her husband is a farmer, both husband and wife are helping each other in their rice farm while Marife do the corn production to earn income also. 

She aims for a greater income because of the increased needs of the family. She borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for her corn farm to produce good quality of corn and have a good harvest.

Marife wants to save money out from her business to improve their house building.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her corn farm to be able to improve her house

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Ramel is 18 years old and is sixth of nine children in the family. His mother Josephine supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Ramel is studying Bachelor of Science in Information and Technology and is currently on His 1st year of this four years-year course.

Josephine is borrowing 3625 to pay for tuition fees of her son Ramel, for the 1st semester of the School Year 2015-2016.

When he graduates, Ramel plans to be gainfully employed so he could help improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees in IT

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow so the future of her children will be secured

loans.name: Jan Marie

texts.en:
Jan Marie is 20 years old and married with one child who is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jan Marie is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Jan Marie has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jermilyn

texts.en:
Jermilyn is 31 years old, with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jermilyn is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jermilyn has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 55 years old, married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Edna has a business selling  fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 22000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Edna has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Oscar Ivan

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre de 67 años de edad, tiene un taller industrial, el cual inauguró a comienzos del año 2003 buscando mejores ingresos y dejar de ser empleado, Oscar ha pasado dificultades, malos momentos, uno de ellos fueron los malos resultados en un inicio, pasar de tener un trabajo a fijo a buscar clientes fue realmente más complicado de lo que esperaba, para terminar de completar su mal momento perdió a su esposo, quedando viudo con un negocio en crecimiento y a cargo de sus dos hijos.
Para superar estas adversidades Oscar se llenó de fortaleza y de valor asumiendo con responsabilidad sus dos funciones y prometiéndose triunfar en nombre de su fallecida esposa.

Pasado 12 años Oscar sigue en pie con su negocio, tratando de mejorar diariamente para pagar la educación de sus hijos, tener su vivienda en buenas condiciones y trabajo firme y rentable.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de acero, metales, aluminio y herrajes que son los insumos principales para fabricar rejas, puertas, entre otros objetos.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 67-year-old man who has an industrial workshop. He started it at the beginning of 2003, looking to earn a better income and to quit working for others. Oscar has experienced difficulties and bad moments. One of them was bad results in the beginning; transitioning from having a regular job to looking for customers was truly more complicated than he expected. To top off that bad time, Oscar lost his wife, finding himself widowed with a growing business and two children in his care.

To overcome those adversities, Oscar summoned all his strength and courage, taking on his two roles responsibly and promising himself that he would triumph in the name of his late wife.

Twelve years later, Oscar and his business are still standing. He tries to better himself every day in order to pay for his children's education and to keep his house in good condition and his work stable and profitable.

He wants to request a loan for the purchase of steel, metals, aluminum, and fittings, which are the principal supplies for fabricating bars, doors, and other objects.

loans.use: to buy steel, metals, aluminum, and fittings, which are the principal supplies for fabricating bars, doors, and other objects.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, shorts, shirts for men and women and other products.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 35-year-old woman and is the mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a food stall, where he sells different types of ready-to-eat foods like samosas, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, kabab paratha, etc. Her husband is solely responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Parveen's husband needs to purchase different types of food and other items for his business purpose so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in condition to purchase these items for his business purpose.

Therefore, Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase food and other items for his food stall business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth madre cabeza de familia, ama de casa, con una hija de 23 años que depende económicamente de ella, es una mujer humilde que aprovecha sus habilidades culinarias para generar los recursos para su sustento, ella vende alimentos como almuerzos y desayunos, entre su menú está el sancocho, sudado, bandeja paisa, sopas, espaguetis, comidas típicas antioqueñas en general.
Elizabeth para su trabajo pone a disposición los implementos de su cocina, produce solo lo que sus ollas pueden albergar y esto es algo contraproducente puesto que su negocio está en crecimiento y por falta de capital  no ha podido comprar enseres e insumos para mejorar la producción.
Por tal motivo Elizabeth quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de ollas, pailas, insumos de alimentos pues quiere aumentar su producción en un 200% para suplicar sus ingresos y es sostenible por la demanda. 
Todo este esfuerzo Elizabeth lo hace pensando en la educación y sostenimiento de su familia, ayúdala ella te necesita.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a mother, the head of the family, and a housewife, with a 23-year-old daughter who depends on her economically. She is a humble woman who takes advantage of her culinary abilities to generate income to support herself. She sells food such as lunches and breakfasts. Among her menu items are sancocho [a traditional soup], sudado [a stew], bandeja paisa [a traditional entree], soups, noodles, and typical dishes from the Antioquia region in general.

For her work, Elizabeth uses her kitchen's implements; she produces only what her own pots can fit. This is counterproductive because her business is growing, but because of a lack of capital, she hasn't been able to buy equipment and ingredients to improve her production.

For this reason, Elizabeth wants to request a loan to buy pots, frying pans, and ingredients because she wants to increase her production by 200% to increase her income. This is sustainable because of her demand.

Elizabeth makes all this effort with her family's education and economy in mind. Help her -- she needs you.

loans.use: to buy pots, frying pans, and ingredients to prepare breakfasts and lunches. With the loan she will double her production.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is a married woman with 8 children and she describes herself to be competent.  She operates a farm where she keeps cows which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a dairy cow.  Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have stable income. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to establish a stable business

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is a married man and has 3 children. He operates a retail business where he sells Agrovet products. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.  He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of Agrovet products. His business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have stable income. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of Agrovet products to have a stable business

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is 52 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, coffee, etc.

Emerita has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell dried fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, coffee, etc

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Paz successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Paz's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell in order to build her business

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is a father of two school-aged children and a beloved husband of his wife. The family happily lives in Haykadzor village of Shirak region and is engaged in agriculture.  Artyom, with the help of his wife, runs a big farm with cattle (4 cows, 10 calves, 42 sheep, 3 pigs and 15 piglets) and also cultivates wheat and barley. 

Artyom cultivates both his own land and also 22 hectares of rented land. He sells the gathered harvest in nearby markets and gets income for his family's living. To be able to boost agricultural production and invest some funds on the farm, Artyom has applied for this loan. He plans to purchase forage for the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation. 

Because the region where Artyom's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. His loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF International and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Karla Ivonne

texts.es:
Alegre, trabajadora y siempre agradecida, Karla es una excelente mujer de negocios. Ella nació en 1977 en la Ciudad de México, en donde vive con sus padres y hermanos. Ella vende accesorios para mujer como joyería, bolsas, carteras y agendas a sus conocidos, familia y amigos. 
Además de su negocio, Karla es psicóloga y ofrece terapia en su propia casa. Tiene planeado abrir una boutique en los siguientes meses para incrementar su cartera de clientes, así como sus ingresos. Karla está solicitando un préstamo por MXN 5,000 para invertir en nueva joyería de chapa de oro y de fantasía en grandes cantidades para expandir ampliamente su catálogo. 
Con este préstamo ella tendrá mayores ingresos que le permitirán cumplir uno de sus mayores sueños desde pequeña: tener una fundación para apoyar a la pobreza en México. Karla está muy agradecida con Kiva, Konfío y los prestamistas que han confiado en ella para continuar cumpliendo sus metas. 
Es una mujer muy responsable que siempre está a tiempo en sus fechas de pago. Al terminar su segundo préstamo con Konfío, le gustaría solicitar otro para que su negocio continue creciendo.
texts.en:
Cheerful, happy, and always thankful, Karla is an excellent businesswoman. She was born in 1977 in Mexico City, where she lives with her parents and siblings. She sells women's accessories like jewelry, blouses, purses, and agendas to acquaintances, family, and friends.

In addition to her business, Karla is a psychologist and offers therapy from her own home. She is planning to open a boutique in the coming months to increase her clients and her income. Karla is seeking a loan of MXN 5,000 to invest in new gold-plated fancy jewelry in large quantities to amply expand her catalogue.

With this loan, she will increase her income, which will allow her to complete one of her greatest dreams since she was young: to have a foundation to help the poor in Mexico. Kara is very grateful to Kiva, Konfio, and the lenders that have confidence in her to continue accomplishing her goals.

She is a very responsible woman that always is on time with payments. At the end of her second loan with Konfio, she would like to seek another to help her business continue growing.

loans.use: to invest in plated gold and imitation jewelry

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Orbelina de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas y vende pupusas los fines de semana lleva 8 años en el negocio la cual lo inicio con capital propio, con las ventas que realiza logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilo de seda y cascarillo por mayor para elaborar las hamacas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor estabilidad de vida.
texts.en: Orbelina is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her four children. She works making and selling hammocks, and sells pupusas on weekends. She has had this business for 8 years, after starting it with her own capital. With her income she is able to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy silk thread and string wholesale, so that she can make more hammocks and thus earn more income and have a more stable life.

loans.use: to buy silk thread and string wholesale

loans.name: Justa

texts.es: Doña justa de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos nietos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, también al comercio de frutas y verduras, lleva 5 años trabajando en esa actividad la cual inicio con capital financiado, con las ganancias que obtiene es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra chicharron, quesillo, maíz, frijoles, etc. todo por mayor y poder tener mejores ganancias para darle a sus nietos una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Doña Justa, who is 55 years old, lives in a house that she owns with her two grandchildren. She earns her living selling "pupusas" [thick handmade corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat, and or beans], as well as by selling fruits and vegetables. She has been working in this business, which she started with borrowed capital, for five years. With the profits she earns, she is able to cover some of the household expenses. 

Justa is requesting a loan for the purchase of "chicharron" [fried pork], "quesillo" [a soft white cheese], corn, beans, etc., all at wholesale, in order to have better earnings so that she can give her grandchildren better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy "chacharron" [fried pork], quesillo [a soft white cheese], corn, beans, etc., at wholesale

loans.name: Nhóm 02_Thôn 7_Đông Anh_Đông Sơn. Group

texts.en:
Mrs Vốn works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Vốn is 50 years old and she is married with 3 children. Vốn is the group leader of the Nhóm 02_thôn 7_Đông Anh_Đông Sơn. solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

In 2011, Vốn joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Vốn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Vốn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Vốn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and seedlings.

loans.name: Sayat

texts.en:
Sayat is from the village of Tsoghamarg, where he lives with his wife. His only son is a migrant worker who left Armenia with the hope of finding a well-paid job to help sustain his parents.
 
Sayat runs a farm where he cultivates barley and grass. He also raises animals, including cows, calves, sheep, and hens. His wife helps with the farm and they both work hard to earn income to pay their living expenses. 

Sayat is applying for a loan to purchase fodder to feed his livestock, fertilizer, and fuel for his farm. The region where Sayat lives is poor, the unemployment rate is high, and people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. 

Sayat's loan has been approved by the joint initiative between SEF International and Kiva. The initiative provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them to access credit and improve their living standards. Sayat is a hardworking farmer and hopes to receive support to improve his farm.

loans.use: to pay for fodder, fertilizer, and fuel for his farm

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 45, is a married woman and has five children. All of her children attend school. 

Rebecca is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past three years, she has operated a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Currently, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell

loans.name: Moussokoro's Group

texts.fr: Moussokoro qui se trouve sur la photo assignant avec le drapeau de n'gasene, est membre d’un groupe de 9 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de N'Gouraba au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Moussokoro, âgée de 45 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 10 à 30 ans, dont 5 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son mariage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Moussokoro à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Moussokoro cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Moussokoro entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Moussokoro effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Moussokoro cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Moussokoro planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme et d'acheter du matériel agricole comme . Enfin Moussokoro espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Moussokoro, who is holding the banner of N'Gasene in the photo, is a member of a group of nine farmers registered with myAgro. They live and work in the village of N'Gouraba in the southeast of Bamako, Mali. Moussokoro, aged 45, is the mother of eight children aged between 10 and 30 years, of whom five are presently enrolled in school. 

The fact that the family's tradition is anchored in agriculture, the principle source of income and food self-sufficiency for the household, as well as being married to a farmer, moved Moussokoro to practice this activity for 30 years now. Moussokoro grows peanuts and rice on her plot but as a farmer she is faced with difficulties such as the lack of rain and of agricultural supplies. She is beginning her second year with myAgro, and she re-registered because of the system of payment and the high quality seeds and fertilizer. 

This year Moussokoro is making payments to buy a myAgro package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanuts so as to increase the yield on her plot of 0.0625 hectare. Moussokoro has been growing peanuts for 20 years now for their commercial value, since peanuts are a foodstuff she sells at the market. She also grows them because they help her earn well. 

Moussokoro plans on the increased yield and increased income to be able to raise livestock and buy agricultural supplies. Finally, Moussokoro hopes to be able to cover school fees for the children as well as ensuring food self-sufficiency for her family.

loans.use: to buy herself a package of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Sitivin

texts.en:
Sitivin is age 38 years, and a resident of Mijjunju, Kabila in Rakai district. He is married with seven children, all of whom attend school and he takes care of his grandmother. He carries out a business of farming where he grows passion fruits, which he started in 2009 with the aim of improving on his daily income.

He works six days of the week and 10 hours per day and he wants a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to buy organic manure for agriculture. He says that his clients are residents and people from the surrounding areas, especially those from Kampala.

Stivini’s aim is to have a wide range of passion garden so as to cater for his children’s well being. However, his challenges are lack of enough capital to expand the garden, seasonal changes, and competition. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man and appreciates the lenders for always offering him the facility whenever he needs it.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 50-year-old widowed mother of four. Twenty years ago, she started helping her husband in his grocery shop to cover the increasing needs and expenses of their beloved children. After the death of her husband, she decided to manage the grocery shop alone for she became her family's only breadwinner. 

Souad is well-known for her good reputation. She works hard and trys to develop her business. She requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new products and items to satisfy her customers' special requests. 

Souad hopes to expand her business and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new products and items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase lumber and fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrows and brick making equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, so as to assist her in milk supply to gain more income.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 16 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Nhiễu is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future. She works in agriculture raising poultry.

Nhiễu is 59 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 8-member group, the Nhóm 01 Thôn 16 Quảng Lưu group. Nhiễu lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhiễu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nhiễu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nhiễu hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Jelimar

texts.en:
Jelimar is a 33-year-old father with a good heart who wants a good future for his family. 

He manages and owns a transportation business.  His wife  manages a sari-sari store. He wants a higher income and decided to ask for financial assistance from GDMPC to purchase parts for his motorcycle.

Jelimar wants to buy another motorcycle and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase parts for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mortada

texts.en:
Mortada is a client from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married, and has one child. 

Mortada owns a small workshop to repair motorcycles. He established his business in 2006 after gaining experience while working in other places. He became well-known in the surrounding area. 

Mortada requests $2,400 USD to pay the annual rent for the shop. He wishes to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for the shop.

loans.name: Oscar Rene

texts.es:
Oscar, practica la crianza de ganado, cultivo de granos básicos y brinda servicio de transporte, inicia cada día trabajando en la ganadería y realizando trabajos agrícolas, posteriormente dedica el resto del día a realizar viajes a diferentes puntos de su localidad, según sea la petición de sus clientes; Oscar es un hombre que tiene una familia integrada por su esposa y una pequeña hija de 4 años de edad.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de ganado y concentrado para alimentarlo, aumentará el inventario de su negocio, está trabajando muy duro para que su ganadería sea tan grande como antes, ya que tuvo dificultades y el número de cabezas de ganado ha disminuido mucho.
Sus expectativas son  seguir mejorando su negocio para tener recursos económicos necesarios para mejorar su vivienda y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Oscar works raising cattle, farming staple grains, and providing transportation services. He begins each day working with the cattle and farming. Afterwards, he works the rest of the day taking trips to different parts of town, according his clients' requests. Oscar’s family is made up of his wife and 4 year old daughter.
He will use the loan to buy cattle and grain to feed them. He will increase his business’s inventory. He is working very hard so that his cattle will be as numerous as they were before he experienced difficulties that decreased the head of cattle a great deal.
He hopes to continue improving his business so that he will have the necessary economic resources to improve his home and pay his debt.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and grain to feed them.

loans.name: Edgar Naveli

texts.es:
Edgar, es una persona que se destaca por su compromiso y responsabilidad en su comunidad, actualmente vive con su compañera de vida, aún no tiene hijos, ni cuenta con familiares en el extranjero, su fuente de ingresos es atender una tienda de productos de primera necesidad con ayuda de su esposa y además ofrece el servicio de transporte de personas en un pick up, su mayor ventaja es que la tienda está ubicada en un local propio y el negocio de transporte lo atiende personalmente.
Está solicitando un crédito para invertir en su negocio, comprara aceite, huevos, pan, golosinas, bebidas, azúcar, etc., y dará mantenimiento al motor del pick up, será de ayuda para mejorar su posición económica y para tener más clientes satisfechos. Los riesgos son la competencia, inseguridad ciudadana y posibles accidentes en la carretera. 
Su objetivo es mantenerse trabajando para tener en un futuro un negocio mucho más rentable, permitiéndole tener ingresos económicos necesarios para cambiar su estilo de vida familiar y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Edgar is a person who stands out in his community for his commitment and responsibility. He lives with his life partner. He doesn’t have any children yet, nor does he have relatives abroad. His makes his income with the help of his wife running a grocery store that sells basic necessities; he also offers transportation services in his pick up truck. His biggest advantage is that he owns the location where he has the store and he personally runs the transportation business.
He is requesting a loan to invest in his business buying oil, eggs, bread, sweets, drinks, sugar, etc., and he will maintain the engine of his pick up truck. This will help him improve his financial position and have more satisfied customers. The risks are competition, lack of public safety, and possible accidents on the road.
His goal is to keep working to have a much more profitable business in the future, enabling him to have the income necessary to change his family’s lifestyle and pay off his debt.

loans.use: to buy oil, eggs, bread, sweets, drinks, sugar, etc., and to maintain the engine of his pick up truck.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old, married, and blessed with three children who are all attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 to benefit from training, especially on enterprise development and financial management.

She practices poultry and vegetable farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy chicken feed to improve production of eggs, and hence earn more income.  This will enable her to meet her family's expenses like food, clothing and school fees for her children, with ease. She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed to improve production of eggs, and hence earn more income to meet family expenses like food, clothing and paying school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fruit & vegetables

loans.name: Marco Geovanny

texts.es: Marco de 29 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 5 años logro instalar una peluquería con sus ahorros, lo cual le permite salir adelante y tratar de brindar todo lo mejor a su compañera de vida. Él vive junto a su compañera de vida desde hace 5 años. Marco es feliz con su negocio de peluquería pero además buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos a comenzado a dar clases, pero no cuenta con el mobiliario necesario, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: un sillón reclinable para su negocio de peluquería y brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marco is 29 years old and he is a hard-working man. He managed to set up a hairdressing salon with his savings 5 years ago. This allows him to get ahead and to try to give his life partner all the best. He has been living with his life partner for 5 years.

Marco is happy with his hairdressing business. But, since he is seeking ways to obtain better income, he has also started to teach. However, he does not have the necessary furniture. That is why he is requesting FUSAI a loan to invest in a reclining chair for his hairdressing business and provide his clients with greater comfort.

loans.use: to invest in a reclining chair for his hairdressing business and provide his clients with greater comfort.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Minh Hải Group

texts.en:
Luyến is 57 years old and she is married with three children.

Luyến works in agriculture, raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Luyến faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2014, Luyến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 05 Minh Hải solidarity group.

With her business profit, Luyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Tuy Thôn Trung Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Hồng is 29 years old and married with two children. Hồng is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Tuy Thôn Trung Chính solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2015, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hồng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hồng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Bonifasi is 32 years old, single, and has been blessed with one kid who is still in school. He has been a businessman managing his family by running a general shop together with a cosmetics business. He sells rice, cooking oil, sugar, bar and powered soaps, salt, baking flour and maize flour, etc. He has been in this venture for five years now, working from 7am to 9pm daily with the ability to generate a small profit. 

In order to grow his business and be able to sell more varieties of products, Bonifasi approached Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner, to request financial support. This is his third credit request. All of his previous loans have been paid back in full. He used the previous two credits to buy shop stock as demanded by his customers, such as rice, soft drinks, toothpastes, sugar, baking flour and maize flour. He is really a hardworking man dreaming of improving his family's living conditions. He used the extra income received to cover school fees and health and meal costs for his family. 

Bonifasi will use this portion of the loan to replenish his shop with new products to raise sales. He will share this loan with his group, Mpunga, which consists of two members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish his shop with new products to raise sales.

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.en:
Ziyoda is a hardworking and goal oriented person. She was born in a rural area in 1992. She is living in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is single and lives with her parents. She cares about her parents and wants to do business in order to help her big family. Her grandmother is old and she is sick. The conditions of living in their family are poor. Her family has an activity in agriculture. She was taught from her childhood how to plant vegetables and fruits, and she has experience to do this by herself in the future. Recently, her family planted potatoes and they keep livestock. 

Her father was a teacher, and in order to feed his family he started to do business with trading livestock. Ziyoda is interested in supporting her father and wishes to have her own business with livestock. She is planning to buy livestock to keep, feed, and trade in the animal market. She appealed to IMON to get a loan and buy livestock. They have hills and grazing areas where she can feed and walk the livestock. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock to keep, feed, and trade in the animal market.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en: Angelica is from the town of Matag-ob, Leyte.  She is 26 years. For three years, her business of a Sari-sari store keep her occupied and allow her to earn a living to help her husband who is a farmer. She sells household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan of 10000 PHP to buy feed, rice and soft drinks. These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. With a loan, Aneglica is confident that her sari-sari business will be more prosperous. She will use her profit for food and reinvestment.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock in her business to sell.

loans.name: 070003.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future.

Dung is 40 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 030206070003.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, and has 2 dependents

In 2014, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. Elvira is married and has a printing press business in the Philippines.

Elvira requested a PHP 11500 loan through NWTF to buy additional cloth, yarn and other materials for her business.

Elvira has been in this business for 15 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth, yarn and other materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweet bread, french bread, toast, etc., each time that she goes out to sell.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 54 years old and married with  two children.

She has grown rice for 7 years and  is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a married woman, with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Winfred operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Siti. Siti lives in South Bogor, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. 

Siti owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and provides mobile payment services for her community.  As a woman, Siti realized that she has to help her husband to improve their life. That's why she decided to join Ruma.

As the business grows, Siti needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. 

Siti’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to offer an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Siti is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a 23-year-old married woman with one child.
She grows bananas. Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, she acquired skills in enterprise development, financial management, savings and resource mobilization. She has been able to improve her farming and get improved quality products from the farm. She can earn more profits from the local traders within the area.

She can take good care of her family. Rhoda is borrowing  to expand her farm by buying  seeds and fertilizer. She anticipates a bounty harvest and therefore,  more income.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Pai's Group

texts.en: Pai is 42 years old and a widow woman, living in a rural area of Prasat Balang district, Kampong Thom province. To earn money to support her family, she distills alcohol for sale and feeding pigs an additional source of income. She has been involved in this business for more than five years and earns her about 44,700KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Due to her village has no electricity to use, so she wants spend her loan portion to buy solar lamp in order to lighted her house. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions through this loan.

loans.use: to buy solar lamp

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Prasat Balang district

loans.name: Tsiatsan

texts.en:
Sunny  lives with her husband, father-in-law, son, daughter-in-law and a 1-year-old grandson. 
The family  is involved in farming. 

Besides running their own farm with cattle and crop cultivation, Tsiatsan, her husband, and son are also gather products from the forest and sell it in local markets. 

Tsatsan has applied for this loan to invest in her farm. She wants to purchase a horse and feed the livestock.
 The horse will be used to transport products from the forest. 

This is Tsiatsan's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from a local financial institutions, was very difficult to repay, and Tsiatsan faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her recent hard work, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover monthly payments. 

Tsiatsan has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase a horse and forage.

loans.name: Ikromjon

texts.ru: Икромчон житель города Худжанд. Он семейный человек. Ему 43 лет. Икромчон вместе семьей живет в городе Худжанд. У него трое детей. Дочке 18 лет. Сыновьям 19 и 12 лет. Старший сын и дочка учиться в университете. Младший сын школьник. Его жена работает учительницей русского языка  в школе.  Икромчон честный и ответственный человек. Он занимается мастером ремонта стол – стульев, диван и кресло у себя дома. Ему в работе помогает сыновья. Икромчон 10 лет своей жизни занимается этой деятельности.  Он обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить материалы и инструменты для ремонта. Поддержите Икромчон достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Ikromjon is a resident of the city of Khujand.  He is 43 years old and he has three children: a daughter who is 18 and two sons who are 19 and 12.  The family lives together in Khujand.  His oldest son and daughter are university students.  His youngest son is still in school.  His wife works as a Russian teacher in a school. Ikromjon is an honest and responsible man.  He works as a carpenter from home and repairs tables, chairs, couches and armchairs.  His sons help him to run the business.  Ikromjon has been involved in this activity for the past ten years of his life.  He is taking a loan to buy new tools for his business.  Please support Ikromjon, so that he can achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy tools for carpentry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра 60 лет. Она живет вместе с сыновьями и их дочерями. Ее муж скончался, ей было тяжело пережить смерть мужа, но она нашла в себе силы, жить дальше ради детей и внуков. Зухра дома занимается животноводством. Она покупает мелко рогатых скотин, откармливает их в течение определенного времени и после перепродает с наценкой. Таким не хитрым образом она зарабатывает на жизнь. Зухра хочет расширить деятельность и купить еще несколько голов телят за счет заемных средств. Она будет благодарна, если Вы ей сможете помочь.
texts.en:
Zuhra is 60 years old. She lives with her sons and their daughters. Her husband has passed away. It was difficult for her to endure her husband's death, but she has found strength in herself to live on for the sake of her children and grandchildren.

Zuhra works in animal husbandry at home. She buys small horned cattle, fattens them up for a certain period of time, and then resells them for a premium. In this simple way she earns a living.

Zuhra wants to expand her business and buy a few more calves with the help of borrowed funds. She will be thankful if you are able to help her.

loans.use: to buy cattle and to expand her livestock business

loans.name: Ana Maribel

texts.es: Ana de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas, lleva 18 años realizando esa actividad de la cual ha podido salir adelante con su familia ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos de seda de colores por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ana is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She has been working for 18 years making and selling hammocks, and has been able to support her family with this activity. She is requesting a loan to buy colored silk thread wholesale, so that she can continue working and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy colored silk thread wholesale.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
It is challenging to be young and starting a new family with a small parcel of land in the Nyamira area of Kenya. Violet, a mother of one, has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past two years. 

Violet, an ever-smiling farmer, has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans that farming is for the older generation. She passionately loves dairy farming and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. Violet's primary source of income has been selling eggs, crops, and milk. She also has a posho mill business to supplement her meager income.

Violet wakes up early and milks her cows. The humble mom has been selling milk to her neighbors and the local market. She is known for having the best quality milk and through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Currently, she has more demand than she can supply. 

Violet is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients. A dairy cow will produce between 10 and 20 liters of milk daily. This will allow her to satisfy the demand for her milk. Violet attended training sessions and learned financial management skills through Kiva's field partner, Juhudi Kilimo. This loan will help her save money to fully repay the loan and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alicia is 28 years old, and one of her children is still in school.
