Alicia has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Alicia requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Alicia has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Li

texts.en:
Li is 37 years old and married with two children who are both in school. Her husband is a construction worker. Also, she has to take care of her mother-in-law who is ill and has had to stay in bed for years. Li owns a small shop and sells a kind of native food called “Guo Kui”. The shop is nearby a school. Most of her clients are students from the school. It does very well and can support her family.

Li requested CNY 2,000 from Microcred Nanchong. She will use the money to decorate her shop and make it look more beautiful and attractive. She believes that her clients will be more and more, and in the future, she can give her children a better education.

loans.use: to decorate her shop.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba, comprendió que era necesario tener una actividad económica propia para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, se decidió por vender frutas y verduras, con el paso del tiempo su clientela ha ido creciendo; su núcleo familiar está compuesto por esposo y tres hijos, todos le ayudan en el negocio cuando tienen tiempo libre.
El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en  melones, sandias, yuca, papas, zanahorias, limones, papayas, entre otros; surtirá más su negocio con productos frescos y abajo precio, para aumentar sus ganancias.
Sus sueños son crecer con su negocio y utilizar las ganancias para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y pagar su deuda.
texts.en: When Alba realized that she needed income in order to assist her husband with the household expenses, she decided to sell fruit and vergetables. With time, the number of customers for her business has grown. Her family is made up of her husband and three children, all of whom help her with her business in their free time. The loan will be used to buy melons, watermelons, yucca, potatoes, carrots, lemons, papayas, and other products, to better supply her business with fresh products at low prices and thereby increase her income. Her dream is to grow her business and to use her income to pay the household expenses and to pay her debt.

loans.use: to buy melons, watermelons, yucca, potatoes, carrots, lemons, papayas, and other products, to better supply her business with fresh products at low prices.

loans.name: Abadu

texts.en:
Abadu is 26 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school.  For the past 5 years, Abadu has been working hard to manage his produce sales business. 

To help expand his business, Abadu has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more produce to sell, and will help Abadu generate greater profits and expand through additional stock.  Abadu hopes that in the future he will be able to operate a good business.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell.

loans.name: El Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo El Amanecer se formó en la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, ellas están trabajando y se ayudan para poder mejorar sus vidas.
La Sra. Fátima es la presidenta del grupo, ella es Vendedora de Ropas para Damas, tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos, ya que es muy buena en las ventas. Fátima es una persona que se esfuerza mucho y quiere poder ir creciendo y mejorando para poder ayudar a su  familia por medio de su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para dama, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group El Amanecer [The Dawn] was formed in the city of San Ignacio. They are united and supportive of one another. They work together and help each other in order to improve their lives. 

Señora Fátima is the president of the group. She sells ladies clothing and has a very good clientele that orders a lot from her, because she is very good at sales. Fátima is a person who puts forth a lot of effort and she wants to be able to keep growing and improving so she can help her family by means of her work.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy assorted ladies clothing with which to continue in clothing sales and fighting to improve the conditions of her life.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoelaces, soles, thread and shoe glue, and hoping this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Candida

texts.es: Con 67 años de edad Candida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en maíz por mayoreo y construcción de bodega para almacenarlo, ya que ha observado que este negocio tiene una excelente demanda y ella desea aprovechar para aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Ya que vive junto a su esposo y siente que cada día les es más difícil salir fuera de su casa a ganarse la vida. Candida además se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos, que consisten en lavar y planchar ropa de forma domiciliar, pero ella está cansada y quiere poner este negocio para salir adelante.
texts.en:
At 67 years of age, Candida is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in wholesale corn and construction of a warehouse to store it. She has observed that this business is in high demand and she wants to take advantage of that in order to increase her income. 

She lives with her husband and feels that every day it gets harder for them to go out of the house and earn a living. Candida also works in domestic service, which consists in home based washing and ironing of clothing, but she is tired and wants to start this business in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to invest in wholesale corn and construction of a place to store it.

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Nam Sơn 2,nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa has a retail business selling cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. Hoa has been involved in this business for four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell.

Hoa is 44 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Hoa is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Nam Sơn 2, Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hoa has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Sidra

texts.en:
Ma. Sidra is 47 years old and married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Sidra has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Ma. Sidra requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell. Ma. Sidra has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Ma. Sidra would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Delia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en:
Özlem is married and has one child.  She has been an Amway (cleaning equipment) representative for five years.  She says that she has gone through many good stages since she started this activity.  Her social environment has widened and her income increased.  

With the help of her 3rd loan from Maya, she is planning to purchase Amway products in bulk,  thus to increase her profit.  In the future she wants to promote and become a group leader.  Her dream is to enable her child to have a good education and provide a good  life.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Özlem hanım evli ,bir çocuk annesi.  Beş yıldır amwey(temizlik malz.)ürün satışı yapıyor.  Bu işe başladığından beri çok güzel aşamalar geçirdiğini söyledi.  Sosyal çevresi  genişlemiş,kazancı artmış.  Aldığı üçüncü kredi ile tekrardan toplu amway ürünleri alıp satacak.  Toplu aldığı için daha fazla kar elde edecek.  İleride işinde yükselip grup lideri olmak istiyor.  En büyük hayali çocuğuna iyi bir eğitim aldırıp iyi bir gelecek sağlamak.

loans.use: to buy Amway products in bulk in order to resell

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишер молодой мужчина 30 лет, женат, отец троих детей.  Вот уже на протяжение 10 лет Алишер занимается земледелием. На своем участке земли в 20 гектаров Алишер выращивает виноград всех сортов. Алишер любит свою работу и хорошо ухаживает за своим участком земли и урожаем. Во всех его делах ему помогает жена. Алишер весь свой урожай отвозит на рынок для продажи. Товар выращенный с любовью продается очень быстро. Также Алишер из винограда сам изготавливает целительные напитки. В настоящее время он хочет расширить свой бизнес, купить удобрения для почвы. Но у него нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Благодарит за поддержку и содействие.
texts.en:
Alisher is a young man of 30 years old, married, a father of three. For 10 years now, he has been a farmer. On his land lot of 20 ha Alisher grows all sorts of grapes. He loves his work and takes good care of the land and harvest. His wife helps Alisher with everything. 

Alisher takes all of his harvest to the market for sale. The produce grown with loving care sells very well. Sometimes Alisher uses grapes to make healing mixtures. He currently plans to expand his business and wants to buy fertilizers. But he doesn’t have enough money, which is why he turned to MDO Arvand for financial support. Alisher is grateful for your support and cooperation!

loans.use: to expand the area of business

loans.name: Saroth's Group

texts.en: Saroth’s group live in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. Saroth works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Keno

texts.en:
Keno is a 24-year-old vocational graduate, and lives in Pulupandan. He belongs to a family of seven. Keno is the youngest in the family, and he’s living with his grandparents. His grandfather is a pensioner and his grandmother is a housewife. He has five siblings and four are married. Keno worked before in Superferry, a shipping company, for a year. Their total monthly family income of PHP 10,000 ($225) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. 

Apart from helping his family, Keno wants to learn about the BPO industry, to have a higher income, and to become successful in his career. Your generosity in funding his loan so he can enroll in Bagosphere's training program, will help Keno have a better income in the coming months.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly.

loans.name: Tuhtajon

texts.ru: Тухтаджон молодая женщина. Ей 24 года. Она заботливая невестка в семье. Тухтаджон  выросла в рабочей семье. С детстве она была  очень старательная девочка, всегда помогала маме по хозяйству. В школе она училась очень хорошо.  Но из-за недостатков в семьи она не смогла поступить в ВУЗ. После замужества она поняла, что в рыночной экономике нельзя сидеть сложа руки и тратить те деньги которые зарабатывает муж. По этому она стала  помогать мужу. Она очень трудолюбивая и старательная женщина. Она вместе с мужем откармливает и ухаживает за крупно рогатым   скотом . Вот уже 5 лет она занимается этим делом вместе с мужем. В этом году она хочет приумножить крупно рогатый скот. Но при этом у Тухтаджона есть финансовые трудности. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО “Арванд” за кредитом. На полученный кредит она планирует  купить скот и корм. Она выражает свою благодарность Арванду за содействие и оказанию помощь для улучшения её жизни.
texts.en:
Tuhtajon is a young woman. She is 24 years old. She is the caring daughter-in-law in the family. Tuhtajon grew up in a working family. From childhood she was a very diligent girl, always helping her mother around the farm. In school she was a very good student. However as a result of lack of funds in her family, she was not able to enter a higher education institute. 

After marriage, she realised that in a market economy, she should not sit back twiddling her thumbs and wasting the money which her husband earns. She is a very hardworking and diligent woman. Together with her husband, she fattens up and cares for livestock. She and her husband have been in this business for 5 years. 

This year, she wants to increase the number of livestock. However, at the same time Tuhtajona has financial difficulties. Thus she has turned to MDO Arvand for a loan. Upon receiving the loan, she plans to buy cattle and feed. She expresses her gratitude to Arvand for facilitating and providing assistance to the improvement of her life.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Gitwe Support Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Margaret, 37 years old, a widow, and living with her two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 with an aspiration to be trained and to be able to gain economic and social power. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to improve her farm output.  Margaret is very grateful to Kiva, as it will help her expand her farming and thus be in position to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds that will improve her farm output.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Korotoumou est la femme   au milieu tenant dans ses mains la corde attaché au mouton.
Agée de 33 ans, Korotoumou est une éleveuse de moutons alphabétisée en langue nationale, mère de 05 enfants dont l’ainé à 17 ans et 02 sont scolarisés 03 non scolarisés. Son mari est un cultivateur ,elle est dévouée dans l’élevage de ses moutons , n’ayant pas les moyens financiers nécessaires pour mener son activité ,elle fait recours à l’IMF pour avoir plus de l’argent pour pouvoir acheter plus de moutons et d’aliment bétails. Elle gagne  de profit.  Elle rêve subvenir aux besoins de la famille tel que : la sante , l’éducation le revêtement  .
Elle s’approvisionne dans les foires de la localité en moutons et après  avoir les élevés bien elle les vend aux comptants tous en réalisant un bénéfice de 60000fCFA par cycle de prêt.

NB:les personnes supplementaires sont membres du groupe mais n'ont pas pris de l'argent a ce prét ci.
texts.en:
Korotoumou is the woman in the middle of the photo holding the rope attached to the sheep. She is 33 years old and raises sheep. She is literate in her native tongue and mother to five children, the eldest of whom is 17 years old; two of the children are at school while the other three are not. Her husband is a farmer and Korotoumou is committed to raising sheep. Since she does not have the financial means to carry out her activity she is turning to IMF to have more money to buy more sheep and food for them. She makes a profit. She dreams of being able to provide for her family's needs: for their health costs, education and clothes. She gets her supplies of sheep in local fairs, and once she has raised them she sells them for cash, making a profit of 60,000FCFA per loan cycle.

N.B. the additional people in the photo are group members but have not yet drawn down any money from this loan.

loans.use: to by sheep to sell.

loans.name: Druscillah

texts.en:
Druscillah is 45 years old and supports a family of four members.  She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last 15 years earning an income of KES 13,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family health care. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en: Carmencita is 61 years old. She has one daughter who is 21 years old. They live in Badian, Cebu. Carmencita is engaged in raising goats and hogs for a living. She also farms rice for additional income. This business started when she first had her child. She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and feed to keep her hogs healthy. Carmencita hope to expand her business and live in abundance and comfort in her old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and feed for hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for increased milk production

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a 26 years old, married and has one child to support.  She wants to help her husband by engaging in a transport business with the help of her husband, whose is the person driving their motorcycle. 

Jelly wants to increase their income so she decided to borrowed a loan to buy motor parts for motor maintenance.

Jelly plans for the future to invest in another business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Fernandita

texts.en:
Fernandita is 55 years old, married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Fernandita has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of household goods to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell young coconut business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of young coconuts to sell for her business.

Jenalyn has been in this business for six years. She also earns more income from farming vegetables. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of young coconuts to sell for her business.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José es un hombre sonriente y trabajador de 63 años de edad, que desde hace más de 20 años tiene su taller de reparación de vehículos funcionando gracias en gran parte al profesionalismo, buen servicio, cordialidad, amabilidad, humildad y precios que tiene José en su taller.
José desde que fundó el taller ha tenido buenas noticias, pues junto con este llegaron sus dos hijos que ya son adolescentes y están aprendiendo el negocio familiar.
José quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tener un negocio estable y con excelentes maquinaria porque en pocos años llegara el momento en el que ceda todo su imperio a sus hijos.
En el momento José quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de repuesto de vehículo, el préstamo será muy importante ya que con estos repuestos el taller seguirá su comportamiento normal y tendrá un equilibrio, evitando pasar percances a futuro.
texts.en: Jose is a smiling, hard-working 63-year-old man. He has had an auto repair shop for more than 20 years, thanks to the professionalism, good service, humility and good prices that he offers. Jose has done well since he started his business, and now his two adolescent sons have joined him and are learning the family business. Jose would like to improve the condition of his house, and have a stable business with excellent machinery, because in a few years he will be handing the business over to his sons. Jose is requesting a loan now to buy auto parts. This loan is important, because the parts will allow him to continue operating normally, have stability, and avoid future mishaps.

loans.use: to buy auto parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Oday

texts.en:
Oday is a client from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children. Oday is a barber. 

He established his business in 2012 after gaining good experience while working as barber in different hairdressers shops. He became well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. 

Oday is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy a generator and an air-conditioner. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a generator and an air-conditioner, so as to provide his family with better living conditions

loans.name: Xua's Group

texts.en:
Xua, 26 years old, is an Thai ethnic man. He lives with his wife and his two children, one daughter and one son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

His family’s main income is from from cultivation and animal breeding.  His annual income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and he has saved a small amount. Unfortunately, his second son has a tumor on his neck.  Xua does not have enough money to pay for an operation for his son. Therefore, he wants to take a loan to pay for an operation.
 
He will work hard to get the money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time, and he hopes that the loan amount will help his son have an operation on time and bring his son good health and a brighter future.

loans.use: to take a loan to pay for an operation on his son

loans.name: David

texts.en:
The person in the photo is David who is 25 years old.  He is a banana farmer.

Through Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training, he has acquired skills in enterprise development, financial management, savings and resource mobilization. He has been able to improve on his farming and get improved quality products from his farm which has enabled him to earn more profits from the local traders within the area .This has enabled him to improve his  living standard and take good care himself.

David is borrowing Kiva loan so that he can be able to expand his farming by buying farm inputs such fertilizer and seeds and introduce other farm produce which are marketable in the area to earn more profit and increase his income. 

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds that will boost farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of retail home products for resale at a profit.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 54 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Betty requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Betty has been farming rice for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his shop and buy an air conditioner

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and certified maize seeds for planting in her farm for a better harvest for sale and family use

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 39 years old, married and had three children. She is managing a retail store while her spouse is a farmer.

She runs her store daily and is selling grocery items to the people in her village. Marilou is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy grocery items (canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and breads) to sell. Marilou will continue selling grocery items with affordable prices and friendly services, too. 

Marilou hopes to continue saving funds for education purposes. She will be happy to see her children become successful in their chosen career someday.

loans.use: to buy grocery items (canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and breads) to sell

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina is 55 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Peregrina has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Centre Development Project Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is David, 58 years old, married and a father of two children.

He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2011 to gain entrepreneurial skills through enterprise and financial management training. He is a farmer who specializes in maize and banana farming. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production, hence increasing his income.

He will be able to pay school fees for his two kids and provide basic needs for the family. David is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer that will increase farming production and thus boost income that will help provide for the family

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
María s una valiente y guerrera mujer de 40 años de edad, una madre soltera cabeza de familia que diariamente sale a vender su mercancía en las calles del centro de Medellín, donde hay una fuerte competencia y solo los perseverantes logran sobrevivir a la denominada jungla de concreto.
María trabaja para que su hijo pueda estudiar, para pagar la cuenta de los servicios públicos, el alimento, para vivir bien, siempre ha vendido ropa de bebe, accesorios estudiantiles.
María quiere solicitar un préstamo, este le ayudara a diversificar su oferta teniendo para ofrecer camisas, camisetas, blusas, faldas, siendo su negocio el principal beneficiario pues tendrá una amplia variedad de surtido que de seguro atraerá nuevos clientes y le aumentara considerablemente las ganancias a esta madre ganadora.
texts.en:
María is a 40-year-old brave and fierce woman. She is a single mother, head of the family, that goes out daily to sell her merchandise on the streets in the center of Medellín, where there is strong competition and only the persevering manage to survive the so-called concrete jungle.

María works so that her child can study, to pay the public services' bill and for food, and to live well. She has always sold baby clothes and student accessories. 

María wants to request a loan. It will help her diversify her supply by having shirts, t-shirts, blouses, and skirts to offer, its business being the main beneficiary as it will have a wide variety of assortment that is sure to attract new customers and significantly increase earnings for this winning mother.

loans.use: to diversify her supply by selling shirts, t-shirts, blouses, and skirts.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 47 years old, married to Barnabas and they are blessed with 7 children. 
She has been a livestock farmer for the last 7 years. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow so as to supply her customers with milk and meet their demands in milk supply.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children to higher levels of education. 
Her future hopes are to be able to buy more dairy cows and be financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow so as to supply her customers with milk and meet their demands in milk supply.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a responsible, protective, and vigilant mother of three lovely children. She has been able to support her family thanks to her mixed farming business. With it, she has built her home and has overcome the economic adversities that have presented themselves to her. She always works to improve her quality of life and to provide a better education to her children who see in their mother a great heroine who works and works for their well-being. 

For 10 years Lucy has been a mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Lucy, however, is taking this a little step further. Lucy is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming so as to be able to expand her business

loans.name: Bewin

texts.en:
Bewin is 47 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Bewin has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop and buy and sell vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 45 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Prima works very hard to provide for them.

Prima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Prima has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Prima would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Messias

texts.pt: O Senhor Messias vive numa casa propria com a esposa e filhos, mãe e um neto.  É polícia, com o presente empréstimo vai adiquirir uma máquina fotocopiadora para serviço de cópias na sua residencia. Tem sonho de adquirir gado bovino para reprodução e produção agrícola.
texts.en:
Messias lives in his own home with his wife, children, mother and grandson. He works as a policeman. 

With this loan Messias will purchase a photocopier to provide a photocopying service from his home. His dream is to acquire cows to breed and to use for agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier to provide a photocopying service from his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow so as to supply her customers with milk and meet their demands in milk supply.

loans.name: Sandra Lee

texts.en:
Sandra Lee is 39 years old and has eight children.  Sandra Lee is married and has six children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Sandra Lee requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to by additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sandra Lee has been raising pigs for 7 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sandra Lee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mauricio Wilfredo

texts.es:
Mauricio, comparte su vida con su compañera de vida y dos hijos de 10 y 3 años de edad, para generar ingresos don Mauricio se dedica a sembrar maíz, desde aproximadamente 4 años, su cosecha la divide en dos partes una para alimentación familiar y la otra para venderla, de esa manera obtiene los ingresos que utiliza para cubrir otras necesidades de su hogar, el oficio lo aprendió gracias a su padre.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar abono, semilla de maíz e insecticidas, tendrá todo listo para iniciar a trabajar en esta temporada,  tiene las esperanzas de que sea un buen invierno para que la cosecha sea abundante y así lograr tener una mejor situación económica.
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando y que sus hijos tengan oportunidad de estudiar en la universidad.
texts.en:
Mauricio shares his life with his partner and two children ages 10 and 3.  For a living, Mauricio has worked growing corn for about four years.  His harvest is divided in two parts: one for his family to eat and the other to sell.   In this way he obtains the income that he uses to cover the household expenses.  He learned this work thanks to his father.

He needs the loan to buy fertilizer, corn seed, and insecticides.  With this he will have everything ready to start working this season.  He hopes for a good winter so that the harvest will be abundant and his finances will be better.  His dreams are to continue working and for his children to have the opportunity to attend university.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, corn seed, and insecticides.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
A Felismina é casada maritalmente de 3 filhos menores de idade,com idade escolar,tem  mais 2 pessoas na sua responsabilidade,vive na casa propria não só depende do negocio de venda de marisco tem também o seu  esposo que lhe ajuda em despesas da casa.
Com o dinheiro do emprestimo vai comprar barco para reforçar o os que ja tem.
O seu sonho é densevolver mais com a sua actividade ter mais barcos maiores do que os q possui ,construir uma mercearia e mais uma casa no outro bairro para os seus filhos bem como pagar escola para os mesmos .
Os principais desafios, cuidar dos seus meios de trabalho,espandir os seus negocios,ter mais clientes  e tornar-se  fornecedora de grandes hoteis.
texts.en:
Felismina is married and has three young children who are of school age. She also takes care of two other people. She lives in her own home. She sells seafood, and her husband also helps with household expenses.
She will use the loan to buy a boat to supplement the ones she already has.
Her dream is to develop her business and have bigger boats. She would also like to build a grocery store and another house in another neighborhood for her children as well as pay for their education.
Her biggest goals are to maintain her work tools, expand her business, attract more customers, and become a supplier for large hotels.

loans.use: to buy a boat to supplement the ones she already has.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.pt:
A Sra. Arminda tem 36 anos de idade, casada, mãe de um filho que estuda. Para além do filho, sustenta os seus familiares.
Com o empréstimo de 25,000.00 meticais, pretende comprar mantas, lençois, duvetes para revender.
O seu  sonho é concluir a sua casa para acomodar a sua familia.
O desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Arminda is 36 years old, married and the mother of a son who is studying. As well as her son, Arminda also supports her relatives. 

With a loan of 25,000 meticais Arminda plans to buy blankets, sheets and doonas to resell. Her dream is to finish building her home so she can accommodate her family. Her challenge is to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets and doonas to resell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a charismatic and helpful mother of 6 children, the great desire to see them all grow up to be professionals is what fills Susan with enthusiasm and inspiration. Susan is 38 years old and works tirelessly to raise animals. Through these humble tasks, she aspires to offer all of her children a university education. 

Susan learned to do farm work at a young age, thanks to her parents. She has a tiny plot of land to live off – just under half an acre – and has always struggled to support her family. For over twenty years her income source has been from selling milk, poultry, keeping sheep and vegetables. She supplements the meager income by doing other personal business or as she likes to put it a “side hustle”. 

Susan passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part for her of farming. She is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Milk, poultry and vegetables are very perishable, and these products require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that she faces is delivering to the market on time. 

Kitale area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Susan is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. Farmers like Susan will use the motorbike to transport passengers and farm goods to and from the market. They are suited for areas with poor road networks which are inaccessible by cars. They are also very cheap to acquire and maintain. 

Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport farm produce to the market.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena works hard to support her family. Azucena is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, coffee, chips, bread, etc.

Azucena has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, shampoo, coffee, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Tagoneswa Group

texts.en:
The Tagoneswa group recently joined the Thrive programme and consists of five women who are in different income generating projects but who know each other well and share the same business philosophy of hard work and forming a close knit group that provides mutual support.

Pumuzani is the chairlady of Tagoneswa group from Highfields in Harare. She started business as a gateside tomatoes vendor after her husband stopped working. Her small business grew to a small vegetable stall also selling snacks and refreshments at the local market. The small profits she was making enabled her to support her small family and apply for a passport. After the acquisition of her passport, Pumuzani added cross-border trading to her business. After hearing about Thrive, Pumuzani and her friends formed Tagoneswa group. They joined the Thrive programme and benefited a lot from the training made available to them. She believes that what she has learnt will make her a better businesswoman.

With her Kiva loan, Pumuzani is looking forward to growing her cross-border business and increasing her chicken batches from 100 at a time to 200 chickens.

loans.use: To increase her stock of broilers.

loans.name: Judith
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Yeyep

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Yeyep. Yeyep lives in West Bandung, located in West Java, around three hour’s drive from Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and his son. He owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone credits for his community. He knew Ruma from the sales executive who is coming to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well give more contribution to his community. Yeyep is a really hardworking guy who loves his family and his community sees him as a trusted mobile service provider. 

As the business grows, Yeyep is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Yeyep improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

As seen in the photo, Yeyep is the one who is in his store.. He is very thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Senhora Albertina tem 40 anos de idade, solteira, mãe de 2 filhos frequentando o ensino secundário, é agente de serviços e não sustenta mais ninguém.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de chapas, barrotes, material de instalação eléctrica, para dar continuidade a construção da sua casa.
No futuro pretende concluir a construção da sua casa visto que agora vive em casa da sua prima e está ansiosa em ter casa propria.
O seu maior desafio é terminar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a solicitar mais financiamentos como forma de lograr mais rápido seus projectos.
texts.en:
Albertina is 40 years old and single. She has two children who are in secondary school. She's a service agent and doesn't support anyone else.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase metal plates, beams, and electrical supplies so that she can continue building her house.
In the future she intends to finish building her house, since she currently lives with her female cousin and she's eager to be a homeowner.
Her biggest challenge is repaying the loan without delinquency. That way she'll apply for more loans as a way of accomplishing her projects faster.

loans.use: to purchase metal plates, beams, and electrical supplies so that she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Dinis

texts.pt:
O sr Dinis é separado, pai de cinco filhos dos quais três estão na sua responsabilidade e os dois estão nos seus lares. Vive na casa própria que está em construção, com o empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: chapa de zinco, cimento, blocos e portas para dar a continuidade da sua obra.
O seu sonho é concluir a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para ajudar nas pequenas machambas que tem, porém, o desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Dinis is separated and the father of five children of whom three are under his care and two live in their own homes. Dinis lives in his own house that is under construction.

With this loan Dinis plans to buy building materials such as zinc plates, cement, blocks and doors to continue with his renovations. His dream is to finish building his house and buy a vehicle to help with his work in the small agricultural fields he owns. His challenge is to repay his loan.

loans.use: to buy zinc plates, cement, blocks and doors to continue with his renovations

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is 28 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 1 year, Amin has been working hard to manage her retail shop. 

To help expand her business, Amin has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy juice, sugar, bread, sodas, detergent, and water, and will help Amin to generate greater profits and increase her standard of living. Amin hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy juice, sugar, bread, sodas, detergent, and water.

loans.name: Sedress

texts.en:
Sedress is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She has two children who are all currently in school. For the past 11 years, Sedress has been working hard to manage her retail shop.  

To help expand her business, Sedress has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cooking oil, basins, jerrycans, cups and plates, detergent, juice, Vaseline, sweets, curry powder and other items. and will help Sedress to generate greater profits and improve her business. Sedress hopes that in the future, she will be able to earn profits.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, basins, jerricans, cups and plates, detergent, juice, Vaseline, sweets, curry powder and other items.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with none currently in school. 

For the past one year, Beth has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells general household materials. 

To help expand her business, Beth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more household materials, and will help Beth to generate greater profits and meet day-to-day family needs. 

Beth hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more household materials

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Tomasa Elizabet

texts.es: Tomasa de 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella posee un taller de costura y tambien a la venta de ropa, cuenta ya con mas de 4 años de experiencia y comenzó con capital propio, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con sus dos hija, ella esta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa pro mayor y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y seguirle dando una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 36 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two daughters. She owns a sewing shop and also sells clothing. She already has more than four years of experience. 

She started out with her own capital, and thanks to her work she and her two daughters have been able to get ahead. She is seeking a loan to buy more clothing at wholesale. With it she will be able to continue with her work, which makes her a good income, and continue to provide her daughters with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Gueume Sa Bopp Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit » Gueume Sa Bopp » de l’association ALLAW, vient pour la première fois solliciter un crédit pour renforcer l’activité de ses membres au nombre de cinq. 
Madame Codou est la responsable du groupe, elle s’active dans la vente de poisson frais depuis 2 ans. Elle a démarré avec l’appui de son époux qui lui a remis une somme de cinquante mille francs qu’elle a fructifié petit à petit. Elle achète le poisson chez les pécheurs à un prix abordable, qu’elle revend sur la plage avec une marge bénéficiaire. Elle est active dès 8h jusqu’à 13h et l’après midi de 15h à 20h. 
Codou est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’ainée est un garçon âgé de 12 ans et le cadet, âgé d’un an seulement. Codou participe à la dépense quotidienne en s’occupant de ramener du poisson pour les repas. 
Comme projet d’avenir, Codou désire avoir sa propre maison et appuyer ses enfants dans la progression de la vie.
texts.en:
The ALLAW association's Gueume Sa Bopp loan group is asking for their first loan to bolster their five-person business.

Madame Codou is in charge of the group. She has been selling fresh fish for two years. She started with the support of her spouse who gave her 50,000 francs that she turned into profit bit by bit. She buys fish from the fishermen for a reasonable price and then resells the fish on the beach for a profit margin. She works from 8am to 1pm and then from 3pm to 8pm. 

Codou is married and has five children—the oldest is a 12-year old boy and the youngest is just one year old. Codou helps with the weekly expenses by bringing fish home for meals.

In the future, Codou wants to have her own house and support her children as they go through life.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming tools to help increase production

loans.name: Bernette Catherine

texts.en:
Bernette Catherine is 41 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Bernette Catherine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Bernette Catherine has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other groceries. 

In the future Bernette Catherine would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Providing jobs, increasing available crop output, buying a home, paying for his children’s education – these are just some of the things going around Josphat’s mind. Josphat is a 33-year-old, smallholder farmer based in Kericho, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Rift valley. He owns a small piece of land together with his lovely wife, and they have been blessed with a lovely family. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for 7 years. Their main income sources are milk, sheep farming and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business, or side hustle, as they like to put it. 

From Kiva lenders, Josphat is seeking a loan worth KES 20,000 to buy seedlings and grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

 It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Josphat access to a loan that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Josphat’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a small dairy and poultry farmer dying to get his hands on the horticultural market. He is a father and has been doing crop farming for subsistence purposes. He also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for his cow. He also engages in a side hustle business, "timber business". 

Kenneth is seeking a loan to grow more crops on his farm. With the steady increase in demand for horticultural products in Kenya over the last few years, having more crop produce to offer at the end of the season will make Kenneth's investment worthwhile. The loan money will enable him to buy seeds and fertilizer, transport them to the farm and to pay for the cost of labour.  Income from dairy will be used to make initial loan instalments. 

The profits will be ploughed back into the business to fuel growth. His increased income will uplift the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To grow more crops on his farm

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Josephine has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Even though her small income keeps the family living in poverty, she still claims the position of breadwinner in the household. 

From Kiva lenders, Josephine is seeking a loan worth 30,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business.
Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Josephine access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Josephine’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seed and grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus, a progressive farmer from Molo, has been doing dairy farming for the last five years. He is particularly passionate about dairy farming. His main sources of income are milk, eggs and other personal business. 
 However, he says the major challenge to dairy farmers in his area is lack of quality breeds of animals. 

Justus is seeking a loan to purchase a good quality dairy cow. This cow produces more than 20 litres of milk daily. Milk sold from this cow will provide Justus with a significant amount of income on a daily basis and enough to clear the loan repayments on time. 

Justus has a clear business plan. Juhudi Kilimo smallholder farmers’ microfinance has been very encouraging and supportive to such progressive farmers. We want his farm to be an example to other farmers who have potential but are constrained by funds. 

Justus says the extra income he will generate will enable him to save enough money to buy a pedigreed dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a good quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her tailoring business, to generate revenue to feed families

loans.name: Bafili's Group

texts.fr: Bafili qui se trouve sur la photo tenant les deux cartes en main, est membre d’un groupe de 5 agricultrices inscrites à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Semana au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Bafili, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Bafili  exerce  cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Bafili cultive l'arachide, le maïs sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Bafili  entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Bafili effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Bafili cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur alimentaire et commerciale. Bafili planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Bafili espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Bafili (the woman holding 2 cards in the picture) is a member of a group of 5 farmers who are enrolled with myAgro and who live and work in the village of Semana, in the south east of Bamako in Mali. Bafili, who is 50 years old, is the mother of 4 children, none of whom attend school. Bafili has been in this line of work for 30 years and was motivated to be a farmer because farming is a long held family tradition (it is the primary source of revenue and enables a household's food self-sufficiency) and she wanted to be able to ensure her family's food self-sufficiency. Bafili grows groundnuts and maize on her plot of land but, as a farmer, has to face problems like lack of rain, a lack of agricultural equipment and a lack of good quality fertiliser.

Bafili is starting her first year with myAgro and enrolled because of the payment system, the good quality seeds and the good quality fertiliser. This year, Bafili will be making payments for a package of myAgro OPV (Open Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertiliser for groundnut production, so that she can increase the yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot of land. Bafili has been growing groundnuts for 30 years for their nutritional and commercial value. Bafili plans, thanks to an increase in output and income, to keep doing business. Finally, Bafili would like to be able to build a family home.

loans.use: to buy a package of OPV seeds and fertiliser.

loans.name: Finess Group

texts.fr:
Kadia est la femme au milieu tenant entre ses mains les ballais, oignons, et une boite de tomate concentrée.
Agée de 52 ans, Kadia est une malienne mariée mère d’un (01) enfant âgée de 20 ans et 02 petits fils âgée de 07à 10 ans dont  les deux  sont scolarisés, elle est alphabétisée en langue nationale. Son mari est un cultivateur.
Kadia n’ayant pas  d’argent pour acheter assez: balaie, savon, et condiment, elle  fait recourt à l’IMF pour avoir plus d' argent pour exercer au mieux son commerce de balaies, savons et condiments..
Elle s’approvisionne dans les foires locales et urbaines en  utilisant les fonds pour acheter plus de : ballais, savon, condiments et après elle  les  revend aux comptants à des prix acceptables tout en possédant une méthode de vente  exceptionnel et rentable, elle exerce cette activité depuis 10 ans pour subvenir aux besoins familiaux tel que : la sante, l’éducation, et le revêtement.  Avec le prêt accordé par l’IMF elle a eu des changements positifs dans l’exercice de son commerce. Elle réalise un bénéfice prévisionnel  mensuel de 15000f soit  90000f par cycle de prêts.
texts.en:
Kadia is the woman in the middle holding brooms, onions, and a can of concentrated tomato.

Aged 52, Kadia is a Malian mother of one, aged 20, and two grandsons, 7 and 10, both of whom attend school. She is illiterate in the national language. Her husband is a farmer.

Kadia, not having enough to buy brooms, soap, and spices, is applying to IMF to have more money to improve her business of selling brooms, soap, and spices.

She stocks up at the local and urban fairs using funds to buy more brooms, soap, and spices, and afterwards, she sells them for cash at reasonable prices, while using her profitable sales method. She has been running this business for 10 years to meet the needs of her family, such as healthcare, education, and clothing. With this loan from IMF, she has had positive changes in her business. She earns a projected monthly income of 15,000 – 90,000 FCFA per loan cycle.

loans.use: to buy brooms, soap, and spices to resell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 58 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. She is a farmer and has been in this business for the last 27 years.

She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds for use in her farm and hopes to get better farm produce for sale when harvest time comes and get more income to support her family.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her hope in future are to expand her farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds for use in her farm and hoping to get better farm produce for sale when harvest time comes.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like bread, soft drinks, coffee, spices, eggs, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pigs.

Tessie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like bread, soft drinks, coffee, spices, eggs, etc

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a smallholder dairy farmer from Tirap division in Kenya which is widely known for livestock farming. Pastoral communities dominate this part of Kenya. Among pastoral communities, human lives are lost and thousands displaced annually due to cattle rustling raids. Livestock farmers from this area take initiative of protecting their homes and properties. James wants to build a proper fence around his home and farm. However, he is in need of external financing to buy wires and poles and to pay for the labour required to dig a foundation for each pole. 

James is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to fence his land. The fence will not only offer protection but also control animal movement and avoid disputes with neighbours. 

The fence constructed with your loan will give James and his family a sense of security which is invaluable in areas like the one where they live. Having some peace of mind will free them to focus on more important and progressive things like business and education.

loans.use: to fence his farm.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Christine, a very industrious, honest, and hardworking woman from the Chuka area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya. 

Christine, 35, has been farming for the past 10 years. Over this time, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She practices mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, vegetables, and other various crops, as well as some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. 

Christine is kindly seeking for a loan to buy pigs and start pig farming. Through the loan she will be able to raise pigs and in the long run she will be able to sell pork to her neighbours and to the ready market that is there. She will also benefit from manure hence saving her costs that she used to incure buying manure. 

Kindly support this Kenyan farmer with a loan!

loans.use: To buy pigs to expand her farming activities

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy solar dryers to enable her to dry and process natural foods for sale.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.pt:
A Sra. Lucia é separada, mãe de três filhos dos quais uma está na sua responsabilidade e os dois estão nos seus lares.
Ela vende frutas no mercado e com o empréstimo de 15,000.00 meticais, pretende reforçar o stock comprando papaias, pera, horta e outros produtos.
O seu sonho é abrir mais estabelecimentos comerciais na sua comunidade, prosperando assim no seu negócio. Ela enfrenta dificuldade no transporte da sua mercadoria sendo que a aquisição de uma viatura seria útil na aceleração da sua actividade e o seu desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo
texts.en:
Lucia is separated and the mother of three children of whom one is under her care and two live in their own homes.  

Lucia sells fruit at the market and with a loan of 15,000 meticais she plans to stock her business by buying papayas, pears, vegetables and other items.

Lucia's dream is to open more commercial establishments in her community to make her business prosperous. She has difficulty transporting her merchandise so acquiring a vehicle would be helpful to increase her business activity. Her challenge is to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy papayas, pears, vegetables and other items

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 49 years old, widowed and has one child to provide for. She has engaged in rice production for ten years already and it was a successful business because they gets their daily requirements and financial needs from this business. 

She aims for a higher income so she decided to take a loan to purchase fertilizer for the rice farm, to produce a good harvest and gain more income from the rice production.

Julieta wants to invest in other businesses

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plots for farming for more production and supply in the area.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a pottery in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like general store.

Ruth dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Ayşe Alparslan

texts.en:
Ayşe is a Quran teacher in the department of religious affairs.  She works on contract.  In her free time, she works as an Amway(cleaning equipment) representative.  She has been doing this for four years.  First she started selling the products to her relatives and neighbours.  She developed her sales by making door-to-door visits.  

With the help of the loan from Maya, she is planning to purchase products in bulk and thus increase her profit.  She wants to promote them by increasing the number of her customers.  She wants to help her children and her family with her own income. 


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Ayşe  Hanım diyanette Kur’an hocası.  Sözleşmeli çalışıyor.  Arta kalan zamanlarında Amway(temizlik malz.) ürünleri satıyor.  Dört yıldır Amway satışı yapıyor.  Çevresine ,aile çevresine satarak işe başlamış.  Dolaşarak ürünlerin tanıtımını yaparak işini ilerletmiş.  Aldığı kredi ile toplu ürün alıp kar payını arttıracak.  Daha çok müşteriye ulaşıp işinde kademe atlamak istiyor.  Çocuklarına ailesine kendi kazancı ile bir şeyler yapmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy Amway products in bulk and then retail them

loans.name: Hamed

texts.en:
Hamed is a 26-year-old single man who opened an auto repair business almost two years ago, specializing in maintaining car's wheels and oil to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious and independent man who is working so hard to develop his business.

Thus today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary maintenance tools to facilitate his work and provide his customers with quick service. 

Hamed hopes to expand his business more in the future, to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy the necessary maintenance tools to facilitate his automobile work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm implements and farm inputs so as to get a better harvest this season and meet client and family demands.

loans.name: Justice

texts.en:
Justice is applying for a loan to support his studies for a year at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University(MERU). This is his story: 

1.  What do you study at the Maharishi Institute? Which classes do you enjoy the most?
I am studying a BA Management degree, specializing in sustainable development and nature conservation. I enjoy algebra, consecration ecology, business communication and marketing. 

2.  What are your goals after graduating from the Maharishi Institute? Please be specific: in which sector do you expect to work? In which city would you like to work? Would you like to travel?
I would like to work in sales and marketing. I also want to own my own company that specializes in providing sustainability solutions for the private sector and individual households. I intend on staying in Johannesburg and I wish to travel the world and learn from different cultures.

3.  Tell us about your background. Where were you born? Do you have brothers and sisters? What do your parents do for work? Are you married; do you have children?
I was born in a small town (Barberton) in Mpumalanga province. I come from a family of 14, with one brother who passed away. My brothers and sisters are unemployed. My father is a driver and my mother is a teacher. I worked in construction because I couldn’t afford to further my studies and I left to pursue my goal of getting a degree.

4.  What do you like to do in your spare time?
I like to learn new things to better understand the world around me. I also love listening to, and making, music. I also work on a number of projects aimed at youth empowerment.

5.  How will a Kiva loan change your life? Describe how the loan will affect your studies and your lifestyle: will there be significant changes?
A Kiva loan will help me in my studies and help me with my daily expenses as I live far from home. My parents have to support my siblings and their children and often struggle to support my studies financially.

loans.use: To pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at Maharishi Ezemvelo Rural University (MERU).

loans.name: Lisandro

texts.es:
Lisandro es una persona muy recursiva y creativa que pone a favor todo su conocimiento y busca la manera de ponerlos a producir.
Lisandro adquirió a lo largo de su vida muy buenas habilidades para elaborar productos de panadería, gracias a experiencias y trabajos anteriores, y ahora vende pasteles de jamón y queso, de ariquipe, de guayaba ambulantemente, el mismo los fabrica y se encarga de venderlos.
Lisandro trabaja con la mentalidad de generar empleo, tener vendedores y que este cuento genere utilidad, porque pone en juego la estabilidad de su hogar, por ello pone tanto empeño e importancia a lo que hace.
Lisandro Quiere solicitar un préstamo con la firme intención de contratar a un vendedor que le ayude a cubrir un mayor territorio, la idea es construir otro estantería para vender panes, y comprar surtido para realizar pasteles.
texts.en:
Lisandro is a very resourceful and creative person who takes all of his knowledge and looks for ways to apply it.  During his life he has become very skilled at making baked goods, thanks to his past experiences and jobs.  He now sells pastries with ham and cheese, dulce de leche, and guava.  He sells them as a mobile vendor, and he makes and sells them himself.

He works with the goal of creating jobs, to have salespeople, so that he can generate a greater profit.  It is because his family's financial stability is at stake that he puts such effort and importance into what he does.  

He wants to request a loan with the firm intention of hiring a salesperson to help him cover greater area.  The idea is to build another display shelf to sell his bread from, and buy ingredients to make pastries.

loans.use: to buy a display shelf and ingredients to make baked goods.

loans.name: Reno

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it's time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Reno. Reno lives in West Bandung, located in West Java, about three hour’s drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He owns a small stall where he sells mobile phone credits and provides mobile payment services for his community (like electricity and water bills). He lives there with his wife and his 9 year old son. His wife works in a factory near their house. Reno knew Ruma from the sales executive who is coming to his stall. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business, as well as to give more contribution to his community.

As the business grows, Reno is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the loan to provide more mobile payment services for his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Reno improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. 

He is very thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communications and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Vagoni Vebasa Group

texts.en:
As the night fades like a scene from a theatre production, a woman named Naume is already unpacking her new stock of groceries and arranging them in the shelves of her small neighbourhood shop. She is ready for the daily line up of customers as they rush to buy food for their morning breakfast. When her morning customers are off to their daily work, Naume leaves her shop and attends to her one hundred hens, picking up eggs, feeding them and giving them fresh water.

Just like many Zimbabweans in Harare, Naume has mastered some skills of being a good salesperson, and has developed a good relationship with her customers and in some cases has even sold some groceries on credit. She also closes her shop late at night when the big supermarkets are closed. Her business has been going well as she spent her third loan on chicken feed, drinks and popular food stuffs. 

She plans to build a brick and mortar shop to protect her from the rain and expand her fowl run to accommodate more chickens comfortably. Just like her group members, Naume is willing to sacrifice her own comfort and finances so that her family enjoy opportunities she never had. 

Together with her group members, they hope that a loan from Kiva will help them achieve their goals and keep their children in school for as long as they want to study.

loans.use: To expand her chicken accomodations into a brick house to protect them from bad weather and also increase the flock

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 20-year-old married man from Dora, a village near Hebron city. He works as a construction worker where he gets a low and unstable income. Islam would like to start a new business. He decided to open a small grocery store in the village.

Islam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy grocery products and kids' candy for his new business. This provide him with a higher income and a stable life.

Islam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and kids' candy for his new business.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everline is 30 years old, married and blessed with 2 children. She has been selling shoes in the market for the last 3 years.
 
She will be using this loan to purchase more stocks of shoes for sale in the market so as to meet the demands of clients as well as to make more income.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to buy more shoes for sell and also start a grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of shoes for sale in the market, so as to meet the demands of clients, as well as make more income to support her family.

loans.name: Nilgün

texts.en:
Nilgün is married and has a child. She works as a volunteer in a foundation. She also makes various handicrafts with recycled materials and felts. This year she attended wooden-painting courses and started making and selling wooden handicrafts. She made trays, picture frames and also renewed old coffee tables and sold them. She sells her products to her neighborhood. She makes a good income and she says it makes her very happy to do what she does and make money from it, and that her handicrafts are very much appreciated and liked.

With the help of her second loan from Maya she is planning to purchase materials, especially wooden materials.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nilgün Hanım evli ,bir çocuk annesi. Bir vakfıta gönüllü olarak çalışıyor. Aynı zaman da iki yıldır geri dönüşüm meteryallerle ,keçelerle çeşitli ürünler yapıp satıyor. Bu sene gittiği ahşap boyama kursunda edindiği bilgilerle ahşap boyama da yapıp satmaya başladı. Çeşitli tepsiler, çerçeveler,eski sehbaları tekrar yenile yaparak çeşitli ürünlerinin yanında bunları da satmaya başladı. Çevresine satış yapıyor. Yaptığı işten çok zevk alıyor bunun yanında maddi olarak kazanc elde etmek ,ürünlerinin beğenilerek alınması onu mutlu ediyor. Aldığı ikinci kredi ile ahşap ağırlıklı olmak üzere tekrardan malzemeler alacak.

loans.use: to buy materials, especially wooden materials, for her business.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза жизнерадостная женшина. Она родилась в рабочей семье. Ей 28 лет. Она мать одиночка. После развода с мужем  воспитание ребенка легло на плечи матери. Дилноза мужественная. Все трудности жизни она преодолевает своим сильным характером. Для того чтобы достойно вырастить ребенка она стала искать работу. Но достойную работу не нашла. Так как у неё не было диплома. После этого она открыла свой бизнес, арендовав магазин по продажа напитков. Продажа напитков самый разгар в летние жаркие дни. Для этого Дилноза хочет расширить ассортимент напитков. Но у нее появились финансовые трудности. С целью расширения своего бизнеса она обратилась в МДО Арванд за кредитом. Получив кредит она расширила ассортимент напитков.
texts.en:
Dilnoza is a joyful woman, born into a working family. She is 28 years old and a single mother. After her divorce from her husband, the raising of their child fell on Dilnoza's shoulders. Dilnoza is courageous, and she surmounts all difficulties in life by way of her strong character. In order to raise her child properly, she began to look for work, but she could not find a suitable job because she did not have a diploma. After this experience, she opened her own business, renting a store to sell drinks. 

The sale of drinks is at its height during hot summer days. Because of this, Dilnoza wants to expand her selection of drinks, but has been having financial difficulties. In order to expand her business, she applied to MDO Arvand for a loan. With the loan she received, she expanded her selection of drinks.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell.

loans.name: Kina Intergated Farmers Group

texts.en:
Fred whose hand is raised up in a group photograph is a forty year old married man with four children living in Masindi-Uganda. He sells food stuffs like beans, rice and maize but also operates a motor cycle transport( boda boda).

He is a very hard working man and hopes to expand his business. He started this business in order to sustain his family and to educate his children.
He is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for selling and to sustain his family and educate his children

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia is 39 years old, married with three children. All of her children are attending school.

Virgenia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Virgenia has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Virgenia aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.pt:
Tem 30 anos de idade, mãe viúva de 1 filho menor que esta a estudar, vive na casa própria, tem nível primário, vive de negocio a mais de 5 anos, esta a repetir o credito pela 3ªvez  e todos foram investidos no credito e no aumento de bens de consumo em sua casa.
