Com o actual empréstimo pretende ampliar o seu negocio comprando: cervejas ( hunter`s gold e dry,windok, lite), agua mineral, refrescos, frangos, etc.
Ela tem o desejo de poder desenvolver mais o seu negocio, fazer os acabamentos da sua casa e comprar mais mobília.
.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 30 years old, widowed and a mother to one young son who is studying. She lives in her own home and completed primary school. She has made a living from a business for more than five years and is about to take out another loan for the third time. All of her loans have been invested in working credit and in increasing consumer goods in her home. 

With this loan she plans to expand her business by buying beer (Hunter's Gold and Dry, Windok, Lite), mineral water, refreshments, chicken, etc. She would like to expand her business further, finish her home improvements and buy more furniture.

loans.use: to buy different types of beer, mineral water, refreshments and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm implements and farm inputs for her farm, so as to increase her produce for a better life.

loans.name: Mecilinda

texts.en:
Thanks for your kindness and willingness to help, lenders. Because of your support previously to Mecilinda, she was able to improve sales from her small business, a sari-sari store. The income she got from this aided the family.

To resume the enterprise, she humbly asks for financial assistance through a loan worth 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). She would like to use this loan as additional capital for buying more quantity of merchandise like grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. It's a great response for her if you'll be affirmative regarding the matter since this business is the only means of the family in making a living.

She hopes that you will not get tired of helping other people like her, because through this scheme of helping, many lives are being changed and transformed for the better. She prays that her business will someday expand and that her children will finish schooling for them to experience a more convenient life. As of now, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha, 52 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past five years, Tabitha has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall. In the future, Tabitha would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet David. David is a progressive 25 year old farmer from Koibatek location which is found in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. David runs a farm business that produces milk and cereal grains. He also opened up a posho mill shop (pictured) to process cereals grains into flour. He spends most of his time these days in the posho mill to ensure the start-up takes off. 
Aside from normal business-related challenges, David's biggest concern is insecurity in Koibatek. David is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed and put a fence around his property. The cowshed will not only offer his cows protection against theft but also against harsh weather. This will improve his animals' welfare and productivity. The fence will also provide protection to his farmland and control animals from getting into or leaving his farm. 

Through your loan, the fence and the cowshed will bring peace to his home and give David peace of mind.

loans.use: to construct a fence for his farm

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Elkana.He is thirty years old, married and blessed with four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.
He grows maize and potatoes in his farming business. He is is happy for the entrepreneurship training that he received from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa which has helped him gain business knowledge and the skills of operating his business. 

He is borrowing a loan to purchase seeds that will improve quality of produce, hence enable him meet customers demand. The loan will raise his income which will enable him cater for his family needs with ease.

Elkana is happy for Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy seeds that will help boost farming thus more income to provide family needs with ease.

loans.name: Den Say Nor For Late Group

texts.en:
Mariatu is a member of Den Say Nor For Late. She is married with three children age eight, five and six months. Two are in primary school. (see group picture, Mariatu sits in the middle). “Den say nor for late” means "we must not be late". The women have named their group “Den say nor for late” because they are determined to repay their loan on time.

Five years ago Mariatu established her drink, rice and sugar business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profits she gets from the business. She sells six days per week from 10am to 6pm.

Mariatu plans to use the loan to buy crates of drinks, bags of sugar and bags of rice. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account which will be used in paying her children's school fees. Mariatu plans to give her children the best education, build a house and live a happy life.

Mariatu and her group members need a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which Mariatu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL. Mariatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy crates of drinks, bags of sugar and bags of rice.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Hello! Introducing Evangeline, a charismatic woman who is 25 years old and full of energy. She hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya, an area with good and favourable weather patterns that support farming. She is the mother of four children who are under her care from her marriage. 

Evangeline completed her secondary school education thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents, but never advanced. This never killed the spirit she has for succeeding in life. Evangeline has been farming for the past five years and through mixed farming, she has been able to take care of her family. She loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows Mutune (from a person's name). 

Although Evangeline passionately loves farming, she faces the challenge of water shortages. Most of the rainwater goes to waste, which is why she is seeking a loan to buy a water tank. Evangeline comes from an area where there is no piped water. Therefore this water tank will assist her to harvest water during the rainy seasons and also store water for home consumption. Harvested water will assist Evangeline to irrigate her farm, ensuring that there is a constant production of crops. 

This loan will turn around the life of Evangeline, as she will no longer have to walk for long distances in search of water, thus saving her time. Also through the loan she plans to build a modern dairy unit that will prevent her cows from being exposed to harsh weather conditions.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Annah has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Annah is a hard-working and honest smallholder farmer who hails from the Nyamira area of Kenya. She is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES from the wonderful Kiva lenders to buy seedlings and grow her horticulture business.

Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Annah access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Annah’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and grow her horticulture farming business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a thirty eight year old woman. She is married with three children. Her first born, a male is twenty years old and has just completed senior high school. Her second son is eight years and the last born is six years old. Rebecca sells sachet water in retail and wholesale quantities. She has done this business for three years and has been supporting her husband with income she makes for the upbringing of their children.

Rebecca needs this loan to buy more bags of water and sell it to increase her income. She believes this will help support her husband in paying for their oldest son's educational expenses after gaining admission into the University in September, 2015.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water and sell it to increase her income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to get more milk for supply to her customers and use the income to support her family.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, 41 years old, is married to Reuben and supports a family of 4 members. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 18 years, earning an income of KES 14,000 per month. 

Florence has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve her family's health care. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily and meet family and client needs.

loans.name: Jorna

texts.en:
You can now see Jorna. She resides in Caloocan City by now with her husband Romulo, who is a pensioner. Together, they run a small bakery for two years at the most. This bakery has been a good source of income for them most specially for aiding their daily expenses. 

With the fact, she would like to take out a PHP 50,000 loan to continue the operations of her business.  She would use this to buy more equipment that will be useful in her business.  Surely with the stuff, it would become easier for her to produce larger quantities of breads and increase profit. Thus, it would become a benefit indeed for the entire household. 

Nothing would matter now to Jorna except the good life that she dreams for her children. That is why, she is working very hard to provide and save for the children’s education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more equipment that will be useful in her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 33 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Alicia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Alicia has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anjielica Marie

texts.en:
Anjielica Marie is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school, Anjielica Marie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell .

Anjielica Marie has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Araqsi

texts.en:
Araqsi and her two sons live in Tsaghkavan village of Tavush region. They all run their farm, which includes piglets and hens and also arable land. They specifically cultivate wheat, corn, haricots, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions and garlic, and a large variety of fruit trees (plum, nut, apple and pear).

Araqsi's sons sell the gathered harvest in the market and this is the only source of the family's income.

As this is Araqsi's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Araqsi get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. She hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for six calves, two pigs, forage and partial renovation of the car

loans.name: Hatice

texts.en:
Hatice is married and a mother of two. She runs a bonneterie (haberdashery) and also teaches public educational courses in wooden painting. Hatice is planning to use her second loan to buy materials and paints for wooden painting and materials for her shop. She says that both teaching and running the store make her very happy. Her dream is to provide her children with a better future. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Hatice Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Tuhafiye dükkanı işletiyor.  Aynı zamanda halk eğitim kurslarında ahşap boyama öğretmenliği yapıyor.  Aldığı ikinci kredi ile tuhafiye ürünlerinin yanında ahşap boyama için gerekli olan meteryalleri ve boyaları alıp satacak.  Hep öğretmek hem de satış yapıp kazanç elde etmek kendisini çok mutlu ettiğini vurguladı.  Hayali çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlamak.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Eva

texts.pt:
Mãe de 3 filhos ainda a estudarem, 1 recentemente num emprego temporário, ela tem nível primário, vive na casa própria a base de negocio a mais de 10anos, conta com ajuda do esposo que trabalha como guarda numa repartição do estado, esta a repetir o credito pela 4ªvez, com os anteriores investiu no negocio, na melhoramento  de suas condições, comprou uma viatura que ajuda no negocio e realizou a cerimonia de casamento oficial.
Pretende com este comprar: alho,  feijão, cenoura,sal, etc, para revender.
Seu maior sonho é desenvolver mais o seu negocio, fazer acabamentos na sua residência, construir murro de vedação. 
Seu desafio é concentrar-se no seu negocio que tem tido altos e baixos devido a concorrência.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a mother to three children who are still studying, one of whom recently got a temporary job. She completed primary school and lives in her own home which has been the base of her business for more than ten years. She is helped by her husband who works as a guard for a government department. She is about to take out another loan for the fourth time after investing her previous loans in her business, improving her living conditions, buying a vehicle to help with her business and paying for an official wedding ceremony. 

With this loan she plans to buy garlic, beans, carrots, salt, etc. to resell. Her biggest dream is to further develop her business, do home renovations and build a retaining wall. Her challenge is to focus on her business which has gone through highs and lows due to competition.

loans.use: to buy garlic, beans, carrots, salt, etc. to resell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 57 years old, married and blessed with 6 children. He has been a farmer for the last 13 years and it has been profitable.

He will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and improved farm tools and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell to his customers.
 
He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and provide for his family's needs. His future hopes are to expand his farming business and be able to increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and improved farm tools and hopes this will enable him to grow more farm produce foe sell to his customers.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a mother with good heart who is always aiming for the best for her family. She has one child to provide for, so she wants to give what is the best for her child. 

So she engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn for living. She wants to increase her income so she availed a loan to purchase more goods for selling to increase her store inventory and generate more income.


Rita in the future, plans to expand her business to sustain her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Contribute now for Nena. Recently, she was granted a loan amounting PHP 10,000 which she used for improving her inventory. With heartfelt thanks, she would like to avail another loan worth PHP 20,000. This time, she will utilize this to add many grocery items for her sari-sari store business. 

Surely, this loan, if granted, will help sustain the family needs basically their main expenses for everyday living. She is hopeful that through your helping hands, she will be able to expand her trade someday. 

She simply prays for her family to be always in good health. She also wants to save for the education of her children, have an opportunity to get own stall and someday build their own house. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items that are needed in her business.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eliza is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Eliza has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Eliza requested a PHP 13000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Eliza has been in this business for three years. In the future, Eliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 58 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Azucena is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Azucena has been farming sugarcane for four years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her sugarcane business

loans.name: Quenny

texts.en:
Quenny is married and has six children, three of whom are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming citrus in the Philippines. Quenny requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Quenny has been farming citrus for 5 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Quenny would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is from Goris town where she lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and little granddaughter. She works as a local laboratory and is a doctor by profession. All her time after the work is devoted to the farm, which she has been running for many years. Natalya keeps livestock of two calves, two pigs and 12 piglets in her farm. She likes the job of pig breeding and organizes it with great care and love. 

Natalya has now applied for this loan to ask lenders to support her with purchasing more cattle for her farm. Natalya hopes to purchase  two cows and two pigs. 

As this is Natalya's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Natalya get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Natalya hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and two pigs and develop a livestock keeping business

loans.name: Saliha

texts.en:
Salİha is married and has a child. She used to sell flowers but she had to quit for private reasons. Now she is back to her job again, selling both real and artificial flowers. Salİha found a store and started running it with her two friends. Each person sells their own products and this helps lower everyone's expenses. With the help of her first loan from Maya, Salİha purchased lots of flowers. Her dream is to be successful in this business and open a bigger store on her own. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Salİha hanım evli,bir çocuk annesi.  Daha önceleri çiçek satış işi yapıyormuş ama bazı ailevi nedenlerden bırakmış.  Şimdi tekrar dan işine döndü.  Hazır çiçek ve yapma çiçek satışı yapıyor.  İki arkadaşı ile bir dükkan tutup satış yapmaya başladı.  Burada herkes kendi ürünlerini satıyor.  Böylelikle giderleri daha az oluyor.  Bizden aldığı ilk krediyi sermaye yapıp çiçek aldı.  Hayali işinde başarılı olup ileride kendine daha büyük bir dükkan açmak.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a 21-year-old single Syrian lady who started three years ago working as a tutor to cover her needs and expenses, as she is still continuing her studies. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who dreams a lot for a better future and she believes that none of her dreams will come true without holding a university certificate. Thus,  today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university tuition fees.

Hana hopes to finish her studies and open her own business to stay capable of satisfying her needs.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras frescas, clienta cuenta con más de un año de experiencia en las ventas la cual inicio con capital propio, vende todo el año y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor y asi poder tener mas mercadería para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Concepción is 35 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband and their three children.  She works selling fresh fruits and vegetables.  She has more than a year of experience and started the business with her own capital.  She sells all year round and the income she earns helps meet some of her household expenses.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables at wholesale so she has more merchandise to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 57 years old, married and has two children. 

Lucita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lucita has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Gyulnara

texts.en:
Gyulnara lives with her daughter and son in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Gyulnara is a pedagogue with many years of experience in this field. Both Gyulnara’s son and daughter are students. 

Her daughter studies at the State Medical University and her son studies at The State Economical Institute at the faculty of Social Financing. He studies at the distance learning division. Gyulnara mentions that she hardly covers her family’s needs and the fact that her both children study at the paid division is really great hardship for her. This loan of 660.000 Armenian drams Gyulnara asks in order to pay for her children tuition fees for the second semester (425.000 AMD for her daughter’s and 235.000 AMD for her son’s education).

loans.use: to pay for her children tuition fees in medicine and economics for the second semester

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 58 years old, married and has two children. 

Lucita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Lucita has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Lucita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Leo Xavier

texts.en:
Leo is a 39 year old hardworking married man with 3 children who lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the growing of bananas and coffee alongside waragi selling. He started these businesses with the intention of looking after his family. He meets a difficulty of low capital to buy manure and fertilizers. 

Leo is requesting for a loan to buy more fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is farmer from Artsvanik village in the Syunik region. She lives there with her son and daughter-in-law. 
Marine has been running a farm since she was young and is specialized in cattle breeding. The livestock which Marine currently keeps includes cows, piglets, calves and hens. Besides farming, Marine also works at a nursing home in the Syunik region. 

She has now applied for this loan to purchase three mother pigs and 130 chickens for the farm. As this is Marine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Marine get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Marine hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for three mother pigs and 130 chickens for the farm

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hardworking man who lives in Masindi-Uganda. He runs a retail shop that sells general merchandise 

He ventured into business on realizing that he needs a stable source of income to carter for his family and educate his children. He dreams of constructing rentals and improving on the family needs. Stephen will use the loan to buy more soap, sugar and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Neira Yola

texts.es:
Neira es una mujer de 35 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijas mujeres de 8, 9 y 14 años, y su negocio es la confección de edredones para cama. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Oeste de la ciudad, donde el comercio es la principal actividad, llegando a tener un movimiento económico superior a los 500 mil dólares por día. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Neira es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo hasta los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección de edredones para cama. Ella se ocupa de seleccionar el diseño de la tela, toma las medidas y procede a cortar, costura los bordes y esquinas, y la entrega a sus compradores, "la confección es un arte, cada día me inspiro y visualizo en mente un nuevo diseño y lo creo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que por los años de experiencia que tiene en el negocio cuenta con una cartera de clientes establecida, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para la compra de cortes de tela por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa de cama para vender sus propias creaciones, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de tela por rollo para la confección de edredones y cubrecamas para dormitorio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Neira solicita un préstamo para la compra de rollos de tela para la confección de edredones y cubrecamas para abrir una tienda de ropa de cama propia.
texts.en:
Neira is 35 years old, single, and has three daughters who are 8, 9, and 14 years old.  She works making quilts.  She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, tenacious, optimistic, responsible, and very hardworking.  Her business is in the western part of the city, where sales in the main activity, approaching financial movement of more than 500,000 dollars a day.  The climate is cold and dry and the temperature varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade.

Neira has brown skin, brown eyes, black shoulder length hair, and she is short with a medium build.  Her first language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family.  She speaks Spanish generally and at her business.  She shares her life with her children, who attend school.  They live in a room they own built of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof.  It has running water, electricity, and a sewage system.

She works making quilts for beds.  She selects the fabric design, takes the measurements, makes cuts, sews the borders and edges, and brings them to her buyers.  "Sewing is an art.  I am inspired every day and see new designs in my head and I believe it", she says.  The advantage of a business is that with her years of experience, she has an established set of customers.  The disadvantage is a lack of working capital to purchase lengths of fabric at wholesale.  Her dream is to open a bedding store to sell her own creations.  She wants to expand her business by purchasing rolls of fabric to make quilts and bedspreads.  

This is her first loan with the institution after eight years in business.  For these reasons, Neira is requesting a loan to purchase rolls of fabric to make quilts and bedspreads so she can open her own bedding store.

loans.use: to purchase rolls of fabric to make quilts and bedspreads so she can open her own bedding store.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en:
Colleta 34 years old is married to Alfred and supports a family of 3 members. She has been practicing small scale farming for the last 7 years earning an income of KES 9,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to improve her farming so as to raise more income to meet family demands. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and improve family health care. Her hope is to better her life.

loans.use: To improve her farming so as to raise more income to meet family demands.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik from the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region hopes to receive Kiva loan and Kiva support for her farm development. Here she lives with her husband and with her son’s family. She used to work as a tailor, but now she is busy with farming and agriculture which she manages with the help of her son. 

In her farm she has cows, calves, pigs, sheep and chickens. She sells milk, cheese, meat and eggs. Her agricultural activities are also a lot; on her plot of land she cultivates potato, tomato, cucumber and greens.  She sells these vegetables at the city’s wholesale market during the week. Hasmik mentions that she hopes in future her son will continue to enlarge her farm which she loves and cares very much. This loan she will use for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel owns a food stall in Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She has been operating the business for almost twelve years now. She has three children and is married to Jose, who is an operator. Whatever income she gets basically from her chosen trade she uses it for helping her husband in sustaining the family expenses. 

Filipinos are fond of eating heavy meals. Unlike some of foreign countries who are only used of eating breads for lunch or dinner, most Filipinos can’t afford to not eat rice with dishes during lunch and dinner. It is a big help to most when there are food stalls along the roads where they can eat without going home to just cook. This is the reason why Isabel has chosen to manage a food stall. Since food is always in demand, she earns a good profit from this. 

However, Isabel still wants to expand her business. She is asking a loan worth PHP 9 000. She will use this to buy more raw ingredients needed for the food she sells from her food stall. She wants to drive to you her sincerest thanks for your goodness and generosity by now. 

In the future, she wants her family to progress and improve as well as her current business. She prays that her family will always be free from diseases. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients needed for her food stall.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 33 years old, married and has three children. She's been in a sari-saris store business for three years already to earn a living. Her husband is working abroad, which is why she is the one who manages the business. She is still aiming to earn more income to provide for her children's needs. So she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the rice farm to have a good harvest.

Elvie wants, in the future, to improve their house with the profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for the rice farm.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a forty year old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  She practices the rearing of cattle alongside agriculture where she gets her extra income. With this, she has been able to sustain her family. 

She hopes to expand her cattle farm, however her main challenge is diseases that attack her animals and competition.

She is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for her farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for her farm.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah, a 63 year-old hard-working woman, lives in Masindi-Uganda. She raises cattle and does crop production. She sells milk from her cattle so as to sustain her family. She hopes to improve on the quality of the farm and modernize her animal housing as she is determined to become a model farmer in her area.
She is requesting a loan to buy more chemicals for spraying and pay for labor to clear the farm land.

loans.use: to buy more chemicals for spraying and pay for labor to clear the farm land.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is married, currently working with the local government as a nursing officer and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda with her three children. She runs a drugstore in Bundibugyo town to supplement her salary. She started the store from her savings. She has managed to meet her school fee costs for three years with Hofokam school fees loans. Her major challenge is balancing studies, work and supervision for her drugstore.

Carolyne has asked for a loan to pay her school fees for the final year.

loans.use: to pay her school fees for the final year.

loans.name: Dunia

texts.en:
Dunia is a 26-year-old, married woman who has been working as a hairdresser since 2008. In 2011, Dunia moved her business outside of her house to make sure that her customers will be more relaxed and because she needs to develop her business to increase her income.

Dunia is an ambitious lady with a good reputation among her region. She succeeded throughout the years with her professional skills in gaining loyal customers. Today, Dunia is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her salon's decorations and buy beauty cosmetics to satisfy her customers' special needs. 

Dunia is very excited for this loan because she will be able to make her salon comfortable and attractive, which will pamper her customers in a very special way.

loans.use: to renovate her salon's decorations and buy beauty cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Nemesia

texts.es: Doña Maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 5 hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas  sus cuatro hijos mayores le ayudan en el trabajo para tener más producción y asi poder tener mejores ganancias ya que ese es su única fuente de ingresos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima como hilos de sedas de colores por mayor, para aumentar la producción y asi tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 53 years old, lives in a house she owns, with her 5 children. She works making and selling hammocks. Her four oldest children help her with the work to have more production and in this way have more earnings, since it is her only source of income. She is asking for a loan to purchase more raw material such as colored silk thread in bulk, to increase the production and, so, to have more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw material such as colored silk thread in bulk.

loans.name: Deisis Marina

texts.es: Deisis de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 5 hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas  sus dos hijos mayores le ayudan en el trabajo para producir 12 hamacas semanales y asi poder tener mejores ganancias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima como hilos de sedas de colores por mayor, para aumentar la producción y así tener mejores ingresos económicos y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Deisis, 33 years old, lives in a house she owns, with her 5 children. She works making and selling hammocks. Her two oldest children help her with the work to make 12 hammocks each week and, in this way, be able to have more earnings. She is asking for a loan to purchase more raw material such as colored silk thread in bulk to increase her production and, so, to have more income and with her family have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more raw material such as colored silk thread in bulk.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
This is George. He has been busy operating his rice store for 10 years. He is 57 years old and a resident of Intramuros, Manila,Philippines. For his family's  future, he is working with perseverance to run the business well since they get all the income they need to survive from the business

However, it is not always possible to get enough profit from the store. Sometimes it is not sufficient for the family. For this reason he wants to avail of a loan worth 50,000 PHP. With this money, he will be able to add a greater supply of rice to sell. A greater supply of rice would help increase the profit, which would be a great help for the entire household's needs. 

As a diligent father, it is George's dream to have his children finish their schooling and to give his family a better standard of living. This is why he wants to make sure that your help will not be put to waste. 

He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of rice to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of 13 children, Elsie works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store.  Elsie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Lebby

texts.en:
Lebby is 53 years old and married with two children, who both attend school. Lebby works very hard to provide for them.

Lebby runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Lebby has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, canned goods, diapers and other personal care products. 

In the future Lebby would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is a 42-year-old, hardworking, married farmer living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also practices the rearing of goats to earn extra income. He was inspired to start up these businesses by the need to educate his children. He faces a challenge of seasonal changes; however, he has a vision of becoming a modernized farmer.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Yezid

texts.es:
Yesid es un hombre de 34 años de edad, trabaja como independiente en un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar, inicio con un capital muy básico donde ofrecía granos y abarrotes, con el transcurso del tiempo ha ido surtiendo su negocio con otros productos como lácteos, y productos refrigerados, gracias  a la mejora de ingresos la calidad de vida de su familia, sus padres ha ido en crecimiento, viven dignamente.
Yesid quiere seguir mejorando y ahora es tiempo de invertir en su negocio, en el momento se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara pañales y productos de aseo personal y doméstico, este préstamo ayudara a diversificar su oferta al cliente, tendrá mayores ventas, aumentara sus ingresos lo que hará que en su hogar puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Yesid is a 34-year-old man. He works independently in his store which sells basic pantry items. He began with very basic capital where he sold grains and groceries. With the passing of time, he has been stocking his business with other products such as dairy and refrigerated products. Thanks to the increase in income, his family's and his parents' quality of life has been improving. They live with dignity. 

Yesid wants to continue improving and now is time to invest in his business. At the moment he asks for a loan with which he will purchase diapers and personal and domestic cleaning products. This loan will help him to diversify his offerings for his customers. He will have better sales and will increase his income, which will make it possible to live better in his household.

loans.use: to diversify his store's offerings, he will purchase diapers and cleaning products, both domestic and personal.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
É um jovem empreendedor, com muita vontade de trabalhar e progredir, de 32 anos de idade, a viver maritalmente, pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, tem nível básico, vive na casa própria. Foi agricultor por alguns anos onde adquiriu a experiência de lidar com insumos agrícolas e actualmente é dono e gerente de uma loja de venda dos mesmos e conta com ajuda da esposa no mesmo negocio. Esta a repetir o credito pela 5ªvez, com os anteriores investiu sempre no seu negocio e no melhoramento das condições de sua residência, estava numa casa de material precário e agora conseguiu erguer uma casa de material convencional. Tem também um estabelecimento de venda de material de construção. Com o actual financiamento vai investir na compra de insumos, uma vez que esta a entrar o inverno onde a procura é maior.
Pretende comprar: adubos, sementes de feijão, quiabo, couve, cenouras ecebola, para ampliar o seu negocio.
Ele gostaria de poder desenvolver mais o seu negocio , seu maior desafio é o facto de não ter capital suficiente para por em prática os seus projectos e o facto de estar a alugar o estabelecimento que usa.
texts.en:
This young entrepreneur has a great will to work and make progress. He is 32 years old, lives with his wife and is the father of two young boys. He has basic schooling and lives in his own home. He was a farmer for a few years where he acquired experience handling agricultural supplies which he currently sells in the store that he owns and manages with the help of his wife. 

He is about to take out his fifth loan, having used the previous loans to invest in his business and improve his living conditions at home. He lives in a house that is made out of precarious materials and now he is able to build a home out of conventional materials. He also has a premises selling building materials. With this current loan he will purchase supplies once winter begins when the market is better. 

He plans to buy compost and bean, okra, kale, carrot and onion seeds to increase his business. He would like to develop his business further but his greatest challenge is the fact that he doesn't have enough capital to put his projects into practice as well as the fact that he is renting the premises that he uses.

loans.use: to buy compost and bean, okra, kale, carrot and onion seeds to increase his business

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es: Maria de 30 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y ropa tiene más de 4 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria, 30 years old, is a single mother. She lives in a house she owns, with her three children. She has worked selling products from catalogs and clothing for more than 4 years. Her business is located in her home and she also sells as a street vendor in the various neighborhoods. She is asking for a loan to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants. etc., all in bulk, and in this way be able to continue with her work to have better income.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorants, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
With her thirty-two years, Rosalyn has never been so determined as she is today. Eager to raise her two children into success, she has patiently operated her small food stand for eight years now in their community at Intramuros,Manila, Philippines. She is married to Michael, who is also a vendor, and their total income makes a living for the entire household. 

However, their capital for sustaining the business is as stable as expected. Thus, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan that will be used to purchase more ingredients to make the prepared food she sells from food stall. This will provide her with an opportunity to increase her profit. 

She dreams of being successful someday and that is why she is indeed persevering for the benefit of her family. Rosalyn meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Corn crops are abundant in the fields of the Philippines. This is a good alternative for Filipinos when rice is unavailable. So, Lourdes has chosen such to be the object of her business. She has been selling corn for more than 12 years. She is 57 years old and a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. His husband, James Ronald, is helping her hand-in-hand in the business. They are working together to support and equip their household. 

Lourdes buys raw corn on a wholesale basis. She puts corn inside a large pan of hot water to cook it. Every day she pushes her cart and sells each corn for PHP 10 to PHP 15. From this, she earns only an average profit. But it’s not stable since customers vary from time to time. 

Lourdes is asking for a PHP 11,000 loan to buy additional supplies of raw corn for her business. This loan will be enough for her to improve her inventory and her sales also.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of raw corn

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, el mayor ya trabaja los demás son dependientes, le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo, sus padres le enseñaron a cultivar granos básicos, criar ganado y en ocasiones a vender frutas y verduras, actualmente estas actividades son su fuente de ingresos.
Comprará semilla, fertilizantes, abono y pagara obreros para realizar la limpieza del terreno y poder sembrar en el tiempo indicado para tener resultados favorables, su objetivo es tener su negocio activo y también utilizar el zacate que se produce con los cultivos para alimentar su ganado.
Sueña con tener cosechas más abundantes y darle a su linda familia un estilo de vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Paulino lives with his wife and three children. The oldest already works and the rest are dependents. He likes working in the countryside a lot. His parents taught him to grow basic grains, raise livestock, and sometimes to sell fruits and vegetables. Currently, these activities are his source of income.

He will purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure and will pay laborers to clean the land and to be able to plant at the right time to have good results. His objective is to make his business active and also to use the fodder he produces, which are his crops, to feed his livestock.  

He dreams of having more abundant harvests and giving his lovely family a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, manure and pay laborers to clean the land and be able to plant at the right time.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Ella es rosa una imponente mujer de 51 años de edad, ella se separó de su esposo y ningún momento mostro debilidad, por lo contrario acepto lo ocurrido y sin esperar un día busco la manera de generar recursos, gracias a sus conocimientos en confección, con una máquina y un gran sueño de progresar inicio su rumbo y mira lo bello que es la vida, y en día esta mujer cuenta con 5 empleados, más maquinaria, y se proyecta a contratar un mayor número de personas.
Ahora Rosa se encuentra en su auge, quiere progresar, invertir en este momento maravilloso que pasa por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos como hilos y comprar telas para confeccionar prendas propias, es el momento para rosa, tu puedes apoyarla que esperas anímate y préstale.
texts.en:
She is Rosa, an impressive woman, 51 years old. She separated from her husband and at no time showed weakness, to the contrary, she accepted what had happened and without waiting a day, sought out a way to generate income. Thanks to her knowledge of sewing, with a machine and a great dream of progressing, she began her work and look how beautiful life is, these days this woman has 5 employees, more machinery, and plans to contract a larger number of people. 

Now Rosa finds herself at her peak, she wants to progress, invest in this marvelous moment which is happening and, for this, she wants to ask for a loan to purchase supplies such as thread and fabric to make her own clothing. This is the moment for Rosa. You can support her, what are you waiting for? Come on and lend to her!

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies and in addition to begin her own line of clothing for which she primarily needs fabric.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
You're indeed a great blessing to Jinky! She is so much thankful that you have extended your helping hands to her. Because of the previous loan that you lent to her, she ably purchased more items for her ready-to-wear business. She was also able to suffice the household through the income she got. 

She would like to take out a loan worth PHP 25,000 again. She would preferably use this to buy additional quantities of footwear like slippers that she sells. It would really mean a lot to her if you'd allow her request, especially because she wants to save money for better living conditions for her family.

She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional quantities of footwear like the slippers that she sells.

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos, tiene como actividades económicas actuales la plantación guineos y plátanos para vender al mayoreo, el oficio lo heredó de su papá, lo ha practicado desde hace 3 años, a tiempo completo; vive con su esposa de 25 años, solo una persona depende de él.
Necesita comprar abono, fertilizantes e insecticidas para cuidar de las plantas de guineo y plátano, de esta manera evitara que su cultivo se vea afectado por plagas y aumentara su producción, espera poder obtener beneficios con la inversión y salir adelante con su familia.
Los objetivos de Santos son lograr que su situación financiera sea favorable y cancelar su deuda lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Santos has as his current economic activities growing bananas and plantains to sell to the wholesaler, a profession that he inherited from his father. He has done this for the past 3 years, full time. He lives with his 25-year-old wife, only one person depends on him. 

He needs to purchase manure, fertilizer and insecticides to care for the banana and plantain plants. In this way he will prevent his crop from being affected by pests and will increase his production. He hopes to be able to get benefits from the investment and continue onward with his family.

Santos's objectives are to manage to have a more favorable financial situation and pay off his debt as fast as possible.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer and insecticides to care for his banana and plantain plants.

loans.name: Rudy Lisandro

texts.es:
Rudy, considera que su negocio está creciendo y necesita surtir más su inventario, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar jugos, gaseosas, boquitas, pan, galletas, cereales, etc., para cubrir las nuevas demandas, espera que sus clientes continúen visitando su negocio.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior ha incorporado nuevos productos en su tienda, su estilo de vida está cambiando favorablemente, continua viviendo solo y mantiene el apoyo económico a sus familiares.
texts.en:
Rudy considers that his business is growing and he needs to stock more inventory, so he asks for another loan to purchase juices, soft drinks, snacks, bread, cookies, cereals, etc. to meet the new demands. He hopes that his customers will continue visiting his business. 

With the help of the previous loan, he has incorporated new products in his store. His lifestyle is changing favorably; he continues living alone and continues his economic support of his family members.

loans.use: to purchase juices, soft drinks, snacks, bread, cookies, cereals, etc. to meet the new demands.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Intramuros, Manila, Philippines. She is 34 years old and has three children who are currently in school. Rhelan, her husband, works as an operator in the community. She manages a buy-and-sell business, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenses.

What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sells them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can include products like hand soaps, detergents, dish washing liquids and other similar products.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Daisy is requesting a 9,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

She prays that someday their family will prosper and that she'll be able to buy their own house outside their area now. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more products and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Cambitas Group

texts.es:
Elvira es una mujer de 37 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 1, 8 y 14 años de edad, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, amigable, atenta, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ ubicada al sur de la ciudad, sus pobladores son la siguiente generación de los damnificados de un turbión del río en el año 1983. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Elvira es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada en el medio, viste blusa rosa y calza fucsia, lleva un bolsoncito marrón). Su vida la comparte junto a sus hijos, los 2 mayores estudian en la escuela el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la sastrería; que consiste en la confección de prendas de vestir (vestidos, pantalón, blusa) de forma manual y con las medidas exactas, diseñando exclusivamente de acuerdo con las preferencias de sus clientes, “trabajo mayormente con damas, porque me encargan vestidos y todo tipos de confecciones, para varones sólo realizo arreglo de ancho y alto…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina de coser industrial que le permita mejorar la calidad de sus confecciones. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa de confección, ella desea realizar la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para mejorar y aumentar su producción. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Elvira solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial para aumentar su producción y abrir una tienda de ropa de confección.
texts.en:
Elvira is 37, single, and has 3 children, ages 1, 8 and 14. She has a tailoring business. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, friendly, courteous, persevering and very hard working. She carries on her business in the Plan 3000 neighborhood, located in the southen part of the city.

Its inhabitants are the next generation following  those affected by the heavy rains of 1983.  The climate is warm and sub-tropical, with a temperature that varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade

Elvira is strongly-built, low in stature, dark-skinned, with grey eyes and long black hair that she wears pulled back. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which is spoken in this area, and she speaks Spanish for general culture and for her business. She is seated in the middle, wearing a pink blouse and fuchsia tights, carrying a brown purse. She shares life with her children, the 2 eldest of whom attend school; the youngest is not yet school-aged.

They live in their own home, constructed of brick and cement with a sheet metal roof and a cement floor. It has electricity and well water, but is not connected to sewer. 

She has a tailoring business, in which she makes articles of clothing (dresses, pants, blouses), by hand and made to measure, designed exclusively  according to the preferences of her customers, “I work mostly with women, as they order dresses and all kinds of sewing work; for men I only do alterations." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has steady customers, the disadvantage is the lack of an industrial sewing machine which would allow her to improve the quality of her sewing work. 

Her dream is to open a dressmaking shop. She wishes to buy an industrial sewing machine  to improve and increase her output. This is her first loan with the institution, in the 3 years she has been engaged in this business.

This is why Elvira is requesting a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to increase her output and to open a dressmaking shop.

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Mãe de 3 filhos 2 menores a estudarem e 1 maior já a trabalhar, tem 5ª classe, vive à base de negocio de venda de roupas como ambulante, conta com ajuda do esposo trabalhador da Africa do Sul, está a repetir o credito pela segunda vez e com o primeiro investiu na compra de mais artigos do seu negocio.
Pretende comprar: Lençois, Duvés, almofadas, toalhas de mesas, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio que faz como ambulante dentro e fora da vila.
Ela tem o sonho de poder desenvolver mais o seu negocio e futuramente construir um estabelecimento de forma a deixar de ser ambulante.
Diz não ter muitas dificuldades, uma vez que já conseguiu construir sua casa e com bens aceitáveis.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a mother to three children. The two youngest are in Grade 5 at school while the oldest is already working. She makes a living selling clothing as a street vendor and is helped by her husband who is a worker from South Africa. This is the second loan that she has taken out and like the first loan it will be used to buy more articles of clothing for her business. 

She plans to buy sheets, doonas, pillow cases, tablecloths, etc. to increase her business as a street vendor in and outside of her village. Her dream is to be able to further develop her business and in the future build a store so that she can stop peddling on the streets. She says that she won't have many difficulties once she is able to build her house with adequate goods.

loans.use: to buy sheets, doonas, pillow cases, tablecloths, etc.

loans.name: Leonardo Adrian

texts.es:
Él es Leonardo, emprendedor, talentoso, sonriente, una persona echada para adelante que quiere progresar, que busca vivir mejor, no es conformista, tiene presente a su familia y a su hijo de 5 años de edad, se preparó para afrontar la vida aprendiendo del tema de instalaciones eléctricas hace un tiempo decidió que esta sería la profesión que le daría de comer y hoy en día se esfuerza por sacar su negocio a flote, de generar buenas ventas y tener equilibrio.
Trabaja de lunes a sábado, 10 horas diarias, tiene su almacén pero igualmente sale a realizar instalaciones eléctricas, es perseverante y muy pulido en sus trabajos.
Paralelo a su trabajo, tiene un almacén donde vende productos y el cual lo atiende su pareja, vende toda clase de electrodomésticos y artículos para el hogar, la idea es potenciar este negocio por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra de taladros, cafeteras eléctricas, ventiladores, bafles, sanducheras, destornilladores eléctricos entre otra clase de electrodomésticos de uso domésticos.
Con tu apoyo Leonardo podrá tener un almacén surtido y así generar ventas con sus clientes, generara el empleo de su esposa y de seguro en su hogar la calidad de vida aumentara.
texts.en:
This is Leonardo, enterprising, talented, smiling, a person pushing forward who wants to progress, who seeks a better life, is not a conformist, and is present with his family and his 5-year-old son. He prepared himself to face life learning about electronics installation. Some time ago, he decided that this would be the profession that would feed him and today he works hard to keep his business afloat, to generate good sales and have a balance.

He works from Monday to Saturday, 10 hours a day. He has his store but he also goes out to install electronic products. He is persistent and very refined in his work.

Alongside his work, he has a store where he sells products, which his partner watches. He sells all sorts of appliances and things for the home. The idea is to strengthen this business, so he asks for a loan to purchase drills, electric coffee pots, fans, acoustic boxes, sandwich toasters, electric screwdrivers, and other sorts of household appliances. 

With your support, Leonardo will be able to have a stocked store and, so, generate sales with his customers. He will generate his wife's job and the security of his household, and his quality of life will increase.

loans.use: to purchase drills, electric coffee pots, fans, acoustic boxes, sandwich toasters, electric screwdrivers, and other sorts of household appliances.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 20-year-old single man who started working as a cashier in a company almost two years ago to cover his needs and expenses. Besides his job, he is still continuing his studies. Hani is an independent man who is working hard to improve his living conditions and build a better future. 

Today, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay his university tuition fees. He also wants to pay for his driving license. Hani hopes to finish his studies and open his own business in the future to stay capable of satisfying his needs.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees and to pay for his driving license

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, adicional a eso también vende calzado, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a ese trabajo, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra zapatos para damas, caballeros y niños por mayor para poder continuar con su trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Maribel, who is 49 years old, lives in her own house with her family group. She makes and sells tortillas. In addition to this, she also sells footwear. She has been doing this work for 6 years.  Her business is located near her place of residence, and she has many customers. She is applying for a loan to purchase women's, men's, and children's shoes wholesale in order to be able to continue with her work and thus be able to have better income in order to have a better quality of life along with her family.

loans.use: to buy women's, men's, and children's shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
This woman’s name is Alina and she lives in the village Agarak of Lori region. She graduated Yerevan State Linguistic University the faculty of Russian Language and Literature. She works of her specialty already 36 years at the same school that she graduated many years ago. Alina is very intelligent and patient pedagogue and her pupils really enjoy their each lesson with Alina. She also has a group pupils whom at her house she gives courses of Russian Language and Literature preparing them for their entrance examinations.  

Alina is married and she has two daughters and a son. All of them are married and they live with their families. Alina’s husband is unemployed. 

Alina asks this Kiva loan as she wants to furnish the room where she is having her courses, as she wants to make it more comfortable for her pupils; she will buy a big table and enough chairs for her pupils.

loans.use: to furnish the room where she is having her courses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling to raise school fees for the six children attending school.

loans.name: Bazirio

texts.en:
Bazirio who is married with 4 children is a resident of Hoima Uganda.He is charged with the responsibility of providing them with all the basic needs and two attend school. He deals in cattle keeping supplemented by farming to earn an extra income. 

He is seeking for a loan to buy more cows for rearing. He has hopes of developing and expanding his business if it was not the threat of diseases that affect his cattle.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing to develop and expand his business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses a father of 2 children is a married man aged twenty eight living in Hoima-Uganda. His business is selling shoes and clothes. Due to the need to raise income to support his family, Moses got involved in business and has been able to reap tangible benefits. 

Despite his progress, he faces difficulties of inadequate capital on top of changes in tastes and preferences of his customers. Moses has asked for a loan to buy more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher is 28 years old and he happily lives with his parents in Ijevan city of Tavush region. Mher’s father is very famous and skilled constructor and Mher from his childhood just dreamed of being like his father. Now he greatly helps his father in house repairing activities and he also learnt how to make different pieces from gypsum that are used for house decoration works. 

Mher is also good in farming especially in swine breeding, and he has not small farm. Here he takes care of a lot of pigs and piglet and chickens. He also has several bee families. Mher is very clever and prosperous farmer as he very skillfully sells his farm goods such as meat (he sells it to city butchers), eggs and honey. Mher is very honest and clever young man all the customers who usually buy his farm products like to cooperate with him, especially the group of butchers who give a lot of orders of meat sale to him. 

This loan Mher will use for the purchase of two pigs and also enough fodder for all his farm pigs.

loans.use: for the purchase of two pigs and also enough fodder for all his farm pigs

loans.name: Luis Ramiro

texts.es:
Luis es de esas personas que aman incondicionalmente a su familia, de esos hombres que se sacan el bocado de alimento de su boca si es necesario para alimentar a sus hijos, siempre los tiene presente, renuncio a su trabajo para estar cerca de ellos, junto a él, está un mural con la foto de ellos, son lo mejor que le han pasado y orgullosamente los mantiene ejerciendo su profesión como vendedor de comidas rápidas. 
La principal ventaja es que está cerca de ellos, junto con su esposa generan los recursos necesarios para vivir y tener una buena calidad de vida.
Luis trabaja principalmente los fines de semana, en semana se dedica a buscar otros trabajos, no se puede quedar quieto, le gusta trabajar y sentirse útil.
Su principal sueño es tener un restaurante, un hogar propio, un vehículo para viajar.
Luis quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar insumos para su puesto de alimentos, comprara servillas, cubiertos y platos desechables, carne, salchichas, panes, ensalada, gaseosa, papas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Luis is one of these people who unconditionally loves his family, one of these men who takes the morsel of food out of his mouth if it is needed to feed his children. He is always there, he left his job to be near them. With him is a mural of photos of them. They are the best thing that has happened to him and he proudly supports them with his profession as a fast food salesman. 

The primary advantage is that it is near them, along with his wife, they generate the resources they need to live and to have a good quality of life.

Luis works primarily on the weekends. During the week he dedicates himself to looking for other work. He can't remain still, he likes to work and feel useful. His principal dream is to have a restaurant, his own house, and a vehicle to travel. 

Luis wants to ask for a loan to purchase supplies for his food stand. He will purchase disposable napkins, silverware, and plates, meat, sausages, bread, salad, soft drinks, potatoes, and more.

loans.use: to purchase disposable napkins, silverware and plates, meat, sausages, bread, salad, soft drinks, potatoes, and more, to stock his business.

loans.name: Kwa Mbonde Group

texts.en:
Kassimu who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children, one of them is in school and the other one is still small.  He has been running a general store for five years now.  He works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kassimu's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to restock the out of stock items in the general store and has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan to increase  on the shop inventory and meet his customers' demand.  He dreams of taking care of his family.

Kassimu will share this loan with his loan group Kwa Mbonde which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase  on the shop inventory and meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Don Salvador de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica a la venta de medicina popular desde hace 30 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y ya tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Don Salvador está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas medicina popular por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor estabilidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Salvador is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and daughter.  He has worked selling popular medicine for 30 years.  His business is located in his home and he already has many customers due to the quality of his products and good prices.  Salvador is requesting a loan to purchase more common medicine wholesale since this is his only source of work and will allow him to have a better income and more stability in life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase more common medicine wholesale.

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda is 49 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom is in school.

Berlinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Berlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Berlinda has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed eleven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Berlinda would like to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson  is a married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a retailer and at the same time a farmer growing cocoa that adds more income. He is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital that hinders progress of his business. However, he hopes to build a permanent house for his family. Jackson has asked for a loan to add stocks of sugar, washing soap, cooking oil, and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to add stocks of sugar, washing soap, cooking oil, and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Noviantika

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Noviantika. Noviantika lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) south of the national capital, Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her five children. Noviantika owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services to her community.
